Reviews.Title: “so far....badddddddd”
Reviews.Author: partsqn
Reviews.Content: so we check in a couple hours ago....we get to the room and keys dont work....call down and front desk brings us new keys. new she says matter of fact..oh we did nit have any doubles left like you booked so we put you in a suite, one double bed and a pull out.....not cooll and not what i reserved. so room is hot we crank air and go for a walk... we come back and room is 81 frickin degrees... i call down they say we can open windows and they will bring up fans..are you fricken kidding me... my total bad. I had seen others have air issues when I checked reviews but thought they would be fixed. they are not getting it fixed!!! DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT THE PRICE........

Reviews.Title: “Fine except for a/c on the fritz”
Reviews.Author: L Z
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating staff. Great breakfast, great location. Only complaint is that the a/c was not working and the room was 80 degrees (according to the thermostat) even though outside it was in the sixties. The floor we were on was too close to street level to make opening the windows an option due to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: cruiser1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March of 2011. I like it so much I stayed again in March 2012. Both times I used it for their park and cruise package. Last year it was fantastic how everything worked. I liked that my car was in a parking garage.The room was both times was nice. The hotel is in walking distance to the Inner Harbor. The hotel started using taxis this year to drive people to the port instead of a private limo service. You are given a voucher to give the driver. The problem came when I needed to be picked up from the port. I waited over an hour for a taxi that never showed up. I begged a taxi to drive me back to the hotel. This taxi driver said that they hate to take voucher fares. This taxi company didn't even know where the Port of Baltimore was when I called.

Reviews.Title: “Hot!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachin2011
Reviews.Content: It was cooler outside than in our room. We had to call twice to have them bring us fans because it was soooo hot! They never offered another room which would have been nice. The managers reception was very nice. Two different beers and two different wines, along with lots of fruits, veggies, and snacky foods. Location is nice, close to the harbor. It could use some updating but even without updating if the room was a comfortable temperature I would give it a great rating. It was also very warm in the lobby and there is no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: anotherswords
Reviews.Content: I got a groupon deal for this stay, and was so pleasantly surprised! If they made even a few cosmetic changes, this place really would be top notch. It's location could not have been better!

Reviews.Title: “family fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: brian w
Reviews.Content: Like to first start off by saying all the hoteal staff did a wonderful job showing my family and i a great hotel stay,we had valet parking which was really nice bieng in downtown Balt. Welcome party was a nice touch for people to meet and ask questions.Morning breakfast was also nice didnt have to go out for a good morning breakfast.And hotel is close to all downtown activies.A plus stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two kids age 14 and 12 stayed 4/6/12 to 4/8/12 and it was the best experience we encountered.Very nice people, clean rooms, service AAAAAAAA+++++++AND LONG HOT WATER FOR SHOWERS !YOU WANT A GOOD PLACE TO STAY LOOK NO MORE THIS IS IT!We are going back end of june for another getaway Thanks for reading Tom B From PA

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: emily y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Baltimore for the Orioles opening day. When I called the Brookshire to inquire about the best rate available, I was told about the manager's special which included free valet parking. We have stayed at the Brookshire many times over the years, with and without children, and we have never been disappointed. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and the location is ideal. Charles and Emily Goldsboro, NC

Reviews.Title: “No A/C, Good Location & Price - 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Marc19002
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night over the past weekend for a gathering of friends in Baltimore. Pluses - Location is about 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor area. The price we paid was excellent for the area at $136 plus tax. The room was somewhat large with a bedroom separated from the other area by a door. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean with two large screen flat TV's Negatives - There was no air conditioning as some of the over reviews mentioned. Even though our stay was in early April and the outside temperature went into the 40's at night, the room was warm and muggy. Opening the two small windows in the bedroom and outer room helped, but then you got the street noise. The TV channel lineup was OK at best. The bathroom was small but adequate. The valet parking....you need to drive into a alley behind the hotel. If this was at night, no way would I have done this but during the day with several other friends it was OK. My suggestion is to just park it across the street where the valet is going to park it anyway. Overall - very good value. If you are going in the winter when you don't need A/C or the summer when the A/C is on, I would recommend this hotel. In the Spring and Fall I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Fuathas
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at this hotel! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. David, served breakfast with a smile in the morning and had the same smile on while serving during happy hour! He even went out of his way to make sure our kids knew about the collecting coins from the staff so they could get a toy out of the toy box. The breakfast was great, food was abundant and delicious. Happy Hour was amazing, far more than we expected. They had free drinks, fruit, cheese,crackers, dips, veggie tray, chips, salsa, and a complete Caesar Salad. Ian, our friend at the front desk was polite, extremely helpful and friendly....the whole staff was awesome! The rooms are clean, a little worn, but the staff makes up for the out-dated rugs and furniture. We stayed in a suite, with a Queen Bed and pull out sofa for the kids. The door can be closed between the sitting area and the bedroom. There are two TV's, a sink, microwave, and refrigerator. Only one block from the water and a short walk to the Aquarium, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “crusie and stay apr 11”
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise last year in April in a king suite. Wonderful staff, great room and enjoyed the Harbor so much were coming back in July this year for a weekend of baseball for our 3 year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Surval
Reviews.Content: Hey, it was a good price and clean. The room was super small but the bed was comfortable. OK for the price.

Reviews.Title: “WORST... don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: iogato
Reviews.Content: The cost was so much more than it was worth. The rooms are so small you will feel claustrophobic. No air conditioning so I had to sleep with window open which because of the busy street was so loud. NO WIFI!!! Only a ethernet cord that is in one spot of the hotel room (the desk) so you will not be able to roam throughout the room (even though you can reach almost every spot from your bed) with your laptop. Hallways smelled like smoke. I switched rooms three times (which I have never done before) and I ended up checking out early and staying at the Camden Yards Marriott which was fabulous! I spoke to someone else who also checked out and stayed at the Renaissance next door but that was a little too pricey for me (although I ate there and it was fabulous). I will not stay there again and cannot understand how the experience could have been enjoyed. I do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: Elise G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were on a road trip and wanted to visit Baltimore for the day. If you are looking to do something on a budget that's near many of the city's attractions, this is the place to go. However, their parking was considerably more expensive than the 2 parking garages right next to the hotel. They charge $29 plus tax while the garage we parked in had a max of $20. When we went to check in, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room ended up having two full beds instead of 1 queen or king, but since we were there just for the night and the beds were big enough, we didn't say anything. The beds were also really, really comfortable! Unfortunately, there is no wi-fi, but they do have an ethernet cable in the room. Overall, the stay was pretty good, but for more than a couple nights, I probably would have upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Best Local Business Hotel in Town”
Reviews.Author: Frankie1122
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough on how friendly and accommodating the staff was. Great location to the inner harbor, just 1-2 blocks away from all the action, Suite was nice having a separate bedroom and living room area with kitchenet. The Clouds in the top of the hotel (Nice to see the Harbor) have Nice comp. breakfast with eggs, homemade waffles, juice, coffee, tea and Fruits. Overall a great value hotel with a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY FOR THE PRICE!”
Reviews.Author: JLuisP
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my girfriend through a deal we bought through Living Social. It wasnt' the best stay but it wasn't the wost either. The pros of the hotel is the great customer service! The AC was not turned on and it was very hot in our hotel room, but they did send a fan up to our room which helped out for the most part, AC would have been better. Another pro is how close it is to the Inner Harbor, 1 block away you cant beat that! Also the free breakfast in the morning at the Cloud Club is great! Cons of the hotel would be no AC was on at the time, hopefully that has changed. Another big con was the noise level from the city at night, you can hear everything from sirens to people yelling. Woke up several times in the middle of the night. There is plenty to do around Baltimore so if your looking for nice place at an affordable price this would be it. We were never in the room during the day, so I dididnt mind all the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: leightly
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend using a "Living Social" package deal. We had requested a room with two queen beds, but got one. Good thing we're close friends! The breakfast was nice, and changed daily. The area it was served in (The Cloud Room) was very pleasant. The hotel offers free wine, beer and hors d'oeuvres on weeknights and the spread was quite nice. David works the Cloud Room and is AMAZINGLY helpful - offers restaurant recommendations, remembers details of things you may have said the day before - very attentive and kind. The bed was extremely comfortable, the linens nice, the room appropriately sized and clean. It was noisy on the 6th floor, but we wanted the windows open (nice to stay someplace where opening the windows is an option!).

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravel711
Reviews.Content: It was 75 degrees in baltimore and the Hotel doesnt have AC in the colder months. Archaic as it may sound they were serious. They do however advertise AC on the room features page on their site. The manager Andrea was elpful and down right rude. She thought I was ridiculous for expecting it. Ileft the Hotel after I had unpacked and valet parked the car and put pajamas on my kids who were sweating bullets as they like to say and went to Hilton...guess what they had AC. IMAGINE that.

Reviews.Title: “Good at discounted rates”
Reviews.Author: iamrennie
Reviews.Content: Clean & modern atmosphere. Not pretentious. Standard size room was very spacious & comfortable. Bed was soft (maybe too soft for some). Air conditioner was poor, though functional enough for an early springtime visit. Street noise was heard too well through our 3rd floor windows, but quiet enough at night. We did not use their "vallet parking", as the "parking area" was merely a small tunnel hardly wide enough for two cars. Also adjacent to some barren dark alleys. Complimentary drinks in the evening. Complimentary breakfast was fair/normal hotel fare. We got a discounted rate, so I suppose it was acceptable as 'value'. For the normal price I would recommend many other hotels in the area before this one. Location isn't everything on this one. Plenty of other places to stay in walking distance, and with a safer feel to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top lounge”
Reviews.Author: Porch99
Reviews.Content: Ask David that works in the top lounge for advice on foodplaces around Baltimore he gives excellent advice. Thank you David you made the stay much better.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent... but”
Reviews.Author: DrGuitar
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty poorly maintained. The toilet did not flush properly, the sink did not drain properly, the remote for the sitting room TV did not turn it on or off, the shower curtain rod was coming off the wall and there was some mold on the ceiling above the toilet. In addition, the furniture in the room was in fair to poor condition (the desk was badly banged up and the sofa cushions did not fit the sofa. Only one thing kept me from giving this hotel a poor rating, the service was very good. The parking attendant was upbeat and friendly and the woman at the main desk was also friendly and helpful. But the biggest reason for the great service was the concierge David. He was extremely friendly and helpful. He knew of great places to eat and was a joy to interact with. Honestly, David (the concierge) made us feel so at home, that we would consider coming back to this hotel despite the very poorly maintained room and bathroom. If the hotel could get it's maintenance together, it would have gotten an excellent rating from me. The hotel is in a great location (one block from the Inner Harbor), they serve a nice breakfast and a happy hour drink (free). And the service (especially from the concierge) was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell....”
Reviews.Author: ParanoidAndr0id
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this weekend with my boyfriend and booked through living social/groupon. I bought this as a valentines day get away thinking that it would be a nice romantic little getaway. I should have known from the minute I walked into that old run down elevator things would only get worse from there! Upon getting to the hotel I thought how nice the lobby looked, and the use of colors were pretty cool... However, by the time we both arrived to our floor I started to notice things weren't right. The ceiling was so low that my boyfriend almost had to duck down, I thought that I had entered a land for short people, as I am only 5'3" and I couldn't help but chuckle at first. When we opened the door I found to my horror that the "Suite" I had upgraded to for an extra fee (which wasn't a huge deal to begin with) was run down, dark and depressing with little light, and down right disgusting and unclean. The walls were beat up, the carpets smelled funny and had stains, and I kid you not... had water damage EVERYWHERE. The bathroom was even worse, as they had cut one of the vents in half to fit in the bathroom, put a hole in the wall to fit the shower head, and just small and stuffy! I was horrified and a bit embarrassed that I had taken my boyfriend to this dump! I've stayed in motel 6's nicer than this place! To top it off, the service of this place was just as horrible, it took us 3 hours to get our bags from the valet, and the lady at the front desk seemed drunk in the morning. Please save yourselves from this horrible place!

Reviews.Title: “Once a parking garage... But always a dump”
Reviews.Author: 1stdue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for a one night get away. The bellhop took 2 hours to bring our bags to the room and only after 2 calls to the front desk... And speaking of the room: ceilings were very low, the wallpaper was water damaged and peeling and the carpets faded and nasty. We turned on the tv only to find 22 available channels. The view we were promised on the phone turned out to be an abandoned brick building... The next morning I went to take a shower in the poor excuse for a bathroom only to find that the shower head came up to the base of my neck on my 5' 11" frame... Not only that but the ceiling in the shower stall was even lower! I would never stay here again, my girlfriend and I are now sick because of this place. This place should be condemed or turned back into a parking garage and the people that work there sent to a customer service class...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5-night stay!”
Reviews.Author: dianne136
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a 5-night stay at the Brookshire and it was great! We had booked using a Groupon deal and we chose a 1-bedroom suite, which is exactly what we were given. Our room was on the 9th floor and it was a corner unit facing the Inner Harbor - gorgeous view! Yes, the furniture/decor is older and needs replacing at some point, but the room was very clean and perfect for what we needed. EVERY EMPLOYEE we encountered was smiling and pleasant!!! When we returned in the evening, the person at the front desk would say "Welcome back!". The valet parking was fast - no problems. The breakfast buffet that is included is plentiful and everything seemed fresh. Though we only made it to one evening's manager's reception, it was a very nice amenity. Beer and wine were offered along with a decent selection of snacks to go along with your drink - a nice perk! Unfortunately, during our stay my step-daughter and I became ill and were in the hotel room for the better part of 2 days - despite this, I found the suite to be very comfortable and loved the fact that you could open the windows to allow fresh air in. We made a few requests at check-in and during our stay and none of them were a problem! You CANNOT beat the location of this hotel - ONE BLOCK up from the Inner Harbor - we walked there, to Power Plant Live, Little Italy, Camden Yards, Federal Hill etc etc, We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: tgrkew
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to extend our stay in Baltimore when we booked a B&B for Fri nite where there was no availability on Sat nite. The hotel was a great value for the location and the refrigerator and microwave were a nice bonus. The location is great. Easy walk to Inner Harbor. The buffet breakfast at Cloud Club was very good with eggs, breakfast meat and waffles. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Use the valet parking--if you use other area garages you will end up spending more because of the way they charge their days. The valet parking was very convenient and it is quick and easy to get your car if you need it. Would visit again for Inner Harbor visit.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed wkn in Balt.”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel just off the inner harbor. Staff(Micheal,Ian,Angela?) worked very hard to keep everyone happy. Give said staff more than a gold coin, alittle bonus for them would be nice. One comment, pls fix the manhole cover on the street out front. It bangs whenever hit by a car!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lost It's Glamour”
Reviews.Author: Nate M
Reviews.Content: Prior to this weekend we last stayed at hotel in Sept 2005 on my wedding night before leaving for our honeymoon the next morning. The hotel was grand then, and under the same management as 4 other upscale hotels. My wife planned a surprise get a way weekend for us at the Brookshire so I was greatly disappointed when we checked into our room and found it not to be a suite. The hotel needs a cosmetic make-over, and the 2 rooms we stayed in were physically unattractive. The rooms need painting, modern furniture, and some plumbing work. Breakfast is good, and the staff is nice & cooperative. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short getaway”
Reviews.Author: jaytam
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. We enjoyed the location and the employees were all very helpful and friendly. There were no issues with early check-in, which is always good. If I had to give a negative, it would be the valet parking. It took quite sometime for us to get our vehicle when we drove to an appointment. But in defense of the new valet guy, it was a Friday and rush hour traffic was horrible... even with the vehicle being less than two blocks away. We will definitely visit this location again. It was close to many restaurants and tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quaint and very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Mark2280
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good value. Room size is fine, but very small bathrooms. Ian was very helpful at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Social Living deal”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: We beleive this hotel has a number of lesser quality rooms reserved for "special deals" like living social. The room was of poor quality. Pipes were bare in the bathroom, the drapes were visibly stained, and the thermostat seemed not to work in the heating register, causing the room to be either hot or cold, but not regulated for in-between. The ceiling near the door and the door itself were 6' high. This was true for the room adjoining ours, also a "Living Social" deal. I can't imagine what a very tall person would do! We can't imagine that this hotel would ever rent this room at full price. The breakfast was marginal at best. They would be much better served by dropping the "hot" part and just giving a true continental breakfast. Cold Hash Browns, sandwich ham slices, premade pancakes and one barely functioning waffle iron does not a HOT breakfast make. There were a few nice ammenities including a nice Happy Hour layout and a plesant staff. These of course, were offered in general for the regular guest. There are no other facilities at this hotel (i.e. pool, game room), so these are what they have to offer. Very poor for children. This offer is a discounted product at a discounted Social Living price. It could never be confused with a regular priced product at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “And a good time was had by all!!”
Reviews.Author: LynneChildress
Reviews.Content: We bought a Living Social deal for the Brookshire Suites that gave us a good room rate, free valet parking, breakfast, and a credit to a nearby restaurant. The only downside was the hold time when you call the hotel. Once I got there, I saw that they seem to be busy, so the people who work there are doing the best that they can with who they have. I first tried to get a room for this past Saturday, but they were sold out, and I was put on a waiting list. I kept calling, and everyone was really, really nice and professional, but again, I was left waiting on the phone for a very long time. The good thing, though, was that there were cancellations last minute and we got a room on the day we wanted. The place where you pull your car to valet is a little cramped, but our car was taken care of. But everyone was so, so nice, from the front desk staff, to the valets, to the cleaning people. EVERYONE. Our room was nice and spacious, and really, really clean. The front desk called us a cab to our destination for dinner and they were prompt. The room was really comfortable and the bed was great! Breakfast was more than what I was expecting, and the mood of everyone there was relaxed, so people seemed to have all been in a good mood. The food was delicious, and once again, the front desk staff and valets were really efficient and pleasant. They also even have activities for kids with a treasure box that you ask for gold coins from to redeem for a prize. Really thoughtful place, a block from Harborplace, and near everything. I would definitely recommend. Even the regular prices are much better than a lot of the other hotels downtown, and it's worth it. Really enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “The best part was the customer service”
Reviews.Author: pattigrace1028
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived on a Friday evening for an alumni event at my alma mater. When we attempted to check in, they did not have our reservation (I had booked through hotels.com and apparently there had been a snag on their end with the confirmation of my reservation). The staff were laid back and extremely helpful. We ended up just taking a room they still had open. The staff member we dealt with gave us a rate that was substantially less than the rate we had booked at, and we ended up with a lovely King Suite for perhaps less than it would have cost to secure a standard room on a typical weekend! There were some signs of wear in the room, the wallpaper had minor tears here and there, but nothing that made the room feel unclean. The breakfast in the cloud club was a very nice spread, we made sure to (over)indulge both mornings. The bed and pillows were sooo comfortable! The staff were all extremely sweet, never too busy to answer a question or help out. I even left my cell phone charger there and returned four hours after checking out. One of the ladies from housekeeping ran it down within minutes. Overall, i'd love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay on a warm day in January”
Reviews.Author: Wett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend a day in Fells Point and had the perfect opportunity January 7th when it was in the 60's. We knew we'd need a place to crash afterward and we found the Brookshire Suites. Our stay was nice and the staff was very helpful and friendly. At only a block off of inner harbor we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location bad rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Joshiep123
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the day before my wedding to be close to my reception hall, big mistake. The sky lounge was a joke. The rooms where outdated and not cheap. But my biggest problem was my ac was broke and it wasent getting fixed while I was there. I was soaked in sweat by the time I left my room on my wedding day. I'm a good sport but for the money they charge it's not even close to worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but older Hotel with convenient location and GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: WordlyWannabe
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Brookshire Suites in Baltimore. We have gone to Baltimore several times, staying in a variety of suite type hotel locations along the Harbor front. This hotel has a great location just a block from the center of everything! It’s a short walk to the Maryland Science Center, historic ships, shopping, the National Aquarium, the Power Plant and Power Plant LIVE and Port Discovery Museum. Check-in went very smoothly with greetings and instructions from very friendly staff, from the valet to the front desk. They took the time to welcome my son personally, and begin him on a quest for gold "coins" that he can collect during his stay to earn a prize from the treasure box in the lobby. He loved this. This is an older hotel and the architecture is sort of bland, with a small but well-decorated lobby and narrow hallways. We had an executive double suite with wet bar and living room area and bedroom with 2 beds. Our space was very long and narrow, split in half for the 2 rooms. The decor is very old and mismatched, with some damaged furniture and decor in our living room. A very dirty air vent needed a good vacuum brush tool. The bathroom was functional but small. The hot water is the hottest I have ever felt, and plenty of it. We had plenty of towels but given only one washcloth and two hand towels for 4 people? The bedding was gorgeous, however, with bolster pillows and tons of regular pillows. The windows actually have small sections that open to give fresh air. There were 2 flat panel TVs, one in each room that both carried enough channels to keep us all happy. Due to the narrowness of the room, there is no seating in the bedroom and only a couch in the living area. However, there was ample closet space, two huge closets to store our luggage and clothing. The sound in our room was minimal, despite being street side. We also heard no other occupants through the walls, only maybe an occasional door slam when we were in the living room area. Our beds were very soft and we slept great. They have a top floor called the Cloud Club, which is a 180 degree view of the city from a nice height. It is a lounge, TV watching area where breakfast is also served each day. There is free WIFI up there, and in the lobby and wired internet for free in your room. Each morning, we rode to Cloud Club and partook of the free breakfast, which consisted of all the typical continental items plus a waffle station and 2-3 hot items, like eggs, sausage, sausage gravy, potatoes, omelet’s. Great coffee. Giovanni was quite efficient keeping the tables clean and items restocked as guests cycled through. There was a microwave here and table wear and cutlery are left out, so we chose another night to sit up here and eat dinner, leftovers from a restaurant the night before. Adjacent was a small weight and exercise room. The staff is very friendly at this hotel. They also seem to work very hard, filling multiple roles. You would see the same staff at 8am that you saw at 6pm the night before and wondered if they ever got to go home! We called for more towels and who appears but Meredith, the nice lady who checked us in! Ian was also very friendly and willing to answer questions. The valets and bell captains were very nice, especially considering all the parking is off-site and every time you want your car, they have quite a walk to go get it! Even the maintenance man was friendly and gave my son a “gold coin” towards his treasure chest prize. The coin game encourages guests to notice and interact with the staff! What better way to ensure the staff are interactive and friendly. The lobby gets a bit crazy in the mid morning time with groups checking out, but all was managed well. The hotel is pet friendly, as we saw several small dogs in the lobby and on the elevator. However, we never heard any of them! Please be aware that Baltimore is a city and does have a homeless population, which tends to frequent the tourist areas, including the alleys around this hotel and the harbor area. We did see some beggars and people sleeping as we walked around this area, but there was also a police presence, both on bikes and in vehicles. While one should be aware of their safety, one should not assume that this hotel is in a bad neighborhood just because I mention this. As noted, the location of this hotel is very ideal. It is close to the stadiums, the convention center, the harbor, area restaurants (try the Cheapside Wharf restaurant on Water Street directly behind hotel for a great, inexpensive breakfast or lunch) and even a CVS drug store on the block. It was nice having so much within walking distance. For the price we paid ($99 Groupon rate, with free valet parking ($29 value) and nearby restaurant gift certificate ($25 value) this was a steal, even in the off-season. In the summer months, we would expect to pay $250-300 for the room we had, per night. The value of being close enough to the Harbor to walk to everything, without needing to move your car, get a taxi or water taxi was quite valuable to us, as these are quite expensive in this area. The owners of this hotel just need to reward their exceptional staff and do a little bit of updating in the living rooms with décor and furnishings to make this gem shine even brighter.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed there in January 2012, on a cold Baltimore weekend”
Reviews.Author: BenGlassLaw
Reviews.Content: the trip was given to us by our older children.. it was a groupon deal.. we were very pleasantly surprised.. the property is older but nice....very good value... the included breakfast is in a very nice room and the food was good.. you are within walking distance to everything in the inner harbor. We would go again,

Reviews.Title: “near inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: proofforu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, not too big. Very clean rooms, nice fluffy towels, new carpeting and hallway furniture appears to be recently updated. Near the inner harbor area. Nice breakfast and cocktail hour in the Cloud Lounge on the 12th floor with a view of the harbor. The breakfast was complete with an entree and coffee and juices, fruit and cereal or baked goods and freshly made waffles. The cocktail hour included wine, beer, juices, and cheeses and dip, chips and fresh vegetables and salad. Valet parking only but the hotel is within walking distance of many attractions including the aquarium, science museum, Washington monument, many museums, the Basilica of the National Shrine, Little Italy and many shopping areas and restaurants. The staff were very helpful especially about places to dine. Comfortable shoes are recommended for walking around the harbor and there are walking tours. The visitor center is at the inner harbor.Would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suites, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: OlsenkdNY
Reviews.Content: I recently used a Groupon deal to stay at Brookshire Suites ($99 for one night stay in a queen suite with free valet and $25 restaurant gift card!) Here are some of my pros and cons. Pros: This was my first stay in Baltimore and I was surely impressed at how convenient the hotel was. Right in the middle of the inner harbor, we never moved our car! Our room was very spacious and clean (Queen suite 1106). In it we received complimentary coffee and waters, had a very comfortable bed, and 2 large sized TVs. The Cloud Club had an impressive view of the harbor and a delicious breakfast spread. Although we arrived early and our original room wasn't ready, the staff were very accommodating and even upgraded us to a larger corner room! I was very impressed. Cons: The bathroom seemed a little small and tight for such a large suite. Our room faced the harbor and street (which suited me fine) BUT, if you're not used to traffic, I'd HIGHLY suggest getting a room on the other side of the building, there's a lot of street noise. FInally this may seem like a small complaint but the TV remotes were annoyingly difficult. It seemed that the buttons pressed didn't register with the TVs at least half the time. Not a huge deal but definitely annoying. Finally the valet parking area is a pretty narrow and seems to fill up quickly which may leave you waiting a bit. Overall I was very surprised and impressed with the quality of my stay. Using a coupon I thought the hotel would be lacking in comfort but I was surely mistaken. I would definitely recommend this hotel (esp. room 1106) to a fellow traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Persnicketypeople
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. We enjoyed the evening amenties including the delicious salad, fruit, cheese/ crackers and drink while sitting in the lounge overlooking the inner harbor. Our room was lovely and spacious. The attention to details in the room made our evening quite nice- especially the soft fluffy towels, and deluxe bedding. Everything worked well including the coffee maker. We were able to adjust the temperature in the room with the thermostat. The breakfast was very nice with a good variety of offerings. Although I would suggest having eggs available more often for those of us on low carb/low sugar dietary programs. Ian at the front desk was very helpful. We were able to borrow an umbrella to go out with after I had forgotten mine, and every staff member was polite and gracious throughout our stay. We can highly recommend this hotel to any traveler. Thank you Brrokshire Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Good things but starting to get worried.”
Reviews.Author: IrishNorthEast
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the fourth floor corner suite with our dog and didn't have any real problems, but the overall quality of the hotel has gone down hill since I was there about a year ago. The valet parking is a little hard to get to, it is in the alley way off the side of the hotel, but I only had to do one lap around the block to figure it out. Check-in went smoothly and the front desk was very professional and friendly. The hallways looked very clean and did not have any odors. When we walked into the room though I got a little concerned as there were quite a few stains on the carpet. The room did not smell like animal so I guess they were cleaned as well as they could be. The living room was huge and there was a working thermostat, the windows did open, a mini fridge, a microwave, a coffee pot and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was small, but then, I'd rather have a big room. The bedroom had a working thermostat and a huge, comfy bed; not one of those hard, horrid hotel beds. There is sign of wear throughout the rooms. The curtains were worn at the edges, there were dings on the counter in the bathroom and the kitchen, but overall, a great deal for the value. It is in the heart of everything, the staff can get you to where you want to go with no issues. I am disappointed there was no bar, restaurant or room service. Breakfast was included and left a lot to be desired, very tasteless overall, but the coffee was great. The hotel has separated from their parent chain, so some of the frills are no longer there, like the bathrobes, and special packages, but hopefully things will improve from here. FYI, we did not stay with any kids, but the staff was great to the dog and very engaging with all the children there. The only things that could have been looked at negatively is the fact they seemed to be having trouble with the cable and they only had one corkscrew in the hotel, but they did offer to open as many bottles of wine as I wanted, so that issue was solved.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Value on the Inner Harbor...”
Reviews.Author: RedFlags
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our weekend in Baltimore and we had a great time. The Brookshire Suites lived up to all expectations. While it was not an ultra-Lux 5 star resort, it was a nice place with excellent customer service! Pros -Very Nice beds -GREAT Area -Nice Happy Hour with free drinks and snacks -Easy Check in/out -Great Customer Service -Proximity To Great Nightlife Cons -Dated Decor -Expensive Parking -Warm Room Advice -Park in the garage across the street - Much Cheaper than Valet -Hit the aquarium -Try to find good rates on Online sites All in all, a great place, and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fundamental Service Failures”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy8421
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brookshire Suites New Year's Eve 2012 (December 31, 2011 to January 1, 2012) and I have to say I am shocked at how many positive reviews there are for this hotel. While there were some good things about our experience, the hotel failed to provide three fundamental necessities that a guest expects when staying at ANY hotel that is not a discount motel/dump. Those three fundamental failures were the following: *THE TOILET DIDN'T WORK. SERIOUSLY. It never fully flushed, not once. Since we went out almost immediately after arriving at the hotel, we didn't really take notice until the next morning, when it became VERY necessary for us to have a working toilet. Because it didn't work, and we needed to check out in a couple hours anyway, it wasn't worth it for us to call down to the desk to have someone come up and fix it. Instead, we were forced to high-tail it out of there. *This is the most eggregious: WE DID NOT HAVE CONTROL OVER THE TEMPERATURE OF OUR ROOM! It was 58 degrees outside during our stay, and we were on the 10th floor, yet the heat was on and our room was a stifling 79 degrees. After trying to lower the thermostat with no results, we called down to the desk and were told that they had the air conditioning off and were not going to turn it on. We were advised we could "open a window," which wouldn't have been a problem except the hotel is smack dab in the middle of downtown, and is noisy enough outside without the added volume of New Year's Eve and tens of thousands of people gathering downtown for the fireworks. I understand that it is unexpected to have such warm weather in December in Baltimore, but the hotel manager needs to be able to make the call to turn the air conditioner on so hotel guests are comfortable. This is the absolute first thing a hotel should do for its guests: make the rooms a comfortable temperature. *The TV remote did not work. While this might seem petty, being able to watch TV in a hotel room is kind of crucial. With no working remote, it made the activity very annoying. Of course, I can't mention the bad without mentioning the good. The staff are pleasant, the bed was extremely comfortable and the room itself was clean and pretty nice if a bit dated. Since it was New Year's, the hotel gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and party hats, noice-makers, and a gold bead necklace. That was a very nice touch. Also, there was a free hot breakfast, and while not the best breakfast I ever had, it was free and they had a good variety (scrambled eggs, biscuits and sausage gravy, make-your-own-waffle station). Ultimately, there are many other hotels in downtown Baltimore that charge about the same rate for rooms but are successful in the three major areas where Brookshire failed completely. All of the ones I can think of (Hampton Inn, Rennaissance, Hilton, Marriott, etc.) at the very least have working toilets and room temperature control. In light of this, there is no way I would ever return to Brookshire.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal G
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Baltimore for New Year's eve. We were unsure of where to stay. After much debate, we decided on Brookshire. I'm so glad we did! When I called to see if we had two double beds, rather than a queen, which we didn't, the front desk person was actually able to upgrade us to a suite with no extra charge! The suite's living and bedroom space was very large. Additionally, the room and the hotel was very clean. The free breakfast was great. There were many different options. Lastly, it was just a block away from the harbor! I was really surprised. The only downfall of the room is that the bathroom was really small and if someone was taking a shower, the mirror steamed up so much, that even with the fan, it was fogged up. Overall, the hotel was excellent and a great place to stay....very family-orientated!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for location!”
Reviews.Author: powder068
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a block north of the inter harbor and opposite of the street of the mall. The room we had was a corner suite and had a seperate living room. You can only get a Queen size bed here....but the size of the rooms more than make up for that. The TVS were very new and the hotel has been updated in the past 5 years. Offered a free reception each night that included free snacks fruit and cheese along with wine and 2 types of beer.... CONS Bathroom is very small...but plenty of room to do your thing in the larger rooms Parking is $29.00 a night....try to find package that includes this for free

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel BUT do carefully check your valeted car!”
Reviews.Author: Julder
Reviews.Content: PROS: Myself and my husband recently used a Groupon and stayed at this hotel. We stayed in a suite - queen bed, 2 rooms, 2 flatscreens - which was nice but did show some minor signs of wear and tear. The hotel offered evening appetizers and provided beer/wine drink coupons on their 'sky level' each weekday evening which was nice. The check-in staff was also very pleasant and helpful. The location couldn't be better - you're literally 1.5 blocks from the harbor and close to the busline (which there's a free one) which makes it easy to go and do touristy stuff. CONS: Included in our Groupon was 'free' parking which is normally $29/day - but boy do I wish that we parked in a nearby lot ourselves because we ended up with $535 worth of new damage which we did NOT see BEFORE leaving (because it was on the lower front bumper)! We promptly contacted the hotel and they gave us their manager's name. Long story short, unsurprisingly however still with great disappointment, they claimed absolutely no culpability. So PLEASE check your vehicle in its entirity BEFORE you leave so this doesn't happen to you!!! Also the hotel does have a 'gym' which consists of just 2 treadmills (but w/TV's), 2 stationary bikes and some free weights. There's no safe in the rooms either...! Had my car not been damaged -especially to the extent of what it was- I would've given the hotel 4-4.5 stars....

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: GottaGo906
Reviews.Content: From the maid service to the front desk,everyone made you feel welcome.Even the valet was a wealth of information. The location is perfect for someone who wants to be close to the harbor without breaking the bank. Breakfast,which was included,left a little to be desired. It was the same thing everyday of my stay,and kind of tasteless,but there was yogurt and cereal if you didn't want the hot food.The rooms were clean and the suites are fairly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough -- INTERNET access a major issue”
Reviews.Author: V S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at Brookshire Suites. Wired internet access in room offered, but not working in all rooms apparently. The first room we were given (room 703) did not work at all (internet). The staff was very helpful, showing us two other rooms. Internet access did not work in the 2nd room either. The third room (room 503) was fine. However, their internet connection apparently does not allow vpn setup. This can be a major issue with business travelers. Also, I must wonder what we would have done if the hotel was booked solid and we were not able to change rooms! I realize internet access is not a major issue for all travelers and that is why I rated this 4 stars. They did have 2 functioning pc's with a printer in the lobby. Internet access here was fine. The location cannot be beat! It was just a block from the Inner Harbour, So much was walking distance (malls, shopping, aquarium, science center, drug store, restaurants, etc). Parking is a hassle. Since we stayed 7 days (6 nights) and I knew of this issue in advance, after reading previous reviews, I planned ahead. I contacted a parking garage just across the street -- caddy corner. To save money the parking staff over the phone suggested paying for a 1/2 month prorated rate of $94.50 + $15 activation fee ==> total=$109.50. This is less expensive than the daily rate and will permit going in and out at your leisure. About the rooms... Both 703 and 503 were suites with a beautiful harbour view. Both had similar issues with the ceiling. I am 5' tall and did not have a problem with this, but it was very noticeable, as I could touch the ceiling upon entering the room. After stepping inside the room about a foot, the ceiling does get higher, but not by much. I could not reach it, but my 5' 7" companion could! The bathroom sink was noticeably deeper than normal. At 5' tall, I had trouble comfortably using the faucet. It was very far inside. Also, the hot water can be scalding hot -- just a warning for those traveling with children. The water pressure in the shower was wonderful. The carpeting 503 was very shabby and run down. 703's carpet was ok. The mirror in the bedroom in 503 was above the dresser but behind the flat screen tv sitting on the dresser. This was useless. In the other room (703) the mirror was off to the side of the room -- a position that made it possible to fully make use of. The heating and cooling was terrible. We complained, but nothing was done. At the start of the trip we wanted to cool down the room, but were unable to make the room comfortable with the a/c. Later in the trip after a cold wave was passing by we wanted to heat the room, but also had problems with this. One of the dresser drawers in 503 never shut all the way. This was very annoying! Breakfast was fabulous here! Every day they served scrambled eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, fresh fruit salad, yogurt, bagels, donuts, cereal, sliced breads, make your own waffles, juice, coffee, hot chocolate, oatmeal, milk, etc I have no complaints about breakfast. Weeknights they served complimentary beers/wines, salad, cheese, fruit, etc. This was very nice as well. I believe this hotel is a diamond in the rough. If management addresses these issues I listed I would give it 5 or more stars for sure! Of course I do not expect the ceilings to be raised, but otherwise, small changes would greatly improve a guest's visit!

Reviews.Title: “great bed, good bargain, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: rickie57
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teen daughter; we had a two room suite which was quite spacious and had a kitchenette. Our reservation was for a room with 2 double beds which we booked online through Hotels.com, and there were no rooms with this configuration available. The bed was really comfortable but the sofa bed gave my daughter a backache. The associated garage cost $30.00, which seemed alot for a room less than $100. the decor was a bit 1970's. The staff was really pleasant, and they did refund my garage fee because of the error in beds. The location is great--near lots of restaurants, shopping and attractions, right near the harbor. We'll probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff can really make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Kayla H
Reviews.Content: After buying the groupon I finally was able to make the stay at Brookshire Suites. After calling the hotel a few times for planning a little romantic evening I found that the staff was very helpful. Ian and the young lady who worked the evening shift-11pm on 12/16 helped to make my plans for my boyfriend go through. They allowed me to have someone set up the room. Upgraded the room for me and were VERY accommodating. Free valet with the groupon was amazing and the free hot breakfast in the morning was quite tasty. The only downside of the stay was the burn stains in the rugs, some on the wall. It kind of put a dent on the room. I would also recommend putting an air freshner in the room so that it smells better upon entering the room. Overall good stay and I would recommend to other people. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: sunneeNj
Reviews.Content: Everyone who worked there was more than nice! We were very comfortable in a two room suite. The Cloud Club was fantastic. My little boy loved the treasure chest and gold coins.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCKarl
Reviews.Content: The front desk had an excellent concierge who were very personable and helpful. We were there on Thanksgiving and the young lady Meredith went through the trouble of calling various restaurants to see if they had dishes to accommodate me and my partner (we're vegetarians). The rooms were nice, but they needed some updating (maybe some fresh paint and new finishes). Overall for what we paid it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!great service!”
Reviews.Author: kishon t
Reviews.Content: great location: 2minutes walk to inner harbor, 12 minutes walk to the ravens stadium! front desk lady super friendly and super helpful. best budget place in town. got an executive suite for the price of a regular room.

Reviews.Title: “Service and location make up for dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: 6tareg
Reviews.Content: We booked a one night stay in a two room queen suite. Meredith, who was working the front desk, could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Check-in was a breeze and within minutes we were off to our room The building is older, so everything, including the elevators worked a bit slower, but we did not mind. Our "suite" on the third level was comfortable. The ceilings were quite low, and the bathroom quite small, but it was fine. Again, not a shiny penny, but clean and cozy, with a very welcoming queen bed. Upon registering, we were told of a complimentary happy hour on the top floor of the hotel. We decided to check it out and glad we did. Besides appetizers like fresh fruit, vegetables, dip, salad, and salty snacks, guests also got two free drinks (wine/beer). David, the "bartender", was super friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our cocktails and even chatted with a few other guests. The room served double duty as it also was where breakfast was served in the morning. It is open 24 hrs, so if someone needed to escape his/her room, this was a great place to come to. During breakfast, we could see the harbor from the glass enclosed floor. There was a make your own waffle station, eggs, potatoes, sausage, yogurt, fruit, juices, donuts, toast, bagels and cereal. Plenty of options to fill the tank. And again, service was spot on. Empty serving dishes were immediately filled, and dirty plates removed even though this was a do it your self meal. Of course, if you wanted to be near the Inner Harbor, well you couldn't get a better location. You are but steps to the water, shops and restaurants. We were going to a Bob Seger concert at the 1st Mariner Arena, so Brookshire Suites fullfilled our needs. A couple blocks, and we were at the venue......can't ask for more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunilvr
Reviews.Content: We encountered a few problems but I'll start with the pros: great location close to the harbor and Mariners arena; friendly, helpful staff (especially David); pet friendly with no pet fee; breakfast and wine/beer happy hour free; low price on hotels.com; true suite with separate bedroom; comfortable bed. Cons: room could use a serious rehab or at least a good cleaning - more shabby than chic; ceilings very low - I'm 5'7" and could easily touch the ceiling - could be claustrophobic for a tall person; bathroom is tiny; pet walk is a city block away; $34.80 per night to park. All in all, we got such a good price on hotels.com (less than$100 before taxes,parking, and fees), I really can't complain. Price for the same room on Orbitz was $206, before parking fees, taxes and destination fees, whatever that is. I'm used to paying resort fees, but this is no resort. Also, when we checked out, we noticed we were charged for an extra night parking. The mistake was corrected, but I will continue to monitor my account to make sure as credits take days to process. Would we stay here again? - probably, keeping in mind this is a three star hotel. By the way, we've never visited Baltimore before and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Marik99
Reviews.Content: Meredith, our concierge/check in person/ wine opener, was our 1st entrance to the wonderful staff of the hotel. Location is fantastic, near to all that is fun in inner harbor Baltimore. Street noises are a little noticeable, but the overall experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “So Close to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Mike58318
Reviews.Content: perfect location,close to the inner harbor,everything whorthwhile is close by.The hotel is not perfect but it is "good" the staff was great and we have no complaints.TV remote is a POS and watching is unusable traffic noise is loud but I assume this is normal in the big city .We enjoyed our stay.BTW we went to the Ravens vs Bengals game and that was GREAT !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: Antonios T
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three night stay. Staff is excellent and courteous .... Remind me of staff at very upscale hotels. The location can't be beat ...one block from the center of inner harbor. Room was great and had sink microwave and mini refrig. Breakfast was perfect. Travelled with two children (7 & 4) . Parking on premises (valet $29/day)....saw a review that was surprised that they had to pay for parking?! Obviously never travelled to a city hotel before! This place is a hidden gem with a great price and location. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Ed A
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend here. Wonderful. Great location - 1 block from the Inner Harbor. Breakfast included and a great nightly cocktail hour - both on the 12 floor overlooking the city. Wonderful, caring staff. David was the best. Hosted the evening cocktail hours and has a great personality and knowledge of the city. Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but room was not clean”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: The location was good. The service was good. The breakfast was good. But the room is dated and not as clean as I like. For the pricing compared to other hotels in the area it is a good deal if they could just get in some new flooring and repaint some of the walls

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Breakfast and Happy Hour..who could ask for more?!!”
Reviews.Author: MissyHudson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2 nights at the Brookshire and we have only good things to say about our stay. Traveling with 2 kids (6yr and 3yrs) they loved the hotel coin hunt and the breakfast and happy hour with David were wonderful. He was very pleasant and helpful answering our questions, truly a top employee that made everyone feel welcome. We parked the car in the secure valet and were able to walk to all the Inner Harbor spots. No need to drive at all. Our only draw back was that we forgot our "white noise" machine. Being located in the city, you will hear the sounds of some traffic and emergency responders overnight. The Brookshire is an affordable and perfect hotel for families, we will return for a stay again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca_W34182
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the brookshire suites for a weekend getaway and it was a fantastic expeience. When we arrived Devante helped us with our valet parking(34 dollars a night) and took good care of our car. David was the host of the could club reception(you get two free drinks a night) and he was very helpful with dinner reservations. All the staff is welcoming and very friendly. Dennis, Meredith and Ian were all amazing at the front desk. i would certinaly recommend this hotel to everyone. great price and great location. we will deffinatly be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: freedominc98
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Baltimore and was visiting for the weekend with some friends from Texas. It was important to have a good convenient location. It was a busy weekend in baltimore and the waterfront hotels were very expensive. We decided to try the Brookshire because it was an exceptional deal (we thought almost too good to be true... like what kind of surprises would meet us after check in). The hotel was very clean. The staff very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were great, however the carpet was worn and needing replacement soon (though I heard they will be doing some interior renovations). Not a major deal considering the value, just an observation. The breakfast was okay, but again I would say reasonable for the value/cost of the room. The location is great. Though it is not waterfront, you are literally one block from the Inner Harbor. My wife and I are both walkers and it is no problem to walk to Federal Hill, Little Italy, Harbor East and even Fells Point in good weather. If your not a walker, the Charm City Circulator, which is a free bus has nearby stops. Again, best way to some it up is... Great Value. p.s. Don't spend to much time in your room anyway, There is a lot to do and see in Baltimore and if your there for business... well find time to have some fun.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: The staff is great. The location is very convenient to Inner Harbor. My son had a great time collecting the coins from the staff to redeem for a prize. We arrived on Friday and the happy hour was very nice too. While talking to the staff at happy hour, we asked if the microwave was available for use later in the evening. They said yes but actually brought a microwave to our room for use. Only negative is the $29 valet parking. Very nice breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “I'm definitely coming back.”
Reviews.Author: George L
Reviews.Content: Merideth, and Kenya... 5 Star performance. The staff was so helpful in making my buddies bachelor party memorable. I'm not usually a review guy but the hotel was so nice and the staff was so friendly. I was inclined to come on here and compliment everyone's performance. The location was awesome, perfect walking distance from the harbor and a quick taxi ride away from all the places we wanted to go. The 24 hour Subway across the street didn't hurt either especially after a long night of drinking. They have definitely earned a repeat customer in me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and price”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: After attending a business conference, I decided to stay another day in Baltimore to enjoy myself taking photos of the city. I found this hidden treasure of a hotel. It started with a smile and enjoyable experience with Ms. Kenya at the front desk. The price was very good considering the quality of the hotel and its location just a block away from the harbor. There's a great sky lounge on top to look at the harbor, watch television, exercise and to have breakfast or snacks. My room had widescreen television, desk, free DSL Internet connection, WiFi, and a small kitchenette area. There are some great views. A great room. And great service. I'm not sure what Brookshire Suites can do to improve their very high bar for quality of service - maybe they'll have to start dancing for guests and peel grapes?!?

Reviews.Title: “We were treated great!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We're not ones to write reviews but because of the personalized service we received and the extra mile the manager went to make our stay memorable, I had to make an exception. This hotel is situated one block away from the harbor and is surrounded by several unique neighborhoods. We didn't know any of this when we chose the hotel (the great price sold us) but the manager created a detailed map of the area and took a half hour of his evening to point out not just hot spots but also exactly how to get to them. The Corks restaurant Dennis recommended was perhaps the best steak I've eaten outside of NY. The time this young man took with us out-of-towners assured that we will use this hotel on all subsequent Baltimore trips. All in all the hotel is spacious and nicely decorated. Beds are much more comfortable than even our own and the buffet breakfast overlooking the city was a great addition to our stay. Found a rate around $100 online but would happily pay more in the future knowing what we now know!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daphnee R
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Bookshire Suites. This was my first time in Baltimore,MD for a Medical conference at The Johns Hopkins Medical school. I must say that the staffs were very polite and supportive. I want to especially thank Travis (I believe that's his name. Correct me if I am wrong) for his generosity. Thank you Geoff and David for getting a taxi for me and my friend. I wish that I could keep in contact with the staffs, perhaps through face book, but I forgot to ask them for their info. :(.. All has already been said..Overall rating is EXCELLENT!. If it is possible to keep in contact, that would be great!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: LindsayNJ620
Reviews.Content: My boyfried and I stayed at this property this previous weekend. It was a last minute trip from NJ to go see the aquarium and get out on the town. FIrst of all we parked at a neighborhood parking garage thinking we would save a few bucks instead of using the hotel parking service. Mistake. You do not save any money, infact it may wind up being cheaper. Up on checkin we were greeted by someone, I believe his name was Dennis, who was extremely helpful and easy going at the same time. He checked us in quickly and still gave us need to know information clearly. When we entered our room I was very happy. There was a microwave and fridge and seperate sink area other than the bathroom. The bedroom in the suite was more than enough and the bed was comfortable. There were two flatscreen TV's in the room but the remote control batteries were nearly dead...whatever we had the Ravens game on all afternoon before dinner so we didnt have a need to change the channel. I did forget to inform the hotel!!! The bathroom was slightly small but towels were adequate and there was space to move around. The breakfast was good and I was shocked it was included in the already cheap price considering all of the surrounding Inner Harbor Hotels were double the room rate of Brookshire. LOCATION was perfect! Literally one block from the Inner Harbor!!!!! We felt safe walking to and from. Also about 6 blocks from Power Plant Live where we enjoyed a few pints at the Biergaren. This will be our first choice hotel whenever we visit Baltimore. We will be visiting again very soon thanks to this wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: mzqueenz
Reviews.Content: My company booked The Brookshire for us for a huge nursing convention. The room was very spacious. The staff was very helpful and attentive. David our happy hour bartender was the greatest. He makes a mean strong drinks. Geoff and Devanne where great handling my vehicle for the valet that I paid for. The good thing about an other wise expensive valet parking is the fact that I was able to pull out my car at my leisure without penalty. I really enjoyed my stay. I was very comfortable and rested very well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while in town for a conference. The breakfast and happy hour that came with the room was a nice touch, especially when you are busy running back and forth to conference sessions. I have to say though that the best part of the hotel was David the concierge. He has very helpful with helping us navigate around the city and getting back to the airport. He had an amazing energy for his work and you could tell that he really loved his job. The only reason I didn't give this hotel an excellent was I wish there had been more light in the bathroom and an available outlet next to the bed for me to have been able to plug my cell phone charger into.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was The Best”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. David was The Best Of The Best. Room was clean. Will return soon. We decided we want to hire more Davids in our work place. He has a great attitude and a lot of energy.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinash
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently stayed here for two nights as we were attending a conference at 1st Mariner Arena. We really couldn't have been more pleased. The location of Brookshire was PERFECT! We were on the 10th floor and had a room that looked out towards the Inner Harbor... the Inner Harbor is just a short walk. We felt very safe during our stay. I can't say enough the EXCELLENT customer service from each employee that we encountered. From recommending places to eat to giving easy directions, we were really impressed! The complimentary breakfast and snacks were also wonderful. Our room was very clean. Just a head's up- the valet parking was about 35.00/night (including tax). While this seemed a little steep, I would pay it again just due to the crazy traffic in Baltimore! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Mike D”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: If you need a great experience while in Baltimore, you need to stay here. Great rooms, amazing views and very helpful, kind and courteous employees. Excellent! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised for the cost. Clean room and very spacious. Convenient walk to Harbour (1 block) and 2 blocks to the great aquarium (a must see!). Hotel staff was quite friendly and informative. The complimentary breakfast was good. The complimentary drinks and snacks from 5:30 - 7:00 pm was a nice plus. A reasonable walk to Orioles game. Just a few blocks to many choices for Italian restaurants. A parking lot just 1/2 block away is less expensive than valet parking if you just want to leave your car there.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce J
Reviews.Content: Great find and a great buy! I was at a conference in Baltimore and booked a standard room. The suite I was given was actually much closer to a one-bedroom apartment at the same price. The hotel is one block from the Inner Harbor so very convenient to all touristy things. Good breakfast in the Cloud Room with excellent views, good treadmills,great beds,professional and friendly staff. Definitely will recommend and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ......just a tad above average”
Reviews.Author: Jifffer
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Baltimore as part of a baseball stadium tour. We were only staying 1 night ....so the suite was probably overkill for only a one nighter. Hotel looks very cool from the outside ....interior is a little tired. Hotel has that little boutique feel ...but they don't quite pull it off. Beautiful and fairly spacious lobby .....with nice little snack - alcohol fridge adjacent to lobby for night time entertainment - snacks. The room was just ok .....spacious once again - we had a living room with large flat screen TV ... with connecting room which was very big ....with another flat screen TV. Bed was extremely comfortable ... the washroom was a little small and disappointing however. Didn't really put the kitchenette to use ....but it looked a little dated but it was very clean. The wife enjoyed the full ironing board + iron. No Wi-Fi in the rooms ....how can this be in 2011. Need to go to the top floor of the hotel or lobby for internet access. We had complimentary breakfast - well stocked buffet style - very filling on top floor with great views of the Inner Harbor. Hotel was also offering 2 complimentary drinks per guest between 5-6 pm ...which we couldn't use. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. They are fairly sticklers about check-ins which is set for 4 pm - we couldn't check-in before ...we arrived at 1 pm - they did stow our luggage. Overnight parking was also a little steep for Baltimore ...$30 +. Hotel is conveniently located within 5 minute walking distance to the very charming Inner Harbor ....tons of restaurants, bars, shops, etc .... Walking distance to Camden Yards to see the Orioles (15 minutes max ....a true must see .....Camden Yards has to be one of the finest and fan friendly baseball stadium - nice marriage of old and new right in the middle of tow) or right next door, the stadium for the Ravens. The walk is right through town, very safe neighborhood .....with great selection of restaurants and bars. Really nothing bad to say about this hotel ...it just lacks that little something to make it a killer for the price. I would still recommend it over the Hyatt which has a real impersonal look.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the place”
Reviews.Author: Beth F
Reviews.Content: This place is a good value, especially for the area. Rooms are clean and nice, nothing fancy but very nice. Staff is wonderful, they are helpful, friendly and go out of their way to make sure you stay is pleasant. I would stay here again in a minute just based on the service. Thanks for a great weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, convenient location, spacious... but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: madvice
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the Brookshire looks kind of artsy or retro. The front desk has stools in front of it, so if you think it's a bar, go over there anyway to check in. The room itself felt old, in spite of the updated bedspread and bolster pillow. My suite had an ample living room, the bedroom was adequately sized, and the bathroom was... efficient (had to close the door to get into the bathtub). Great that the bathroom has an exhaust fan - I rarely see that in any hotel. No room service, but that's why there's a kitchenette. Nice having the extra sink next to the fridge, as well as the microwave. Ironing board was a little unsteady, threatening to fold itself at times. But the steam iron was functional. Five hangers in the closet. Some of the dresser drawers didn't open well. Most of the nights, the hardline internet connection wasn't up. Apparently there is wireless upstairs in the Cloud Club, but my colleague said it was not reliable. Breakfast was good, with enough variety to satisfy most. There was a drink reception each night that I never got around to attending. Staff was very friendly and helpful. That said, I did overhear conversations with guests at the front desk on two separate nights about the hotel having been overbooked. Valet parking is only available 07:00-23:00 - however, if you need to check out before 07:00, you can arrange the night before to have your car brought up into an enclosed valet breezeway, and it will be available to you when you check out. There is a 24-hour Subway sandwich shop thirty yards from the lobby - a lifesaver for late night arrivals. There is also a CVS drugstore up the block, but they close at 20:00 on weeknights (!). Easy walk to the inner harbor and lots of shops and restaurants, so the location is decent.

Reviews.Title: “You May Want to Try This One”
Reviews.Author: DCSEasternLongIsland
Reviews.Content: I am an infrequent visitor to the Inner Harbor area of Baltimore. Stayed several days at the Brookshire and was impressed. Quite close to the waterfront, moderately priced and great service mark the Brookshire. I was annoyed at the $9.95 per day "amenities fee" until I found that it includes a fabulous 'reception' with snacks and drinks from 5:30 - 7:30 PM. Then a breakfast buffet in the morning - what a deal! The staff are eager to please and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Brookshire very nice, great location.”
Reviews.Author: EI83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th birthday weekend get away. We only had the weekend & wanted somewhere close to home but some fun stuff to do. Brookshire is a 3 minute walk to Interharbor. Had to use parking garage as there is nowhere to park, $35 a night but was even 1 night free. Car was safe, close by & 17 a day, not bad compared to alternatives. Heard traffic noise was bad & requested top floors which was granted. Noise was still bad, police & fire truck sirens all night. Hotel had a happy hour type thing on top floor with drinks & munchies. Breakfast was very good both mornings. Walked around area without any fear, although we were approached by several people begging. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's me and my girlfriend's new spot!”
Reviews.Author: bendingblades
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the whole place. And Kenya at the front desk was especially helpful! The valets were pleasant and helpful and the accommodations were pleasing. A good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Already booked Accessible Room for next year!”
Reviews.Author: RavensLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks due to a medical stay at Kennedy Krieger/Hopkins. The staff was wonderful, especially David and Andrea. The room we stayed in was handicapped accessible w/roll in shower. As far as accessibility, the room was very spacious for w/c users. Not completely perfect bathroom, but when you're used to your own b/r at home setup is never quite perfect. If you have an sci and can't feel hot/cold there's a digital shower but it always runs hot and is very sensitive. Management was very open to feedback for better setup next remodel. Free breakfast was wonderful (you can even make your own waffles) and 2 free drinks at night! Walking or rolling distance to Inner Harbor made the free time great. Again, experience was great and the staff made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a recent business trip in Baltimore. The hotel had been recommended to me months prior by Harbor Magic as their hotel that catered to business travelers because of the breakfast, suites available, wireless, and shuttle to other neighborhoods within Baltimore. After booking, I learned that the hotel is no longer associated with Harbor Magic. I made reservations at the last minute and was able to be accommodated. Upon arriving, I was upgraded from a king room to a suite due to "low occupancy." The following description is not meant to be funny and does not exaggerate. I wish I had had my camera to help show what I am talking about. Upon entering the room I felt like I was in a horror movie set in 1970. It was truly an eerie experience. The lights flickered on, some never turned on. The carpet was threadbare and stained with disgusting red and brown marks. There was a silverfish in the bathtub, probably due to the fact that the bathtub faucet constantly leaked. There was dirt behind the headboard and a long hair (not mine) on a pillow. There were stains on the ceiling and marks on the walls. The dark, dank, dirty room gave me such an unsettling feeling that I seriously considered checking out and finding another hotel. I decided to stick it out and it only got worse. When I was getting ready for bed I heard a phone ringing faintly in the distance. Turns out it was my bathroom phone, which had been turned to low volume. It never stopped ringing and I did not pick it up. I tried to call the lobby to let them know of this, only to find that neither the phone in the living room or bedroom had a dial tone. Instead, I turned the volume off. The phone was still ringing in the morning. Breakfast consisted of cold eggs, stale bagels, fruit from a can, yogurt, and various pastries. Juice and coffee were both from a machine. Positives: able to get a reservation at the last minute, was only $99 Negatives: there is no longer a shuttle running to all Harbor Magic properties, as was advertised to me. The rooms are not only drab, but dirty. There is no wireless in the rooms, only DSL. Breakfast was underwhelming at best. The location is downtown, but is not good because it is not safe to walk outside in the neighborhood at night. (I lived in Baltimore for many years and trust me on the safety issue.) I would not recommend this to anyone and will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SowerFamily
Reviews.Content: The trip was wonderful! Everyone there treated us like family. From when we got out our car, to when we got to our room. Even the bellmen were great. I think there was a boy named Donte or Devonte. I could never get his name right. But he was excellent. He helped with our luggage, took care of our car, and even went out the way to check on us.
