This is the way hotels should be. The lady Andrea was also magnificent! My wife and kids really enjoyed themselves. My daughter didn't want to leave because she wanted to see the shark again. I will be sure to return next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: babs067
Reviews.Content: Beautiful clean room, excellent staff who go above and beyond. Full Breakfast and a happy hour you won't find anywhere else. Very satisfied and would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Average Stay in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: OhCanada1867
Reviews.Content: Brace yourself for this review, Trip Advisors. It is long, but useful. My family and I recently traveled to Baltimore before a cruise vacation on the East coast. After nights of deliberating, it was settled that we would stay at the Brookshire Suites. Firstly, let me say that the location of this hotel is perfect. We couldn't have asked for better! It is seconds away from the fabulous Inner Harbour which made sight seeing very easy. I do not understand the poor ratings for staff at this hotel. Front desk personal, valet drivers and bar staff were always friendly and polite (especially Amy and Dave). They were very kind to us and offered their tips and advice about places to visit and eat in the city. However, I would not consider the hotel to be one of the greatest that I have stayed at. My family and I had to switch rooms due to noise from Lombard St. When we attempted to do this, the hotel told us that no rooms on the opposite side of the hotel were available. It was only after several calls to the front desk that we were able to acquire a quiet room. It would have been nice to know that Harbour Magic was no longer affiliated before we stayed at the Brookshire Suites. Harbour Magic was one of the reasons why we chose to stay at the hotel and we felt that we had been duped. No information about the break was provided before or after our booking, and we were told only after inquiring at the front desk upon check in. The pullout couches did not provide a comfortable sleep and we were hard pressed to find a decent cot to use. The cot delivered to our room was lumpy, missing springs and had a deep concave which made it impossible to sleep on. The hotel, however, did bring a replacement as soon as was possible - then we switched rooms and had two queen sized beds for our use. As for the decor, the hotel could use some renovations, but it was far from a dive. Breakfast and snacks in the Cloud Club were the highlight of our time at the hotel - thank you Dave. All in all, the Brookshire Suites is not a terrible hotel. It provided decent accommodation for the time we spent in Baltimore. Whether or not we will return in the future has yet to be decided.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: NightNurse801
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for several days and were really impressed all around. 2 minute walk to Harbor area, safe, well-lit and lots of tourists day and night made us feel comfortable walking after dark. Rooms are big and our view of the water made the evenings all the more romantic. Most of the staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgable about the local area and we were met with a 'hello' or 'welcome back' each time we passed through the lobby. I have to say that the only complaint we had was when I asked if a shuttle could drop us in another area of the city for dinner. The young lady behind the desk told me rather rudely that they have new owners, no shuttle and that she apologizes 'but theres unfortunately nothing I can do about that.' We didn't see her at the desk over the next 3 days and we were in and out constantly so I'll assume she isn't in customer service normally! Breakfast was perfect....lots of food and spectacular views of the city and water from the top floor. Evening happy hour was wonderful break in our day. Overall an excellent mid-week getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly great staff”
Reviews.Author: oc1996
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Brookshire for a family vacation to the inner harbor. Pros:Location, location, location. Just across the street from the inner harbor. A must so you are not walking around the city of Baltimore. This is not a safe city at night if you are outside the inner harbor. The biggest pro for this hotel was the staff. They have a gold coin reward program for kids. They were great with my 10 and 6 years olds. They were always happy to greet my kids and went out of their way to get them a gold coin. (5 gold coins and they got to pick from the treasure chest) This was by far the most famliy friendly hotel we have stayed at. Another plus was the breakfast. fresh waffles, eggs, muffins, donuts, bagels, fruit, and oatmeal were all part of it. It was also located on the 9th floor with a great view of the city. Cons: Hotel rooms need some updating. The suite was run down but clean. The bed was comfortable and updated but the living area was not.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I’ve stayed at to date! Go to the Renaissance across the street and save yourself the headache.”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: Run away! Run away! Management and staff were incompetent and inhospitable. Serious retraining is in desperate need at this location. The bartender was the only staff member that seemed to have a clue and seemed happy to be there. The entire week of my stay the AC was not working properly, the room I was given was not what I reserved and the staff was unwilling to change. Parking ($29/day) was to be free as part of a package deal and it was not since “We were dropped from the Harbor Magic Hotel affiliation” and “cannot not honor that deal even though you booked before we lost our affiliation”. Check in is guaranteed by 4 PM though it wasn’t until 4:30 PM was my room available (with a broken AC in 100+ degree heat) after trying to check in early between 1-3. Management stated that they would move my room to the top of the cleaning list so it may be ready early, but obviously that was not the case. Then the final night the hotels fire alarm was going off for a number of hours without fire department notification (which should be an automatic notification - SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE) lost power and the entire hotel was without air-conditioning, and parts without power, to include the elevators and the stairwells. So we had to use flashlights to walk to and from our room as we packed our things and made three trips two blocks away to another hotel. There was no attempt to rectify our concerns or correct the hotels failures to adhere to their code of conduct were made despite multiple attempts to speak to a manager. After numerous requests to have a member of management contact me, it has been three weeks without a call, letter or even an email. After reading other reviews of the same incident, HOTEL MANAGER response is a brush off with no attempt to try and gain the customers confidence back, only, “and based on your comments there is little we can do to change that”, what a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location for a night at the harbor. Everyone that worked there was very friendly and super helpful. The rooms were clean and even bigger than I expected. Parking is convenient if you don't mind paying for it, however the metro is only 3 blocks away. We had taken the metro and the hotel even held our bags for us while we shopped after we checked out. I will definatly come back here on my next trip to the harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Quality seems to have declined recently...”
Reviews.Author: Bosley02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend night for a race up in Baltimore last month, and picked Brookshire Suites because we had a positive experience there during a previous trip for a fun Baltimore weekend trip. So, first a quick summary and then I'll explain: Pros: Good free breakfast, rooms are inexpensive, location is convenient/walkable to harbor Cons: Staff did not seem knowledgeable on area, basic maintenance and cleanliness of common areas, room was not clean and poorly designed Like I said, we really enjoyed our first visit here but this time it seemed a lot different. The hallway area leading to our room was run-down with poor lighting and the room itself had a really cramped bedroom and the bathroom was about the size of a closet (again, very different from our first experience). This room was also quite noisy. As for the service, we had asked several staff members about the light rail and other public transportation options to get up to the zoo area the next morning, and no one seemed to know...we ended up having to search online and figure it out ourselves. We also had called to ask about public parking options in the area and got a spacey "uh, there's parking garages in the area, just look for signs." Not particularly helpful. All that being said, the complimentary breakfast was excellent and if you're not planning on being around your room much, I suppose it's still a good deal for the price since the harbor is practically right out the door. They always have excellent last-minute weekend rates if you sign up for the email list. It sounds like based on recent reviews people are still having quite divergent experiences, so I imagine it largely depends on the room you get an who's working when you're staying there. I just wouldn't go in having high expectations on the room quality or counting on the staff to provide reliable information about the area. If I went back to Baltimore, I think I would pay a little extra $$ and stay at one of Brookshire's sister hotels, Admiral Fell Inn or Fells Point Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Free shuttles, free hot breakfast, free evening reception, the best staff”
Reviews.Author: boatinirish
Reviews.Content: David Grossman, the bartender, was so knowledgable of everything around the city from the restaraunts to things to see and do. The hotel was very clean with a staff so friendly and willing to go the extra mile to make your stay the best. A block away from the inner harbor, shops and water taxis. Now lets mention the FREE shuttles,hot breakfast buffet and an evening reception with food and refreshments. You won't be disappointed .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff balance out the room's shortcomings.”
Reviews.Author: MelissaMC13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brookshire Suites in March 2011 with three of my friends for a "Girls' Weekend". After researching, I chose the Brookshire based on its nightly rates, reviews and proximity to the Inner Harbor. The hotel itself was easy to find, with a parking deck located across the street. Part of your nightly parking is validated by the hotel, which is nice. The hotel lobby is colorful, bright and clean. The employees are super friendly and professional. The room, however, was not of the same caliber as the lobby and employees. A one-bedroom suite - seating area and small "kitchenette" on one side, with bedroom and bathroom on the other. Room review: Pros: Plenty of space for four adults, bathroom looked newly renovated, good water pressure, refrigerator, flat-screen TVs in both rooms. Cons: The ceilings in the rooms were VERY low, and I am a very short person! The low ceilings gave the suite an overall feeling of being closed in. While the beds were nice and comfy, I agree with the previous poster that said the rugs were a little scary. But then again, most hotel rugs are scary if you think about them too long. We did not partake in the happy hour but my friends attended the breakfast on the second morning (I was sick with food poisoning - NOT from the hotel.) They said it was "OK." The front desk staff was even kind enough to extend our check-out time because I was so ill. Overall, a fine hotel for what we paid, but I would not pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Adam56
Reviews.Content: Okay so it isn't the Embassy Suites.Price is not either. The Cloud lounge breakfast leaves a lot to be desired. If the food was hot it would have been better. eggs were lukewarm and the potatoes were stone cold. The nightly reception is pretty good, not heavy on food but really aren't we there for the beverages? The rooms while dated were clean- not spotless, street noise is a definite issue. We beat this by taking the cushions off the sleeper sofa and putting them in the bedroom window, helped immensely. Overall great location, great price, recommend with the above notices. Staff was outstanding! Everyone was friendly and helpful . We got treated to the full Geoff treatment.. what a hoot! we would do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but excessive street noise--insulate your windows please”
Reviews.Author: Foodwise
Reviews.Content: The 2 room suite was great for my family. Plenty of room to spread out, and 2 free waters. My step son loved the free kids toy he received there. The staff there were exceptionally friendly and kind. Sadly, that's where the great things about this place stops. The street noise at night was the worst I've ever seen or HEARD. There were thousands of people (foot traffic and cars) on the street as the hotel sits on one of the busiest street corners in Baltimore City. The police were out in force hurrying people along the roads, but also randomly blaring their sirens. This went on until 3 am. Then the street miraculously emptied and quieted down. With ear plugs I was able to get to sleep around 3 pm. Only to have to get up at 8:30 am. While the street noise can't be helped, this hotel MUST GET SOUND PROOF WINDOWS!!!!!!!! We were on the 10th floor and could hear nearly everything at street level. The interior hotel noise itself was minimal. Not kids running down the halls or loud neighbors etc. The only other thing that really troubled me was the huge molded rusted stain behind the toilet bowl that was conveniently blocked by the trash can. Couldn't really see it till you move the can out of the way. Then, it was like OMG, what the heck is that. All in all, I would not stay here again until the windows were changed. The location is a block from the inner harbor and you could even partially see the harbor from our hotel room. Oh well, I guess that's why the other hotels are more expensive in the area...the rooms are sound proof. If you're a sound sleeper and can sleep through loud noises, you'll love this hotel for the price. The carpet in the rooms was also very worn, but appeared clean. Parking was also $25! If the noise wasn't so bad, I would have given it 3 stars. BTW, my spouse is a heavy sleeper and even he had a terrible time sleeping until about 3 am. Great price, but excessive street noise

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite family hotel offered by Harbor Magic Club!”
Reviews.Author: Cheyejade
Reviews.Content: Harbor Magic Club has great hotels but if you are going with younger children, Brookshire is the way to go! The kids love the 'gold coins' they collect from various staff members that get turned in at the front desk for a piece of the treasure! The hotel makes everyone feel welcome and the kids feel special! The staff is wonderful and will provide you with whatever you need to make your stay with them as wonderful as can be. They do offer valet parking at a small cost. You will be able to find parking in the area at possibly a cheaper price but if you use their valet service you will be able to come and go as you please without incurring any new charges! As for the internet there is a charge but it is a bundled service that includes a bunch of other stuff and is a part of the room charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in great city.”
Reviews.Author: Dugenheim
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location more than anything, but the rooms were very, very quiet. Beds were great. Slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: szczecinam
Reviews.Content: Close to everything. We parked our car and walked everywhere from our hotel. The beds are very comfy. Rooms need to be redone...starting to show a lot of wear. That was the only disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Please replace dirty, gross carpeting”
Reviews.Author: heeler028
Reviews.Content: First of all . . . location and price were great . . . earning the unit we were in an average rating. But . . . carpet was disgusting. Need to have sofa and curtains replaced. We saw "no smoking" signs everywhere, but the hallway (4th floor) smelled like cigarette smoke so that was a little odd?? The bathroom seemed to have been re-done which was nice and the bed was comfortable and linens were clean and comfortable. Nice flat screen TVs. I am in hopes that maybe room by room this is being updated and maybe they hadn't gotten to our room on the 4th floor yet. As mentioned before, if the carpet and sofa was replaced I would upgrade this place to an above average stay, but until then . . . yuck! Should have taken pictures to post. Maybe would opt next time to spend a little more and stay at a better hotel, just fewer nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for families”
Reviews.Author: GoodTimes
Reviews.Content: I went with my sister and our children to Baltimore for a "road trip" and stayed one night at the Brookshire. It was really great. We parked our car and were able to walk everywhere. Prices for parking are on par with any other dowtown city area you visit. Every staff member we came into contact with was fantastic, from endulging our children with the "coin collection" (great idea for kids) to suggesting restaurants. "Mr. Dave" was great at the cloud lounge evening reception. The drinks were very nice and a wide range of snacks were offered (salad, cheese platter, crackers, chips, dips, veggie and fruit platters). We said you could easily make a light dinner out of the snacks. Breakfast also was very good and plentiful (waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, cereals, breads and sweets). The rooms do differ in layout and there are some spots where the ceilings are low but we were very comfortable. I will definitely return to the Brookshire for our next road trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: lfredin
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! The staff went above and beyond to make sure that we had everything we needed or wanted. We stayed in a 2 room executive suite. It was wonderful to have so much space when traveling with two young boys. The room was clean and the location was only a block away from the harbor. It was also nice to pull up to the curb and have our car parked for us. The Brookshire was great and my husband and I are planning to stay there next spring!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here regularly!”
Reviews.Author: LMS1966
Reviews.Content: Great location. Breakfast is wonderful. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for kids, service is spotless”
Reviews.Author: Leanne_Leanne_81
Reviews.Content: First impression was at 2am when my two children and I arrived after enduring several flight delays. Dennis [quietly] checked me in so as not to wake my 8 month old and allowed me to head up to the room while he rounded up a crib and carried our bags up. He thought enough to bring extra bottled water (free of charge) with him, offering it in case I needed to make more bottles. Impressive is all I can say. The character breakfast on Saturday was fun and my 5 year old had a blast. The variety was perfect and we enjoyed the view of the Harbor while we ate. Later that day we toured the Aquarium which was also great fun. The room was large and the separate area where the crib was placed allowed my daughter to sleep uninterrupted each night. This was a real treat for me! Overall, my first weekend away as a single mom proved to be fun and relaxing and this hotel allowed me ample opportunity to forget some worries and spend quality time with my children. I will most certainly be back! Leanne

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around experience”
Reviews.Author: RanDill
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, staff friendly and accommodating, room very nice and clean and the bed was so comfortable we did not want to leave. The evening social and breakfast buffet were great. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice all around”
Reviews.Author: JMonte40
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally lcoated and has full breakfast and free happy hour. Dave in the lounge is terrific and the frnt desk people are awesome. Ask for guy at desk (Dennis) to give you an idea of what to do and where to eat that won't break the bank. Nice rooms, comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: RogerRunnalls
Reviews.Content: What can I say but Denis Clark and Geoffrey Merriman made all the difference in my stay. I asked they took care of me in a polite & courteous manner. I would stay there again without hesitation. Very good for the business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was OK but I'd probably stay”
Reviews.Author: Uplyme
Reviews.Content: somewhere else next time. I booked the Brookshire Suites because my husband & I had to see doctors at Johns Hopkins. One of the reasons we chose this hotel was brecause there was a free shuttle to the medical center. However, the shuttle didn’t operate when we had to go, because the driver took his lunch break at that time. I feel there should have been a back up driver. I paid extra for a suite and it was comfortable if dark. There is free wifi but we could only access it from the breakfast room on the top floor. The breakfast bar was the best part which featured waffles as well as cereal, eggs, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “deceptive- sneaky”
Reviews.Author: kate325
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived for a trip we made reservations for months in advance. We had ordered a 2 bedroom suite. Upon arrival and check in, the girl at the desk never said a word to us that there was a problem with our room. She checked us in and allowed us to take all of our lugguge up to our room to discover that the gave us a room with 1 bed in it!!!!. We came back down to be told " well that is all we have, there is not ONE OTHER ROOM IN THE HOTEL AVAILABLE!!!" Yet they charged us for a 2 Bedroom Suite!!!! We kept saying they had to accomodate us somehow, and she just kept saying "there is NOTHING we can do- there are no rooms left! We demanded a manager, who tried to tell us the same thing! They game our room away to someone else! It wasn't until we said that the hotel was then going to have to re-imburse us for the cost of our weekend- as we arrived from out of state- that somehow miracously, the manager pulled a key out- to a 2 bedroom suite?????? Really??? Even the people behind us at the counter- could not believe they tried to pull this~

Reviews.Title: “Some good & bad points”
Reviews.Author: Utopian-DreamerDC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here during a recent stay in Baltimore. Our experience was "okay". There were some good & bad points. Good: Hotel staff was very friendly & helpful especially the gentleman at the breakfast buffet. Lobby furnishings are nice & modern. Within walking distance of inner harbor. Complimentary breakfast buffet. Bed was VERY comfy. Toiletries in bathroom were nice. Nice big flat screen TV in the room. Complimentary internet service Bad: Bathroom is very small & cramped. Our room was located right beside the elevator so it was very noisy & we barely got any sleep. Tried to get our room switched but the hotel was completely sold-out. Hotel has no parking lot or garage. You are pretty much forced to use the valet service at $29 a night. The valet service was pretty slow & the guy must have scraped a curb with my car because there was substantial damage to my front bumper when we got our car back. All in all, our experience was okay but I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: erie240
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff, very clean rooms, great breakfast buffet, 1 block to Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect - but the best value in the city.”
Reviews.Author: sssster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while in the city to catch a Baltimore Orioles game. Very nice facility. Comfortable beds. Absolutely wonderful staff! This place doen't have all the chrome and glitz of big name chains, but it doesn't pretend to. No WiFi in the rooms, but it is in the public areas. We did very much like the emphasis they have on environmental responsibility. The "Cloud Club" on the top floor is a nice feature. Breakfast and late afternoon drinks and appetizers are available there and it has lovely view of the inner harbor. This place is centrally located and you can easily walk to many restaurants and the harbor - or use the free "Circulator" bus service to get around. Catch the orange line just one block west. One drawback is parking. There is valet parking available for $29 a night plus tax. There may be self-park options nearby - ask the desk. Now, I say it's a drawback, but this is a city environment and I doubt any nearby hotels have any better parking solution. Parking is simply a pain in most cities.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with a magnificent view of the Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Kofibed
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “They were an excellent host and facility”
Reviews.Author: chesterclarke
Reviews.Content: We had a vietnam reunion at the hotel. We have had 8 reunions, and I often stay at hotels. The staff was extremely cooperative, more so than any hosting hotel I have ever stayed. My total experience with the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Brookshire has exceptional customer service and was perfect for traveling with two kids under 2!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaLorin
Reviews.Content: The staff caters to young kids, giving them coins to trade in for a treasure. The cribs were delivered without any glitches and the suite was perfect for giving my husband and I a little privacy at night. The location is ideal for all Inner Harbor activities. We will definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Brookshire Suites - Nicest staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: we B travlin'
Reviews.Content: I considered this hotel because of it's affiliation with Johns Hopkins Hospital, the shuttle service to & from the hospital, the Internet availability and parking. I chose this hotel due to the very pleasant and helpful reservation lady named Kirsten who graciously & patiently answered all of my questions & concerns. The fact that it is within walking distance to the Harbour was a nice plus. Every person I encountered there was pleasant, friendly & helpful whether at the front desk, the valet, the drivers or the housekeeper. True, the furnishings are not the most modern or luxurious- but they are clean & comfortable. True, there is traffic noises - to be expected - you are downtown. I live in a quiet country area & the noise did not bother me a bit. It was quite nice to have breakfast available, also.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and unclean, saved only by good service”
Reviews.Author: principata
Reviews.Content: Read it here - I'm not sure how this hotel gets so many 5 star reviews? Is it expectations/different standards, I'm not sure, but I will say this. Last summer I stayed at the Fairfield Inn about 5 blocks down the street (new hotel, and 'green') and it was WAY better than Brookshire. First, everything is dated. Sheets aren't real soft and fixtures in the rooms are from the 80's. Weird combo of updated TVs with really old lamps/furniture, etc. Second, the windows might as well be open, I moved rooms after the first was so loud, but both are noisy at night, no matter whether on a high or low floor. Third - bathrooms are SMALL. Staff is friendly and accomodating. That's the only saving grace. I spent a lot of time at the Marriott waterfront on this trip. That hotel and the Fairfield Inn seemed a LOT better - wish I could have stayed in one of those. Even the Hilton and Courtyard near the harbor seem to be in a better area of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: vacationbaltimore
Reviews.Content: we had a great time, the hotel was great, our room was very cozy and quiet, the cocktail that we recienved when we came in was great and the server was very freindly

Reviews.Title: “Other than getting a Free Inner Harbor room, no where else to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: masonjardrinkin
Reviews.Content: Quality, Value, Best Location, Best Views, Superior Staff, this hotel & its staff is a hidden gem in the center of the Baltimore's Inner Harbor. If staying in the Harbor area for entire stay, do what the staff suggests, park your car in the public parking garages for $21/day. If using car to travel in & around city use there Valet service @ $35/day ( much cheaper than going in & out of garages during day when to use car!!!!!).

Reviews.Title: “The best of...couldn't ask for better.”
Reviews.Author: irish717
Reviews.Content: The hotel had everything we needed, the cleanliness of the entire hotel is A+, the entire staff was pleasant and very helpful, our room was quiet and the breakfast was good. Since we were going on a cruise, the implementation of their "stay and cruise" program was fantastic as were the people inviolved in the "pickup and delivery" of us to and from the ship. We will definitely be staying here whenever we visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rtikul8tim
Reviews.Content: The service is really good. David in the Cloud Club is friendly and a great source of local information. Meredith and Courtney at the front desk will take care of any issues that might come up at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DMES
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels all over the world and can state without question that this hotel offered the very best guest service that I have ever experienced. The staff, including Meredith and Geoff at the front desk ,Dave in the Cloud Room and Ed , the bellman could not have been more welcoming, knowledgable or helpful. Thank you Meredith, Geoff, Dave and Ed for a wonderful few days as you made me feel like I was the only guest in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Brookshire!”
Reviews.Author: zekesidney
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have traveled to Baltimore and stayed at the Brookshire Suites. We stayed in a King Suite. The staff was courteous and helpful. Continental Breakfast is served daily until 9:30 (10:30 on weekends) and we had tickets for complimentary drinks later in the day. The wait staff was knowledgeable of the area and answered many of our questions. The hotel is located one block from the inner harbor and we love it's proximity to the inner harbor and Camden Yards. The hotel is a bit dated, but clean. The ceilings are bit low.....and if you are over 6' 3" it could be a problem in the shower......overall we were happy with this hotel and would stay again. The complimentary continental breakfast and evening drinks made this a decent bargain. This is an older hotel located one block from the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Like returning home after a prolonged absence”
Reviews.Author: KnitterSouthFlorida
Reviews.Content: The staff greeted us like long lost relatives and did all they could to make us happy and comfortable. The beds are so cozy-comfy that you don't want to get out of them. The Cloud Room is a great quiet spot to sit in the afternoon and look at the Harbor. It is walking distance to all manner of good things - our favorite is the American Visionary Arts Museum.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient,great staff,clean and great value. highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: babs067
Reviews.Content: All i can say is "GREAT" from the moment we pulled up we were greeted by all staff members. Our truck was brought to us almost immediately when we called the desk. The rooms are very nice, clean and cozy. If we had a question we were helped immediately. The cloud was great!!! Absolutely NO COMPLAINTS!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: tamkster
Reviews.Content: First of all I booked this hotel for two doubles, and when we went to check in at 3:00, an hour early, we were told all they had were kings left. Granted check in didn't start till 4:00. I asked about rollaways and they said they didn't have any they were all checked out for the day. Eventually after 4 phone calls they fixed the situation and got us two rollaways. This took over an hour to solve. The next joy was the happy hour which sounded great on line until you got there and there was one bartender for over 60 people. He was swamped and we waited in line only to finally get drinks with no place to sit down. Breakfast was a repeat of happy hour but the lines were longer and they ran out of forks. We did not arrive until 9a.m. for breakfast and the wait for waffles was over 30 minutes. It was finally time to check out and we went to get our car from the valet and come to find out he skimmed the top of the garage with our car. Luckily it was a rental. The room was a whole other issue. The bathroom was so small that you had to wedge yourself in to shut the door. Then their was this crazy bump out in the shower which made it almost impossible to take a shower if you were over 5'5''. The overall feeling was the price was good, the service was always two steps behind. They tried but they never succeeded. I think we will continue to stick with Hiltons and Marriotts-great rooms but even better service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BefwitanF
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip through Orbitz; paid around $150 for 1 night. Wonderful service (thank you Andrea (?), the assistant manager (?)). Rooms were clean; hotel is literally a 1/2 block from Inner Harbor. Will definitely be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed - feeling cheated”
Reviews.Author: mike5djw
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for a room with 2 double beds and a sofa sleeper - - Our kids will not sleep together. Upon checking in we found only 1 Queen bed. We called immediately down to the front desk. The first person said all of those rooms are sold out. When I went down and spoke to the assistant manager, she said, we do not even have rooms with 2 doubles. I showed her my printed travel itinerary, clearly showing 2 doubles on my reservation form. She said she would issue a full refund and apologized. I called up to the room and said come on down everyone, we have to leave.... Now, there has been no refund and they are giving us a runaround... They are now saying because I prepaid I cannot get a refund. My point is they did not have theroom I prepaid for, so what difference does it make if I prepaid. Here is what drives me crazy, the lobby was busy at the time she promised the refund, although I remained perfectly calm, It seems she was trying to avoid a scene and telling me whatever I wanted to hear just to get me to leave... Well, it worked, we left, and the refund still has not been processed, and now they have kept me on hold for 45 minutes... Then, they promised to call me right back. 3 hours later,and they have not called. I called again, and was given the manager's voicemail again..... Not only that... but upon inspecting my receipt, I find that the service charges were $31.20, on top of the agreed upon price of $152... On my receipt it states that the $152 includes all taxes and service fees.... So what is the extra $31.20 for???/ Parking was also $30 bucks, but we couldn't park there because the height limit is something like 6'6" and we had a roof rack full of stuff... We had to park 3 blocks away.... This height restriction is not noted anywhere on their website... Feeling cheated!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At a Comfortable Inner Harbor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vettebuf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Brookshire Suites a number of times while traveling to Baltimore for work. The hotel is on short block from the shops and restaurants at the Inner Harbor. This time I stayed for one night prior to a cruise to Bermuda leaving from Baltimore. I found out on cruisecritic.com that they had a special rate that included breakfast, 8 nights of free valet parking and the shuttle to and from the port. The rate for all of this was about the same as it would have cost for parking alone at the public cruise parking lot. We were greeted in a friendly and professional manner by Geoff at the front desk. Our room was clean and everything we needed was in it. Free hi-speed internet was included and worked well. One of the reasons I like to stay here is the breakfast that is served in the Cloud room. You get belgian waffles, eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, yogurt, muffins, juice, and coffee or tea and it's all included. We didn't have our labradoodle with us this time since we were getting on a cruise ship but she has stayed at Brookshire Suites several other times (for a $50 pet fee) and she gave it her pawprint of approval too.

Reviews.Title: “Made my whole family feel special!!!”
Reviews.Author: missunewman
Reviews.Content: I brought my family on a conference trip and fun was had by all!! Harbor Magic service for leisure activities was very helpful, they helped find something for everyone-my husband the history buff and my science loving daughter and dolphin loving other duaghter. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay special for everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce location, disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: spider2l
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and informative. We arrived prior to the 4PM advertised check-in time and were surprised to be penalized $20.00 for the privilage of checking in somewhat early. Beware, this is not an advertised policy! The room showed it age and use, and the bed was like sleeping in a hammock. The location was ideal for access to the inner harbor and there are plenty resturants nearby. Our purpose for choosing this hotel was the park-stay-cruise offer with parking for the duration of the cruise included in the price of the one-night stay. However, this hotel would not be a good choice for those traveling to Baltimore for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Simpson91
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Brookshire Suites. The staff was great from the moment we pulled up. The rooms were fantastic and breakast in the Cloud Club was a great way to start the day. Staff like David were very helpful with advice on sights to see and the easist routes to get there. My wife and I had a great time and were really pleased with the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great spring discount”
Reviews.Author: hml33
Reviews.Content: Pros: I greatly enjoyed my time at the Brookshire Suites. It is right in the heart of the city (about 2-3 blocks from the inner harbor). The valet service was very friendly and helpful (which is nice since the valet fee is quite high even for the heart of the city) but I found the clerks rather cold. They have a great happy hour reception and each guest received 2 free drinks, they also had a quite impressive free breakfast in the morning. The rooms were very comfortable and with their spring special I was able to reserve a suite. Although I did not use it apparently they have shuttle that will take you to each of their properties. cons: I had a very hard time finding a check in time which was fine since my room wasn't ready when I went to check in at 4:30. High valet fee. Overall I would stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is well staffed and run, in a great location near the Inner Harbor.”
Reviews.Author: cmass63
Reviews.Content: The Cloud Club reception is a great idea and a wonderful experience. An evening walk along the Inner Harbor was very relaxing. Complimentary breakfast was much more than I expected, with eggs, sausage, toast, fruit, and baked goods. Coffee, hot tea, juice, etc. The hotel is small but clean and well run. Parking is across the street and convenient. Next time I'm in Baltimore, I'll be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, secure place for a woman traveling alone.”
Reviews.Author: k07981
Reviews.Content: This smaller hotel is a little older, but is quite well-maintained and I found it to be very clean, and in a great location. The older fixtures in some areas add to the character and interest of the building. The bed and especially the pillows were very comfortable, and sirens on the street notwithstanding, the room was quiet. The top-floor lounge is a terrific place to sit and have breakfast or relax with a drink at the end of the workday. I like the small staff atmosphere, as well. It's nice to see the same few people throughout the visit - they get to know the guests and interact with them in a very comfortable way. Courtney, Meredith, and Geoff at the desk are very friendly, helpful, and ready to assist in any manner. David moves from role to role seamlessly and always with a smile, and his "How was your day?" is so genuine - it seems he really wants to know. As a business woman who travels solo a lot, I have to say I felt safe, secure, welcome, and well-cared for at this hotel and would not hesitate to send my own daughter to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, and Services for Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: JimH7464
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience for a trip to the Baltimore Inner Harbor with 3 young children. The hotel is a smaller quaint place that really worked to make us feel at home. They engage the children to meet the staff and provide a price included family friendly breakfast buffet and an evening cocktail and hor'dourve reception overlooking the inner harbor. From the time we made the reservation until we departed the staff was always working to better our stay. David made my kids feel like the evening reception was setup for them to watch cartoons and drink apple juice. Dennis and Courtney (and the rest of the front desk staff) did everything in their power to get us the transportation, reservations, and best service for our stay in Baltimore. Honestly the staff complements the location and quaint feel to make this the first choice for any subsequent trips to Baltimore (including my multiple business trips each year).

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great hotel and even better staff!!”
Reviews.Author: dougapher
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a Teach in Maryland job fair. The staff was unbelievable friendly and professional. Travis at the front desk was efficient and helpful. David, the jack of all trades, doorman, bell hop, cab getter, bartender was inceediluly concerned about making my stay the best possible. The hotel is an older hotel, but filled with character, very closed to the harbor. The breakfast was yummy, compete with breakfast potoes, sausage, fluffy eggs, bagels, rolls, juices and more, of course little pints of chocolate milk (childhood memories) The happy hour was nice, great view of harbor and city. The manager, Andrea, was supportive in getting an airline boarding pass printed out for me when I had trouble with the printer in the business center. She also assisted me in getting a shuttle to BWI. The whole stay was enjoyable and I will return to the Brookshire Suites!! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value and super service!”
Reviews.Author: Dustie74
Reviews.Content: We took the stay and the park and cruise package. great value. wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to staying here next yr”
Reviews.Author: SEBalgair
Reviews.Content: From time walked into lobby until left - wonderful service, friendly & helpful staff. We were there on a Thurs. night & enjoyed the complimentary evening cocktail reception & Ceasar Salad bar & the free breakfast was great. Also, as part of the "Harbor Magic" group - got to utilize some of the offerings of those other hotels. Of course the views from the Cloud Room just added to atmosphere. Special thanks to Michelle, David, Geoff, & Ian. They made us feel welcomed & were patient with our questions & helped us have a special visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Great location of the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JkHammer61
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire Suites was almost the perfect hotel. The location was great which is 1 block from the Inner Harbor, 4 blocks to Camden Yards. I truly enjoyed my stay and would definately stay again. By the way, the king size bed was extremely comfortable. The reason I said that the hotel is "almost perfect" is because it needs to be updated, but the hotel is well maintained and clean. There's many bars & restaurants within walking distance especially if you take the water taxi to "Fells Point" The breakfast buffet was good. I can't wait to go again especially wlhen baseball season begins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations. Very friendly and professional staff. Will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ramja
Reviews.Content: Close to everything the Inner Harbor has to offer. Awesome experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/value, couldn't ask for better!”
Reviews.Author: lptrot
Reviews.Content: Clean, cheap, good location, perfect! My only complaint is that the internet was very slow...

Reviews.Title: “Good value and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: familymom1801
Reviews.Content: We stayed under the National Aquarium package where the 2nd night was 50% off. The price was extremely good, considering it included a full breakfast and our tickets to the aquarium were included. We have traveled a good bit to major cities, so the valet parking price did not come as a suprise. I would have to say all the staff were wonderful. We were extremely impressed at how kid-friendly the place was. From the adopt a fish during your stay, the gold coins, and breakfast with Mr. Bite our 2 year old was very much the center of attention. The shuttle driver was wonderful and got us to different parts of the city so we could explore. Overall, I would give the service staff 5 stars. The hotel rooms are older and in need of an update soon. The bathrooms are very, very small. However, having the suite, more that made up for that. It was nice to put our daughter to bed in the living room area and then we could watch TV and read in our room. I did not feel it was dirty, in fact everything in our room appeared very clean, but there were some light stains on the carpet. Again, not a big deal to us, but if you are looking for really modern hotel, this might not be the best choice. We will be returning, just a matter of when.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Phlough
Reviews.Content: The room was awful. The hallway smelled so bad. The carpets had stains all over them. The ceiling had what appeared to be blood on it. Parts of the carpet were torn. The bathroom door would stick and was loud and difficult to shut. The remotes wouldn't work in bedroom or sitting area. The place felt dirty. On top of that, customer service was bad. They couldn't give recommendations for nearby parking. They don't have a kitchen and we were limited with restaurant recommends. There are signs for parking so we pulled in only to find that it was valet only and they charged us $29! We checked in at 9pm and asked the next morning if we could keep the car there while we walked to the harbor only to be told that they would charge us an additional 1/2 day even though we hadn't been there for 24 hours. It was $159 and we had stayed at the Marriott by the airport our first night for $120 and that one was FAR better.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!!!”
Reviews.Author: fincher44
Reviews.Content: 250.00!!!!!!! RIP OFF!!!!! We were looking forward to this trip based on reviews. No one said we would have to pay 29.00 to park. The receptionist was very slow and not very informative. The room overlooked an abandoned building with a bashed in window. The wallpaper was old and peeling off. The carpet was stained the ceilings needed painting. The bathroom door had some thing in the hinge that made you have to push really hard and it creaked really loud. Cheap paneled kitchen cupboards. Even my coffee had things loating in it, do not know if it was a dirty galss or just cheap coffee. It took two hours just to get a pizza on a Sunday night @ 9:00 p.m. Though the bed was comfortable there was a big hair in it:( . They would not let us leave our car with them while we wnt to the harbor for 2 hrs, They said we would have to pay a half days charge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: cstream
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not luxurious. But they were definitely clean and functional. The location of the hotel was ideal for easy access to the harbor and other downtown attractions. The hotel shuttle service was easy to use and prompt. Van drivers Roland and George were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good. Happy hour was inviting. The mascot, Mr. Bite, was awesome! And I can't say enough about the hotel staff. Front desk staff Geoff and Meredith were friendly, helpful and fun. They really enhanced our time there. Cloud Club care rep David made great drinks and had fantastic dinner suggestions. And even Jada at their sister property Pier 5 was very friendly and accommodating. Overall it was a great experience and we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service”
Reviews.Author: NCWilly
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Good service and a great room. The only problem we had was that we booked a room on their website for one night with a 12 day cruise stay (free parking) @ $109. On arrival, we were told that was not the correct rate and had to pay $129. However, the $109 rate was for a standard room, and the room they gave us for $129 was a very nice suite on the 11th floor, so we were not unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and overall staff with one exception...”
Reviews.Author: nursemarie987247
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the harbor and lots of kid-friendly attractions. My family has stayed here three times and have enjoyed the aquarium, port discovery and lots of unique shops. The rooms are quiet, spacious (except for slightly low ceilings) and are clean and comfortable with fridge and microwave which is important when traveling with kids. The staff at the desk is always wonderful and David in Club Cloud is a pleasure to speak with and is an excellent source of info for all things Baltimore. Unfortunately my complaint lies with the valet service. When we had last stayed here in the fall, my husband swore up and down that he had left a $10 bill in the console when he handed the valet the keys. He remembered putting $40 of gas in the car, paying with a $50 and placing that $10 change in the console. When we departed that money was gone but since neither of us were certain we had in fact left it in the car, we dismissed it and moved on. It left a bad taste in our mouths and diminished the fun we had a bit but it was over. We decided that when we returned in Feb or March we would leave a couple of dollars in the car to prove to ourselves that no employee of the hotel would steal from our car. That same valet (Brian, which is also my hubby's name and the reason we recalled it), parked our car on our recent Feb stay. He also returned it to us two days later and since we never called for our car over the duration of our visit, we have to assume that no one else was in it. Both of the $5 bills were missing and, unless someone broke into the car, left the navigation system, radio, etc and only took $10 in cash, we have to believe this valet stole the cash. My husband wanted to confront Brian but I convinced him it wasn't worth it and that we'd simply stay elsewhere on our next Baltimore visit. Its sad because the kids love the treasure chest and gold coins but we love the peace of mind knowing our car is safe more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at fair price”
Reviews.Author: SBK123
Reviews.Content: For the price, Brookshire is a wonderful place. It is very nice physically, has one of the best hotel beds in which I've slept and offered a generous breakfast. There is no reason to not stay there, unless one wants to stay directly on, rather than near to, the Inner Harbor. I've stayed in many hotels in many places. I highly recommend Brookshire Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel esp. cruise & park”
Reviews.Author: richstowe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the night prior to leaving on a 7 day cruise on their stay & park deal. It was GREAT. We arrived to find a valet waiting to park our car. Parking was in a serure inside car park. Check in was easy. We had booked a regular room but they gave us a one room suite. Sweet! Very nice . Had a mini kitchen and a large living room. Would be great if traveling with kids or for work. Only problem was toilet wouldn't stop running. Great bed. Nicely decorated. You could see the inner harbor from our room. Location was perfect with lots of restaurants a block away. Good shopping too. Breakfast was good although I didn't see any staff members there. Didn't matter. All we wanted was there. Great view from this room on top of the hotel. As stated above ,this was a pre-cruise stay. The shuttle arrangements were made and a towne car came exactly on time. There was another couple we shared the "limo" with. A little cramped but VERY nice. Much better then a mini-bus. Great stay. This hotel was part of a group of 3 hotels called Harbor Magic Hotels. Very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, well appointed rooms, nice breakfast buffet, pleasant free cocktail reception, great shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: FiddichGirl
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay, well appointed rooms, nice free breakfast buffet, pleasant free cocktail reception, great shuttle service, awesome value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Mengelhard
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was helpful and friendly especially David, Andrea and Ian. The rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. The hot breakfast was excellent and in a great venue with views of the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: flysky611
Reviews.Content: I have recently had the opportunity to stay at the Brookshire Suites a couple times on business. After staying at a few places in Baltimore, the one thing that stands out more than anything is the staff. They are extremely friendly and make you feel like you are at a home away from home. From now on, I will only choose Brookshire Suites as my hotel of choice for all trips to Brooklyn, be it business or pleasure. I highly recommend to anyone that prefers a classy, relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “I always come back to the Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: maryob66
Reviews.Content: Great Staff! David, and Joseph gave us special attention this time. We just love the Breakfast, and the Happy Hours are lovely as well. Good location to hop on and hop off the Circulator Bus. Easy walk (and I mean easy) to the Inner Harbor attractions. Amtrak stations on the Circulator Bus line.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER ENJOYABLE STAY AT BROOKSHIRE”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaChloe
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Brookshire a few times and we enjoyed the stay each time. We especially liked our room. There is a sitting room with a sofa bed and TV (where our 18 year old daughter can hang out and stay up as late as she wants) and the main bedroom with TV (where we hang out). Perfect for everyone. We also appreciate the refrigerator and coffee maker in the room. The staff is always friendly and helpful. They helped us celebrate my birthday by providing us with a very delicious chocolate cake, ballons, and a Happy Birthday sign. It was a wonderful surprise for me. And of course, one very nice aspect of the Brookshire is that it is walking distance to the Inner Harbor shops, restaurants, and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Classic Baltimore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlh1983
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire is an older building with all the updates of a brand new hotel. The lobby is beautifully decorated and we had a flawless check-in. They offer an evening cocktail reception as well as morning brunch to all guests. The room was very nicely decorated and loved having a little kitchen area. The bathroom though small is well put together with the room they have to work with. There was a lot of counter space in the bathroom and huge mirror for getting ready to go out. The ceilings of the room was low but that's a structural thing that they don't have any control over. I'm 5'11" and my husband is 6'2" and we were ok but anyone taller would probably have to duck their head in the doorways. It was very clean and comfortable bed. The hotel is located in the heart of the inner harbor so it's literally a 5-10 minute ride to any part of the city, Little Italy, Fells Point, Canton, Federal Hill, Mt.Vernon etc, that you would want to visit. I would definitely stay there again. If you're looking for something a little more grander, bigger and more modern their sister hotel, Pier 5, is a stones throw away and we've also stayed there and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Sigh of Relief”
Reviews.Author: chandler4
Reviews.Content: From the first phone call reservation to checkout the staff at Brookshire were excellent. Warm, friendly staff that were not over baring like in some hotels that try to sell the "extras". The shuttle rides are convenient, quick, and included in the destination fee! The only draw back is the low ceiling clearance in the rooms. I'm 6'3 and hit my head a few times going into the bedroom of the suite. If you're shorter than I am, no worries!

Reviews.Title: “I have no idea where all of these great reviews are coming from.”
Reviews.Author: LydiaClaire
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that the location of this hotel is wonderful and that in researching hotels, it was significantly cheaper than some other options. Those are the only two truly good things I can say about the place. I booked a room at the Brookshire Suites in large part due to the glowing reviews on this site. My problems started immediately. I couldn't get an email confirmation that accurately reflected the rate, package and days I was staying. It took several calls before I finally got a correct email. These problems arose even though I booked the room directly through the hotel site. On arrival, the front desk was confused about a $25 spa/food credit that was supposed to be part of my package. I was told that the woman at the front desk would speak with the manager and get back to me. I never heard anything back. The room was not what I expected. It was like a cave, and I was on the 9th floor. I'm not a tall person. Beware if you are. Portions of the ceiling are so low that I can touch them with my palms while standing flat footed (I am 5'4"). The carpet in my room was so poorly laid that it had huge creases in it. They were literally so big as to be tripping hazards. The bathroom is tiny and there is not one towel bar or hook on which to hang anything. There was a lot of dark hair in the shower that did not belong to me. The bed was very uncomfortable (very firm mattress and the sheets and blankets were arranged in such a way that it was hard to get the blankets up to your shoulders without unmaking the bed). The pillows were huge and very, very firm. I don't think the sheets were cotton (but admittedly I did not look at the label). The bed had one of those yucky, never gets washed comforters. The remote controls were almost impossible to use (they didn't seem to "talk" to the televisions). I thought it was an issue of batteries, but I requested a new one, and it didn't work either. I could go on and on about the problems with the room, but overall, mine was not comfortable and was quite shabby. The breakfast was average for a free hotel breakfast. I did not experience any of the great service other reviews reference, but even great service could not have fixed all of the other issues. Finally, when booking my room, the "destination fee" of $9.95 per night was not clear to me. When I said something to that effect at check in, the woman backed off from charging me and I was told that the package I booked was exempt. I guess that was true, but I looked at several package options and don't recall such a fee being evident with any of them, so it might be worth confirming before you book. I really wanted to like this hotel, but I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “What service!”
Reviews.Author: wilfros
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. Beautiful well apppointed rooms with flatscreen TVs in both livingroom and bedroom. But most of all is the personel at this hotel. Yesterday in the rain we wanted to walk the inner harbor and Courtney, at the front desk provided us with hers. What more can you ask for? This morning we wnt to the "Cloud" (a breakfast eating area at the top of the hotel with an pano view of the city) and met David. David iss the host of the breakfast area and talked with us for over 15 mins about the history of the hotel, sights in Baltimore and what ever was on our minds concerning our stay. I can't recommend this hotel high enough! It is a fantastic place for your stay in Baltimore. Thank you Brookshire Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't honor our pre-paid reservation”
Reviews.Author: SarahB112
Reviews.Content: I never got to stay here because they claimed the place was full, even though we had a pre-paid reservation. They "upgraded" us to a sister hotel, which was farther away from the baseball park, which is what we were in town for. The "upgraded" hotel also did not have free breakfast, another thing that is important to us in a hotel. The sister hotel was a more expensive place, but we got terrible service there, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven from the Hospital”
Reviews.Author: Kalindi-D
Reviews.Content: Accompanying my father on an extended hospital stay at Johns Hopkins, we cannot recommend this hotel more highly. From the free door-to-door shuttle service with extremely polite drivers (Rodney for one), friendly and informative reception (Courtney, Geoff & Jadeah), and highly appreciated evening service with drinks and appetizers (David-outstanding), we could not be treated better. A great respite from ICU that was so needed at a very tense and trying time. We thank all of the staff at the Berkshire!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Inner Harbour Hotel and Stay and Sail deal”
Reviews.Author: jackski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Brookshire Suites on a special "Stay and Sail" promotion through Harbour Magic which also covers Pier 5 hotel and Adm Fells Inn. We were leaving on the Carnival Pride to the Bahamas for seven days on Sunday and rather than pay $105 to park at the Port of Baltimore, we chose the Brookshire. For $150 total, we received a 2 room suite, free underground parking fro the trip, $25 gift cert for dinner at 6 eateries nearby, Sunday breakfast buffet, limo to and from the port and valet service on the car. Also got a $25 certificate for next time. It beat the hell out of driving 2 hours on sunday morning and paying $105 to park outside. Suite was huge with two 38 in TVs, dinning table, kitchen, living room and bedroom. Samantha and Ian we as good and friendly as they could be and made us feel right at home. The shuttle also took us to the Adm Fells Inn for free drinks and a short history of Fells Point.. We didn't take the ghost tour but it was available at no charge. The shuttle is provided and takes you around Fells Point to the other properties. When we got off the cruise we called the driver that took us to the ship and he picked us up, called the hotel for us and our car was ready when we got there. Just awesome service at a reasonable price. If you are going to visit the inner harbour and Fells Point, get a suite in this comfortable hotel. You won't be sorry. The rooms are $20 less but the extra room is very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “No problem using groupon”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTeresa
Reviews.Content: I just finished making a reservation using my groupon at the Brookshire for Saturday, Feb. 26. It seems the original expiration date of Feb. 22 was extended through the following weekend because of the response to the groupon offer. My daughter also was able to make a reservation for the same night at the Admiral Fell Inn. The person who took my reservation was courteous and very helpful. My husband and I are looking forward to staying at the Brookshire.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff was very friendly, great service, nice people.”
Reviews.Author: mikemccabe67
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and very wlling to assist with any question or need. Ian Buckley greeted us on arrival , parked the car and assisted us to our room . He became an instant friend. Great young man ! Samantha working the desk was also very pleasant and helpful. Assitant manager Andrea Carter understands how to treat and assist guests. Great operation.

Reviews.Title: “attemped to use groupon and received terrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: cmt311
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience attempting to use a groupon at the Brookshire Suites. The blackout dates listed on the groupon are only the beginning of the restrictions. Once the Brookshire Suites has sold an unspecified amount of rooms for any given day they will prohibit customers from using a groupon on that day, even though rooms are still available. Long story short, I now have paid for a night at this hotel via groupon that I can't use, even though they have availability. When I spoke to reservations about my situation, they said they couldn't help me, and referred me to Andrea at guest services. Andrea is apparently the assistant manager at the hotel, but she insisted she could not do anything to accommodate me, even though I was coming from out of town, and even though I had previously made a reservation online at the full price. She recognized that they were not sold out, but "likely would be" and refused to make any exception. She explained that the "Revenue Manager" sets the prices and blackouts, and he adds blackouts as he sees fit. As someone who has traveled extensively, I was appalled at the lack of customer service I received during this entire experience. I will not stay at the Brookshire Suites knowing how little they value their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Accomadating”
Reviews.Author: aross50
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here and was very pleased at the hotel and services. There were only 2 negative points that I would have to make about this hotel. 1. It is a non-smoking hotel (and I am a smoker - but for those of you who do not smoke, disregard this comment). 2. The rooms only had intenet in the living rooms. Although the quality of the on-line services was good, it was not wi-fi but ehternet, which limited it to the living room. Cables in the bedroom would be nice. Other than those two points, the hotel in general was outstanding. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff insured that my needs were satisfied. I would be remiss if I did not mention some specific staffers at this hotel that insured that my stay there was as comfortable and pleasurable as possible. 1. Andrea Carter, the assistant hotel manager. She was a valuable resource, as well as going above and beyond in order to help not only me, but many of my colleagues with details concerning room accessories and travel arrangements. 2. David Grossman, who was a valuable resource and helped insure morale of the group was maintained after we returned to the hotel in the evening. 3. Geoff Merriman, who was a great resource of things to do and places to go int eh evenings. Overall, my stay at the Brookshire was a wonderful experience and I would recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues for future travel.

Reviews.Title: “R&R In Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: travelfun070
Reviews.Content: Nice time in Baltimore. Close access to Inner Harbor, shuttle service nice feature. Room was clean, there was hole in the wall and shower curtain was old and ripped, but overall nice accomodations. Cocktails and breakfast at the cloud nice extra. David (aka John) was a great host!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jamn_and97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Brookshire for romantic getaways for years; back to before we had kids! This is the first trip we took with the boys (ages 7 and 4) and this was a blast. The room was great, the staff was wonderful to work with and the breakfast buffet was great as well! We had selected an Aquarium package and they everything ready for us when we checked in. The whole experience was wonderful and we'll be going back to the Brookshire Suites very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise value off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: mkemple
Reviews.Content: A garage renovated into a hotel with surprise value located slightly off the beaten path. Immaculately clean, all the essentials, hot shower, and friendly helpful staff from reception to David in the Cloud Room.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PET FRIENDLY HOTEL - and lots of free stuff!”
Reviews.Author: juanastx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Years Eve night with my husband and bulldog. Customer service is beyond great. My dog was greeted at the lobby just as I was. We were allowed early check-in at 11am, for an extra cost of only $20. Check out procedure was clearly stated in a booklet in the room. Location is central to food, garage parking, and grassy areas for your dog to use the bathroom (near neighboring hotel). Room comes with 2 bottles of water, free for each day you stay- awesome cuz i always get thirsty in hotels. Free morning breakfast was just what i needed after a long night of drinking; coffee, juice, fruit, cereal, waffles, eggs, and more. And we got a free bottle of sparkling wine and new years eve celebration accessories when we came back to our room. Had friends that stayed at Renaissance Harborplace Hotel, and were jealous of our hotel. Brookshire is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Challenger72
Reviews.Content: A group of colleagues and I planned to be in Baltimore in November for a convention. The other hotel we used last year was overpriced and impersonal. The reservations for the Brookshire were made last minute but couldn't have been better. The rooms we requested were not available upon check in and they upgraded us to suites with zero hassle. In fact, on their own insistance! After that it only got better. We received coupons for drinks and breakfast in the "cloud club", a nice lounge. Having checked in late we were afraid we missed their hospitality but the gentleman attending the club provided us with refreshments and made us feel at home. Everyone we had contact with at the hotel was friendly and eager to help. The clerks and bellhop knew the area well and suggested many sights to see and restaurants to visit. I don't normally rave about hotels since usually I'm just there to sleep, but in this case the accomodations helped make the trip so much more enjoyable. We definitely will be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Package”
Reviews.Author: PennMom1
Reviews.Content: We sailed on the Carnival Pride on 11/28 and was looking for a place to stay near inner harbor. Needless to say, we found the a great hotel. The package included the night's stay, breakfast, parking for the week and transportation to the port. We had a suite with a view of inner harbor, and the hotel was close to most things we were interested in. The room was clean and had a refrigerator and a microwave. The celings are a little low. It didn't bother us, but it might bother some people. Everyone was great and I am looking forward to our next trip to Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond. Unbeatable Harbor Location. Free shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: KStarrr
Reviews.Content: The staff was the friendliest and most helpful I've ever encountered. They went above & beyond to make our stay enjoyable. We got a queen suite, which has a spacious living room area with small fridge, and a small queen bedroom. Beds were soft, and fluffy making them a pleasure to sleep on. Bathroom, although nice with its granite counter tops, was tight. 2 people can't stand it it at the same time, which might make it tricky for someone traveling with kids. View was awesome (make sure to ask for harbor view). Location was fantastic, being literally across the street from the mall, and only 1 or 2 blocks from the harbor, all the shops, & restaurants. Also, there is a free hotel shuttle that takes you to various places in the harbor. Shuttle goes to The Admiral Fell Inn hotel in Fell's point, and Pier 5 hotel, Brookshire's sister properties. Plus there's a free cocktail reception and free events you can participate in at the hotel or the sister properties. The Admiral Fell in has a free ghost tour and Pier 5 has a free "Crabby Hour" cooking demonstration! Breakfast is free, but it wasn't the greatest. They served the same egg mash and strange mystery meat sausage every day. The upside is that there is a waffle-making station, so if you like waffles, I would suggest having the breakfast there. They also had muffins, so so fruit, and bagels. For dinner, since there is no restaurant on site, I would HIGHLY recommend taking the free shuttle to Fell's Point and walking to Tapas Adela for drinks & sizzling shrimp tapas, and The Black Olive for some of the best seafood in Bmore!

Reviews.Title: “Without hesitation I'd recommed to a friend.”
Reviews.Author: gingec
Reviews.Content: Very nice suite, excellent customer service. We're from Canada and arrived on Thanksgiving day. We forgot that most shops would be closed. The clerk went out of her way by contacting a local store for us to check if they were opened and their store hours. We stayed there 2 days prior to our cruise. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: tweefur
Reviews.Content: The staff really went out of their way to make us and our children feel welcomed. My sister and I got a great Groupon deal and took our kids just to get away for the night (we live close by). The hotel staff made the kids feel welcomed with their treasure chest game, and we enjoyed the complimentary happy hour (with finger foods) and the kids loved the complimentary hot breakfast (waffle maker!). We loved that it's a pet-friendly hotel...at no addtl cost! The rooms were clean (no dog smell!) and the bathrooms as well. Only thing I'd recommend is that the carpets in the rooms (at least in ours) needs to be updated...looked a little faded and worn (maybe from the pets?) and our view was not quite a view (brick wall of an adjacent building) but you are right downtown so go figure. In any case, I'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellant service.”
Reviews.Author: ferdinand0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the inner harbour where it is safe to walk around on your own. The staff was very service minded and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: FuatK
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. I liked the they had fridge and microwave range in the room. Very nice service from the hotel staff. Excellent breakfast. Some nice and thoughtful things were done to make stay really enjoyable for children. Our kids really loved collecting coins to get an access to the "treasure box" and they really had fun with the friendly sharck in the restraint. During this trip we visited Boston, Baltimore and Washington and stayed in 6 hotels in these cities. I would rank this hotel as number 1. Definitely would recommend to families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, in a good location and with very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jaguar7777777
Reviews.Content: First of all the only negative point. The carpets in our room were stained and need to be cleaned/changed. But the price and location, plus the friendliness of the staff are all excellent. The internet is free, as is the very good breakfast and in the evening you can have a free snack between 6.30 and 8 before going out to dinner (or maybe having a pizza delivered to your room instead!). Well done Brookshire Suites, especially to the staff member David who couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: 01Titan
Reviews.Content: We had a great night in Baltimore, the hotel was close to everything. It also offered shuttle service to other locations. The staff was friendly and we had a fun and relaxing time. Hope to do it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: chuckiek
Reviews.Content: The pros...great location and a very reasonable room rate, a nice two room suite, wonderful service from a very friendly staff, remarkably quiet even though it's center city. The just so sos...decor and style are a bit schmaltzy in spots (graphics are awful), charged us $20 early check in because we made good time on our trip, $29 per day valet parking charge is average for the area. The cons...although there are two flat screen tvs in the room, the remote controls are archaic...and take forever to switch channels, the carpet in the room was badly stained and needed replacement...I doubt cleaning would help at this point. We'd stay there again I'm sure...the pros far outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “good rate, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: njmomongo
Reviews.Content: Not too expensive considering how close it is to the harbor. Sister hotels have great perks that you can also participate in, free shuttle service to sister hotels that can get you to other sites in Baltimore. Nice free breakfast, pet friendly, helpful staff, park on your own in Arrow garage across the street. Great for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: EPatrick
Reviews.Content: Just checked out today from a quick getaway with a friend. Brookshire Suites exceeded my expectations as far as value, accommodations, location and the staff. We did have a problem when we were given the wrong type of room from what we reserved however, it was immediately handled by Susan who provided outstanding customer service and it was never a negative issue to the Brookshire Suites experience. Susan was extremely helpful with our questions about the best way of getting to and from some of the local sites.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: billmag2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was recommended by John Hopkins Hospital. I had an appointment with a Specialist at the hospital. My husband and i were pleasantly surprised at the excellent service given here. From the reception area/Managers and the host of the Cloud club. The Cloud club offers a great breakfast and a evening reception. Valet parking is available at the Brookshire Suites.If you chose to stay in you can order the latest movies or book a relaxing massage This hotel offers free shuttle service to its other hotels Pier5 and the admiral. Another fun thing is it is only 1 block away from the Harbor. It is so beautiful, many shops, restaurants, a science center & an Aquarium too! Have in Baltimore Maryland!

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Special”
Reviews.Author: drdon87
Reviews.Content: Living in New York and cruising out of Baltimore we wanted to arrive a day before and not have to rush about. We also wanted to see the Inner Harbor (it was a great bonus side trip.) Brookshire Suites had a very inviting offer for a pre-cruise stay.
