Included with your overnight stay is free parking for up to 8 days cruise, transfer to and from the port, an evening cocktail party and a nice breakfast, all complimentary. The suite was clean and spacious with very comfotable bed. Service was excellent, especially Susan and Asst Manager Andrea. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome, answer all of our questions and solve any of our dilemas. This is a great deal for anyone sailing out of Baltimore and a great way to start your vacation. One block from the center of the Inner Harbor makes it a great base of operation for sightseeing this attractive waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like coming home after a long day.”
Reviews.Author: lashhar
Reviews.Content: The service is unbeatable. Everyone knew us and greeted us upon coming back to the hotel. My daughter was there for Johns Hopkins and Andrea on the desk was always there for us with helpful suggestions and just general support. Jeffry, the valet, was always busy but never too busy to ask about us. The room was a little outdated but was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is within a block of the Inner Harbor with great shopping and restaurants. I haven"t been this impressed in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor Magic at Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: JLHoz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Brookshire Suites in downtown Baltimore over the holiday weekend. The hotel is one block from Harborplace at the Inner Harbor. Being in Baltimore for the first time, this was a perfect location to see as much of downtown Baltimore and several scenic locations on my list. The hotel is at the intersection of two free bus routes called the Charm City Circulator that takes you around downtown Baltimore. A water taxi stop is also located at Harborplace which will take you to Fells Point and several other attractions - more in season (April - September). There was a mix-up in my reservations with Travelocity (expedia, etc., same company - overbooked). Susan, at the front desk was extremely kind and offered water and assistance while Travis worked with other Harbor Magic Hotels and the local hotels to find me another suite of equal quality and only one block away for the night. The effort was outstanding whereas many others would leave you to fend for yourself with your travel agency. The next day I was relocated back to Brookshire for the remainder of my long weekend where the beds are comfy with extra thick mattresses and flat screen TVs in each room. There were also free breakfasts every morning and on weeknights the first couple of drinks are complimentary at their top floor lounge. There was parking available at the Hotel but, not having a car, I took the "Light Rail" from BWI Airport which was only 4-5 blocks away. The Harbor Magic Hotels also have a shuttle to take you to local sites and restaurants, upon availability. Within a block or two you also have restaurants, nighttime entertainment (10 Min. walk to the Power Plant), convenience stores and sports bars (like Dick's Last Resort, Hard Rock), not to mention the proximity to Camden Yards (Oriole Park) and M & T Stadium where the Ravens play football. You are a short 15 minute walk from "Little Italy" and Federal Hill. Make sure you take the Water Taxi ($10 all day) to Fells Point for steamed carbs at Riptide, O'brycki's or Mo's Pasta in Little Italy or just great mussels at Bertha's.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, helpful, Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Philadelphia_PaJay
Reviews.Content: I had to visit Johns Hopkins for a medical procedure and was travelling alone to Baltimore. I was slightly apprehensive about this trip and was not looking forward to it AT ALL. I am so glad I chose to stay at this hotel. The front desk staff put me immediately at ease. The valet parking was convenient. Check-in went smoothly. My room was very comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was perfect. There were scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, fresh fruits, many fruit juices, yoghurts, danish, muffins, coffee, tea: in short, a very filling breakfast. There was also a managers reception in the Cloud Club which I did not attend because I was not feeling well. There was a free shuttle service to the Johns Hopkins Medical Center. I waited for the shuttle and when it was not on time (remember, I had an appointment to make!) the lovely young lady and the car parking attendent came out to where I was standing. They gave me cash for my cab fare and hailed a cab for me! This was incredible hospitality. Some places would have shrugged and said: Oops! Not at this hotel. I cannot say enough good things about Brookshire Suites. THANK YOU! If I have to visit Baltimore again, I would definitely return to this hotel. BTW, it is VERY close to all the attractions of the Inner Harbor, perfect if your plans include a visit to all the city's tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful place!”
Reviews.Author: nini0305
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire Suites staff were incredibly helpful! From making phone calls, to helping with directions, making suggestions for visits, pouring drinks, you name it. The staff were gracious, hospitable, thoughtful... the list goes on! I can especially thank David (in the Cloud Club), Jada and Susan at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff- Cold Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: crkrts6
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation for my mother, her uncle & cousin. This is my mother's review as told to me. The staff was very nice. The location was convenient, about 2 blocks from the water. She used the valet parking. Although the parking deck was just across the street you had to back out of the hotel into the street to get your car there from the hotel and she felt it too risky for her to try. The breakfast was a really nice spread but everything was cold which made it unenjoyable. This was the standard all 3 mornings there so not just a fluke. They mentioned this to the breakfast staff but with no change of results. The room was nicely appointed although they ended up with rooms that had low ceilings. While the low ceilings felt a little confining, it wasn't a deal breaker. A minor inconvenience was that there was no place to hang your washcloths or towels in the bathroom. The hotel was able to accomodate a request for adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't do enough for us... what a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: mtcobbpa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here during a Parent's Weekend at her college. We were able to walk from the hotel to the Inner Harbor and enjoyed a great dinner while the boats came and went. The check-in and check-out were speedy and pleasant. Breakfast was great and the breakfast staff, like everywhere else in the hotel was so helpful and friendly. We used valet parking and could come and go as we pleased. The man from valet parking who picked up our car before we left made sure we had good directions to get home. Everyone was so attentive to us during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: annab1311
Reviews.Content: Hospitality, hospitality, hospitality from all the staff! Fantastic breakfast and afternoon welcome in the upper floor reception area - with a view of the harbor. Our suite style room was very nice with two double beds and flatscreen tv hung on the wall. The living room had nice couch, tv, internet, sink, refrigerator, and ice maker on our floor. Comfy beds and duvets. I am a Johns Hopkins patient that has to come up for treatment - I cannot imagine staying anywhere else. And look forward to the warm welcomes from the staff when I am there again in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience with top service!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbb28277
Reviews.Content: Our stay was one of the best hotel stays we have ever had. Despite the rain and only being in Baltimore for 1 night, the staff went out of their way to make my daughter's birthday a special night. Dave Gossman, the concierge, took such good care of us and even brought my daughter a birthday card and a box of chocolates up to our room for her. I can't say enough about his wonder attention and kindness. Jada at the front desk was so sweet and kind. Somehow our reservations were booked for the wrong day, and she was able to correct it without any incident and made it so that we were comfortable in our new room. My kids loved just hanging out in the Cloud Club that night and playing card games (given the rain). This is a wonderful idea that more hotel's should have to allow guests to spread out and relax. If I had only 1 request, it is that they need a full length mirror in the room and maybe one in the bedroom section of the room. If you have multiple people staying in the room, the bathroom is a little small and extra mirrors would help the other guests get ready quicker... But over all this is a fabulous hotel for the cost!!! Well worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, relaxing, inviting stay. Superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Pua111
Reviews.Content: I've never experienced a more courteous, accommodating and friendly staff! The hotel and rooms are just lovely. The morning breakfast is just great - wonderful coffee! The evening reception was an unexpected treat. Everything is clean and quiet. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: lindsaydel
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I went to Baltimore for a couple of days and had a great time! The hotel was within walking distance to a lot of the sites that we wanted to see. The staff were extremely friendly and even offered their advice on restaurants or offered to hold our things at the front desk when we went out. Rooms were a little cramped, but very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was decent and drink and snack nights were fun. Again, the staff upstairs were fantastic. Our shuttle was late picking us up for the airport and one of the staff let me use his cell phone when the front desk was busy and they were ready to call us a cab when we needed it. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel goes above and beyond any expectation you could have.”
Reviews.Author: hagmankay
Reviews.Content: We have stayed before and it was the exact same wonderful place. We could walk to everything and also enjoy boat rides day and night for one very low price of $10 per day. Every need or want responded to in minutes. I would also love to know the name of one of the employee........she was off work, and she was going to the game......we were also going to and we offered to share a cab............she was waiting for a friend who was stuck in traffic so she would not let us wait. She went one step further by going out to the cab and picking up the cost of the cab ride for us. We were totally amazed!!! All this and free breakfast as well as coctails and snacks .....................Fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Great price”
Reviews.Author: j1107
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again, just enough off the harbor not to be touristy but easy walking to all off downtown Baltimore. Came for our Anniversary and were never in need of service staff was personable and professional. The Cloud Lounge was a nice touch for cocktails and complementary breakfast the bartender attendant was excellent the food needed some TLC. Rooms were great loved the suite layout just beware if you are over 6'4" as we were told this was a parking garage converted to a hotel so the ceilings are low.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful find with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Captube
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at my share of the big Hiltons and Sheratons in my business travels, this was a very cozy and warm hotel where the staff was not only friendly but went out of there way to make our stay great. The relaxed atmosphere of the cloud club with all the great complimentary food and drinks was only enhanced by David Grossman who went above and beyond his job as a host. He made it a point to make everyone feel at home and welcome. Andrea Carter, the assistant Manager was also extremely helpful and enjoyable to talk to. The location was fantastic since it was so accessible to the conference center. I would heartily recommend the Brookshire to anyone who has business at the Baltimore Conference Center.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: twobells2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Brookshire Suites for 3 nights, our 1st trip to Baltimore. The hotel is convenientyly located a block from the Inner Harbor. There's a self park garage next door. The staff was very friendly and quite helpful, even booking a restaurant reservation for us during check-in. The room was a large corner 2-room suite that was very comfortable. Complimentary breakfast served on the top floor was convenient and made the total cost a real value. Was recommended by a family member from a stay earlier in the year. Would definitely return again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Eviker
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated a block from the Inner Harbor, this friendly hotel has everything you need for a stay in Baltimore. The shuttle service to their sister property in historic Fell's Point neighborhood means you get two walkable areas to enjoy; the bustle of the pier near the Aquarium and the and rough-and-ready charm of the waterfront neighborhood of Fell’s Point. The professional staff including front office manager Travis Daniels go far above expectations to help you plan a good visit. The hotel is pet-friendly and with most stay packages offers breakfast in the windowed lounge at the top of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Hiddem Gem”
Reviews.Author: Joe635
Reviews.Content: *** Located just one city block away from inner harbor. The staff at this hotel makes this the hidden gem in the city.We showed up in Baltimore on Saturday with no reservation. All the hotels in the city had been sold out due to the NY Yankees playing. Courtney,Jada and Becky were able to pull off some HARBOR MAGIC to free up a room. Thanks for all your help. The overnight front desk manager (Tad) was a true gentleman. There was one little problem that we had experienced with the room and I'm sure the front desk crew will never forget this one. The management should know that they handled it like pros.***

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: wpm60
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay when visiting on business in Baltimore. It is close to my client's offices and offers good restaurants in walking distance for evening dining. With breakfast included in the room charge I was able to get off to a good start quickly every day. The staff was accommodating and friendly. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable and HVAC worked fine. Because of its location close to the inner-harbor, there is a mix of business and vacationers staying at the hotel. This is not a problem. I will continue to stay at the Brookshire Suites whenever I have business in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “A/C was broke everyday we stayed except the last. Check A/C before going!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yanks42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here for our honeymoon. The service itself was great but the hotel could you some updates. First when we got there I knew there was going to be a problem because the room wasn't cold but and the air was on. It was blowing somewhat hot air. I thought it just needed some time but unfortunately it didn't work out that way. We stayed 3 nights 4 days. (M thru Th) and every night it was 85 to 90 in our room except for real late the 3rd night and we didn't care because we were leaving the next day. On tuesday the only thing they could do was give us a fan to push HOT air around THANKS FOR NOTHING. I was really looking forward to the hotel but this put a damper on our honeymoon. They did not bother to reduce our rate which I felt was appropriate. I would not recommend this hotel unless they are little better with their service if something does break. I fully understand things break but they should have taken care of there customers better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDip
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the man at the counter (Travis) was really great. He checked us in with no problem. They held on to our luggage because we couldn't get in until 4pm. The one bell hop, i don't remember his name, was awesome. He was our bartender at the happy hour they have in their restrurant on the last floor and he was so friendly and made sure that my family and I were happy. The happy hour was real nice and you can look out at the harbour. They are only a block away so it's easy to get around. Everyone else that we came in contact with at the hotel were wonderful. I can't wait to plan another trip there. My family and I will definitely stay at Brookshire.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Gill28860
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally situated and very close to the waterfront which is a `must see, must visit` for anyone visiting Baltimore. The service at the hotel was very good - all staff were very attentive and pleasant. The breakfasts were better than the average continental and were enjoyable. The suite was roomy with 2 television sets, fridge, coffee maker etc. The down side was that quite a lot of street noise can be heard into the early hours of the morning - the weekend day was the worst of the two nights we had. Also, travellers need to take care to stay around the tourist areas which are the safest places. There are some good Italian restaurants quite close by.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, centrally located, with reasonable prices, and a staff that ensures your complete satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Z2010
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Brookshire Suites while on vacation. We selected this hotel because it was conveniently located in the Inner Harbor and close to Camden Yards. The price was reasonable and we liked its appearance online. We were not disappointed at all. Our stay began with a staff was courteous and helpful. The suite was perfect for me, my wife, and two sons (17 and 20). It had a sleeping area and a "living" area that had a desk (with internet service included), second sink, and refrigerator. Each area had a large, widescreen TV. The room was clean/comfortable and a nice breakfast buffet was offered. We will definitely stay here on future visits to the Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Improved since 4 yrs ago”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Every August I go down to Baltimore for work. I've stayed at Brookshire 4 yrs ago and hated it because it felt so grimy and avoided it since then but this year our admin booked us there again because most other hotels in the area were all booked. I was dreading it but saw that the hotel was much improved since 4 years ago. Rooms, although a bit on the small side, were very clean and comfortable. The hotel is very small so there isn't a full business center, gym, restaurant, etc like the bigger hotels. But the location is great, you can walk to a lot of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Service extrordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: tblankenship
Reviews.Content: Before I went to Brookshire Suites I read some of the comments on Trip Advisor which concerned me. I called the hotel and discussed my concerns. The associate took the time to discuss each concern with me and assured me that if I had any concerns when I was at the hotel, just to let the staff know and that they would be taken care of. Before I went to Baltimore, they had a travel specialist call me to discuss things to do in Baltimore. This was extremely helpful since I didn't know much about the area. She was very patient with me as I asked a lot of questions. She also let me know a little bit about Harbor Magic which is the larger group to which the Brookshire Hotel belongs. The hotel is a block back from the inner harbor,easy, safe access to harbor. The suite that we were in was very roomy, extra nice and we could not hear noise from the street at all. The bed was comfy. Many updated features! The breakfast was great with many hot items, even a fresh waffle maker. Thay had lots of room for seating also. While we were in Baltimore I remembered that the travel specialist had recommended Obticky's (sp?) and said that this restaurant has been written up to be one of the places to eat "before you die". We asked the staff at the front desk of the Brookshire about it and if we could walk there. They made reservations for us WITH FREE DESSERT and offered to get transportation for us. They recommended NOT walking, a big thank you to them! I had a little trouble getting the internet to work in my room, called the front desk, they transferred me to an outside company who hooked me right up in minutes. When we wanted to go to the aquarium, I asked about tickets at the front desk. They had VIP tickets which meant that we didn't have to wait in line. I didn't know how sweet that was until I got to the aquarium and saw that LONG line (and it was raining). We walked right past the line, up tp the VIP doors and went in! Oh, and the Hotel shuttle drove us there. As we found out the shuttle is available to take you lots of places. I didn't have children with me but they have a gold coin program for kids. Children ask hotel staff for coins. When the child gets five coins, they get a prize out of the treasure chest in the hotel lobby. I saw a child ask two of the staff at the front desk for coins and they were so very sweet to the child. THAT was the icing on the cake for all of the wonderful treatment that we received which made for a wonderful long weekend getaway at the Brookshire.The staff goes out of their way for you. If you need help or have a problem, just let them know. They will take care of you and you will have a great stay in Baltimore at the Brookshire!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “Big room and great service with cool view breakfast buffet. Thank you.”
Reviews.Author: connie3369
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent trip the Courtney and David at the front desk really made the difference. They gave us great information on how to get around, what was available to visit, discounts available thru the hotel, and where locally to eat. Thank you all very much. The only downside is that they did not have a pool on location. However, the kids were too tired to go to the pool at the end of the day. Kids ages 11, 8, 6, &3

Reviews.Title: “No A/C = Terrible Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: psufan23
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday afternoon, looking for a relaxing anniversary weekend. When we entered the room, it felt like a sauna. We were told to adjust the settings and that it would be fine. WRONG. When we returned from dinner, it was no cooler than before and made sleeping unbearable. We complained the next morning, and were given one fan and were told that they were 'working on it'. By saturday evening, we were again sweating again, and mentioned it to the staff, who brought up another fan. Two fans blowing hot air in our faces was not conducive to sleep. Our romantic weekend away without the kids was a completely flop. To top it off, the remotes didn't work. The rooms were old and faded. Not what I expected for that price or by the website descriptions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly people”
Reviews.Author: lalala017
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in Brookshire. The staff here is nice. Tad, Jeff and Courtney were very helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great beds/linens, & great towels!”
Reviews.Author: mm1793
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't young kid friendly, but the staff were great (quick to meet our needs), the beds/linens were wonderful, and the towels were top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but Facility could use improvement”
Reviews.Author: krzw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly old and could you some updating/repairs. The air conditioning in my room was not fully functional and the toilet overflowed. However, as soon as I reported the problems, the staff was right on everything. They really went out of their way to help me and fix everything. I was having difficulty with setting the time on the clock in my room and Jeff, one of the front desk staff, accompanied me to my room to try to correct the problem. I also had difficulty with the internet connection on my laptop and the hotel immediately contacted two engineers to try to troubleshoot the problem. While they were unable to do so, they contacted a remote help desk who walked me thru the problem and resolved everything. The hotel really gets an A+ for service.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Manager was Great”
Reviews.Author: Kenya011
Reviews.Content: The room were smaller than expected for the price but my family and I had an incident where our car was broken into while in the hotel's valet parking and the hotel manager Travis was great and I loved the way he handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: ce913413
Reviews.Content: It was the worst experience I ever had staying at a hotel. We arrived on Friday night and noticed that the a/c was not really working in the suite they had, the front desk told us to change the settings, when we got back after going to dinner it was like a sauna!. It took forever to get a new room (in total 2 hours). I have 2 small children, and the oldest could not sleep since he was so uncomfortable. Finally, they placed us in I think the noisest rooms that they had - we could hear ALL traffic through out the WHOLE Night. So not only were we hot since the a/c really did not work in the new room we were also tired b/c of the noise. Next day, we were lucky enough to be placed in one of their sister hotels but that is after I complained many/many times!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for families”
Reviews.Author: aligiov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brookshire with three children, ages 13, 10 and 7. I chose this hotel because I was able to fit 5 people in one room at a reasonable rate. The hotel was very stylish and clean. Location was great - just 1 block from Baltimore's Inner Harbor. We purchased the aquarium package which gave us access to the aquarium and all the "extra charge" exhibits, with no wait! I highly reccommend it. We did encounter a few problems after check in: we found the A/C to be insufficiently cold and the tv remotes were not working. On our way out for the evening, we stopped at the front desk to let them know. After waiting on line (only one person was working the desk!) for 20 min., we spoke with Courtney and let her know about the issues, as well as requested a roll away for my son. She explained that A/C issues were hotel-wide and reminded us that roll-aways were not guaranteed, but provided IF available. This did not sit well with my husband (he was not paying almost $300 to sleep withut A/C in August!). Courtney politely told us that she would do her best to help us resolve the issues. We left for the evening and returned to find two fans and a roll-away set up in the room along with gift bags and goodies for my children. Lovely! We were also given a rate reduction due to the A/C issues. All in all, a lovely stay. Would definitely reccommed the Brookshire to a friend (traveling with a family). Probably would not feel the same had it not been for Courtney and her friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dark and dingy”
Reviews.Author: Mikew1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and were disappointed after all the glowing reviews. The lobby was fine, the staff was pleasant. Valet parking was $29 a night, with no other options for parking. We were on the first floor and noticed that the hallway was gloomy and not well-lit. As we approached, the guest next door was repeatedly opening and slamming his door in an effort to get his door lock to work. In our room, the first thing we saw was a scuffed wall with black marks on it. Looking around, the carpeting was quite worn and the room colors made it look dirty. The ceilings of the hotel are very low and this adds to the feeling of it being a bit shady. On the positive side, the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was very nice with continental breakfast offerings and eggs, sausage and belgian waffles. The hotel was only 1 block from the waterfront. And the rate was good compared to neighboring hotels. But based on appearance alone, we'll chose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mutiara7
Reviews.Content: The guy that helped us check in was amazing...he made the difference for us for sure. The staff were all very helpful...we liked the location, staff and atmosphere so we would stay there again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: 2happyinpa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night and were very pleased with this hotel. I mentioned we had just been married 3 days previously and they made sure we had a beatiful view of the Harbor (the hotel is 2 blocks from the Inner Harbor) and a bottle of wine with a very nice congratulations card was waiting in the room. A very nice touch. Staff was very plesant and the Romm while small was nice. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “itsallgood”
Reviews.Author: sunmoon1965
Reviews.Content: we had a great time staying in the Brookshire suite very nice room amd staff is great to they called me when the room was ready I was at the aqaurium with my family I am going to stay there again soon thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable with a warm, welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Squid789
Reviews.Content: Brookshire Suites is a smaller hotel with personal touches. You do not feel like a number when you enter the hotel lobby to check in. We were greeted warmly and told about the amenities offered. The beds were plush and very comfortable. We felt safe and relaxed. Our sons were there for hospital tests, so a shuttle service took them from the hotel directly to Johns Hopkins Hospital. The Cloud Room on the top floor had a wonderful breakfast, and there is coffee and tea available at all hours for guests. We plan to return to Baltimore and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Caycayma
Reviews.Content: The ceiling was so low that I (all 5'5" of me) could touch it! The rug was stained and I would not sit on the sofa. It is in a good location, but would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JGMPA
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend visiting Baltimore. Hotel was written up in the local paper. Our room was on the 8th floor. When we arrived the outside temperature was approaching 100 degrees and the hotel's air conditioning was being worked on. By the middle of the night the room temp was more comfortable. Unfortunately the street noise never reached the comfortable level. Obviously the builders never heard of sound insulation. Really, when you can hear the traffic signal indicator for the blind all the way up to the 8th floor, that's not good. Makes for a sleepless night. Should have paid more attention to a previous post on Trip Advisor about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: tromano17
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite based on other reviews and photos. The first room was filthy, rug stained, couch stained, smelled like wet dog (be aware that the fourth floor and lower allows pets). pull out bed a joke. Mattress was horrible at best. Manager agreed and moved our room. It was a little better but during first night air condition broke in most of hotel. By 11:30am still not fixed and I asked for a refund and help finding another hotel. Eventually they helped us move to Renaissance Harborside which is a magnificent clean,bright hotel right across the street and therefore steps from Inner harbor and well worth the money unlike this dump. The free breakfast was blah (hot foods cold), noise in the hotel from passing sirens ALL NIGHT LONG was brutal. By the way I went back to the hotel to pick up refund reciept at 10:30pm and air still not fixed in hotel. Based on some other review sites this happens alot!!! Manager and assistant managers and bellman are gems and so helpful and they should change hotels because they are better than the place they work.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: ticmeelmo3
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better experience in a hotel. Clean, within walkin distance to all attractions at the Harbor, very nice room. Entire staff we dealt with were friendly and courteous. Especially, Geoffrey who met us at the door when we arrived and helped us when we departed. Highly recomend this hotel for you stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: elchileno04
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and I went to baltimore to see the aquarium and everything else the inner harbor had to offer. We stayed here and it was great! its one block from the harbor and it is very conformable and nice. The breakfast was good and i am sure i would stay there again because it is pet friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience At Brookshire Hotel By The Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: LittleCody
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier that anticipated and was pleasantly surprised that our room was ready with everything we requested just as Andrea promised. Jeff greeted us upon arrival with a friendly welcome, took our bags upstairs and then car for valet parking. The room was spacious with a separate bedroom and kitchenette. Complimentary breakfast and pre-dinner buffet with drinks in the Cloud Club room was a nice touch looking out at the Inner Harbor water activity. On the following morning Susan at the front desk helped me and my little puppy navigate activities that morning. When it was time to leave Brian handled our bags, returned the car and provided the quickest route to navigate home. Thanks to Andrea and her staff we enjoyed our short stay so much that we already booked return reservations.

Reviews.Title: “2nd class citizens at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsbresnick
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 4 months in advance. My family and I show up and the manager says my reservation for a room with 2 beds can't be honored. Finally the mgr agrees to give us a room with 2 beds. We go out for a walk and when we get back, the room is gone. Mgr says he can't help. Apparently if you book through a "3rd party" like travelocity then you are a 2nd class citizen at this hotel. Right now we've been waiting an hour for a rolling bed. No luck. So far we've been treated like crap with terrible service. Been lied to several times by the mgr about our room. Who knows if well ever see the rolling bed. DO NOT RECOMMEND. AWFUL SERVICE. TREATS SOME CUSTOMERS LIKE 2nd CLASS.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILIES STAY HERE! do not even look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: daisymelisWF
Reviews.Content: I have been thinking about what to say about this hotel since the minute we arrived home last night (one load of laundry has just been started). As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by the most wonderful valet and front desk staff. From that second on, the “magic” never ceased. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. For example, the housekeeping noticed that we had a family of 4 and provided us with extra bottles of water and extra towels without asking. The Brookshire Suites was VERY family friendly—kids collect 5 gold coins from various hotels workers and then get to pick a prize out of the prize box! SUPER CUTE! The room was PERFECT for a family of 4-6. You can easily fit cribs and rollaways with no problems. We had a king suite with a decent size family area, dining area, bedroom and 2 closets. Keep in mind that it is a city and space is at a premium but the Brookshire was able to accommodate. The breakfast was delicious- make your own waffle bar, fruit, eggs, sausage, potatoes, and continental breakfast items all served on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the Inner Harbor. The BEST part of the breakfast was Saturday with Mr. Bite, the shark mascot. Super cute! My 2 year old fell in love with Miss Empress, (the shark chaperone) who also takes their pictures with Mr. Bite and gives the kids gifts (coloring books, stickers, crayons, cars). The location was great- one block to the middle of the Inner Harbor, so you can go right to the Science Museum/sports area or left to Fells Point/Port Discovery/Aquarium area. Everything was like a 5-10 minute walk down safe streets. Lastly, the free shuttle takes you between all the “happenings” at the other hotels- chocolate hour at Pier 5, ghosts stories at the Admiral Fell Inn and more!…AND Jackie, he shuttle bus driver, even dropped us a little farther past her “route” for dinner! What service! You will not be disappointed! Pros: “magical” staff Delicious breakfast Spectacular views from breakfast Location, location, location Price/value Cons: Vacant building next door (I had to pick something!)

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel that I would highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: robertveck
Reviews.Content: My wife, two year old son, our seven year old dog and myself were in Baltimore because my mom was in Johns Hopkins hospital. We were so pleased with the Brookshire Suites off of Lombard Street. The suite was clean and quiet, so we had a good night sleep. The living room was spacious, with a pullout couch and it had a separate bedroom. The bed was very comfortable, the staff was over the top helpful, and when you throw in the complimentary family friend breakfast, which wasn't just a few bagels and butter, but a full breakfast, the value was fantastic. If you have ever traveled with a pet, you know how hard it is to find good lodging. I can honestly say that it was one of the better hotel experiences that I have had at that price, and I have stayed in a lot of hotels!

Reviews.Title: “A most Courteous and Helpfull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swbutler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theBrookshire while our son was having surgery at Johns Hopkins. Your staff made the stay very relaxing and were most courteous. You usually do not find that much Courtesy north of the Mason Dixon Line. Susan, who worked at the desk, was very helpful with shuttles and directons. The elderly gentleman who was working the graveyard shift was also very helpfull and courteous even though we were checking in at 1:30 AM. We would highly recommend your establisment and plan on staying at either the Brookshire or one of the Harbor Magic hotels again in a about a month. Thank you for making a not so pleasant occasion a very relaxing and stress free trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: gordondad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the proximity & shuttle to Johns Hopkins Hospital. The beds were very comfortable. The artwork though is not PG. Ask for a room NOT on Lombard St (you will hear every bus, fire truck, car, etc.) Breakfast was very bountiful, but could do with some low fat/fat free choices. For the money it was a very good hotel to stay at. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful - even printed out a map for use to drive to Hopkins. If looking for a great place to eat, try Sabatino's very close by!

Reviews.Title: “Recommending to my friends and family”
Reviews.Author: kkauhane
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Brookshire for a bachelor party in Baltimore and the groom wanted to stay someplace near the Inner Harbor. We got three suits for our group of six and found the location to be fantastic, the amenities to be great, the rooms to be comfortable and the staff to be welcoming. I really liked the price we got with our AAA discount, especially since all of the other hotels we looked at were way more expensive and only offered double rooms. For essentially the same price, we were able to get suites with very comfortable queen beds and surprisingly comfortable queen pullout beds. But the best part was the location and the great full, hot breakfast buffet (which was an incredibly pleasant surprise that it wasn't just a continental breakfast) which was included in the price of the room! Try to find that anywhere near the Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mediocre overall”
Reviews.Author: qls200
Reviews.Content: Pros: - The location for the hotel is good, right near the inner harbor and close to most of the touristy spots. - It was overall very clean, the reception was friendly, check-in was quick. - The bathroom was clean and had all the toiletries which were refilled daily. - Bed was comfy. Cons: - The hotel itself is a bit dated, the room could use some updates. - They charge a $9.95 destination fee per night (for wireless, 2 bottles of water, and their shuttle service I think) - which we did not utilize but had no choice to opt out. - The hotel is on a busy street so noise could be an issue if you are on a lower floor. We were on the 6th so it was not bad with earplugs. - The nearby garages have better rate than the hotel valet. Upon check-out, someone also charged valet parking to our room even though we did not use the service (it was taken off after we argued). - The free breakfast was pretty bad. Powder eggs, cereal, sausage patties and some bread, we ended up eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, though shorthanded, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: BJMURFY
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful even though short handed and sometimes hard to find because they were doing so many jobs. Air conditioning in room didn't work and rooms were in serious need of updating. Great location downtown and close to Inner Harbor and Aquarium (we got a good deal with free aquarium tickets). Bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “While memory is still fresh”
Reviews.Author: Dominicanamerican
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week,Great location,Breakfast is adequate.Same every day.Waffles,scrambled eggs, cereal,...... Monday,Wed,.and Friday they have snacks and 2 drinks in the evening.Not Mon thru Friday.Get there early cause when they are out of snacks or drinks they don't bring more out.It is supposed to be till 7"30 but at 7"00 everything was picked up/ Rooms are very clean.Traffic is a problem when sleeping. My room 409.Beds are very comfy.No restaurant but a 24 hour Subway across the street and a block away from the Harbor restaurants. Good value all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: GalwayBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel becuase of all the great reviews online and was soooo disappointed. I have stayed at alot of hotels on business, 3 and 4 star but am not high maintenance, we just came from 3 days in a motel style resort in the shanandoah mountains. This was to be our splurge hotel after 3 nights in the mountains and it was not worth a splurge of $225/night at all. I booked the "suite" which was not sweet. Tiny, roms, tiny bathroom, facing a noisy street, low ceiling, a bag of dirty diapers in the closet, nicked and dinged up furniture, horrible room spray smell, and terrrible service. Was not greeted at the check in desk, I had to stand there and wait for them to finish their conversation to acknowledge me. Called down for a drain stopper twice at 7/730 pm for my 3 year olds bath and a service guy came 2 hours later with nothing and then another came at 11:30 pm at night with a complete new drain, almost pushing his way in after I said no way my son is sleeping and so were we! The breakfast was not nice, not enough seating, stale bread, old fruit. Again soooo disapponting, dont book it! The bed and flat screens TVs were nice but that does not a hotel make! Book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience, good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Pughappy3
Reviews.Content: Good location and easy to get a cab anywhere needed...food delivery and subway restraunt just across the street...convenient for quick hunger or just 1 block away the inner harbor with the Cheesecake Factory and lots of shopping. Gotta mention that Brian was most helpful at the front desk with checking us in, getting our luggage from the holding room, and serving us in the Cloud Room (which has a water view). Very pleasant, hospitable, and professional. BTW we had a comfortable room! All good no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Inner Harbor, take a cab or hike to other neighborhoods”
Reviews.Author: LibraryJoe
Reviews.Content: Great location for Inner Harbor visit. We stayed in the small standard room-- which was almost uncomfortably small, so can't comment about the majority of the suites. Hotel itself was clean,and staff were helpful and courteous. The price and location were great for visiting downtown Baltimore. The free breakfast was an excellent added bonus. Fells Point, Little Italy, and Harbor East are walkable, or a short cab ride or water taxi away. The Mount Vernon neighborhood is also worth exploring. Brookshire is a great hub for a Baltimore visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Employee's and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: mlscls
Reviews.Content: This was not the first time we've stayed at the Brookshire and it will not be the last!! We have always had an excellent experience while staying here, from the time we checked in until we checked out. I'm bad with remembering names, but the young lady and gentleman at the front desk was always helpful when we needed assistance. The Brookshire is only a block away from all the Inner Harbor action, making it very convenient to come and go as you please. On our most recent stay, we were in town to attend a geocaching event at the Maryland Science Center. We also visited the Aquarium and a bunch of the local stores and restaurants. We definately look forward to a return visit to the Brookshire!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ladychef2010
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Brookshire Suites several times, and they never disappoint. Me and my Fiance love to go there as a little getaway that is driving distance from Philly. Baltimore has alot of nice attractions that are either walking distance, or a REALLY short drive from Brookshire.It is in a prime location that is perfect for walking to the local Harbor attractions. When we first started going to the Harbor we used to check out all the local attractions and the staff are always knowledgable about the area. Now that we have been there several times, we are quite content to enjoy the comfort of our 2 room suite. The beds at the Brookshire are soo comfy you wont want to get up!! But then you do because you know there is a great breakfast buffet waiting for you in the Cloud Club. Did I mention breakfast is FREE!!!!!! And its a real Breakfast with bacon, sausage eggs etc. You can even make your own belgian waffle!!! Let me take a moment to talk about value. I almost dont want to tell you because if everybody starts going to the Brookshire I might have trouble getting a room. LOL Anyway This place is ALWAYS running some kind of BOGO deal!! We stayed for 2 nites in a 2 room suite, breakfast included, we received a $25 gift check for use at a few local resturants, right in the heart of the harbor for under $200 tax included!! You cant beat that! Customer service at the Brookshire is always excellent. i really have nothingn bad to say about this place, and if you are trying to decide where to stay while at the Harbor, you should stop looking and make your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “The location and great service we received will ensure a return stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yianni24
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Baltimore for a short overnight stay. We were there for an engagement party and our cousin recommended Brookshire Suites for our stay. We were very satisfied with the friendly and helpful staff and the great location. Tony was a nice guy who not only gave out coins to our little nieces and nephews but helped us out with our luggage and parking our vehicle to make us feel like it was safe for the night. The front desk staff was helpful in providing us with tickets for the aquarium so we ended up saving time not having to stay in a long Sunday line.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique hotel with a conscience.”
Reviews.Author: Mommysstillflabulous
Reviews.Content: The Pier 5 Hotel was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in in a long time. The service was great, the staff was accommodating and pleasant, and the aesthetics of the hotel itself were beautiful. We ate dinner and had drinks in the hotel bar/bistro, and the food was great. I also enjoyed my view of the harbor, the spacious room, and the east to access Wi-Fi. The hotel was in the heart of the Inner Harbor with easy walking to all of the hot spots and attractions. From the toiletries, to the vegan options on the menu in the hotel, I loved the "organic" feel of the entire experience. The room itself was spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. No cheap hotel "art" here! There was a big, flat screen that rivaled one I would see in any nice home. I *think* they allow pets. I did see a woman with a small dog. Finally, the staff was wonderful. I had two really great encounters with the desk. Very accommodating and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional first impression!”
Reviews.Author: pjrosen
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our experience at the Brookshire Suites was exceptional! The first thing that impressed me was how nicely decorated the main lobby was for Valentines Day weekend. Then I was really pleased with the free champagne offered as we arrived. It really helped kick off our stay on a positive note. Multiple times we received excellent assistance from a gentleman employee named Shelby. Please reward him for his efforts. I plan to stay again soon and am looking forward to it. Keep up the good work Brookshire Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, Breakfast, Value”
Reviews.Author: BillatSoulforce
Reviews.Content: Just finished an 8 day stay at the Brookshire Suites and it was a fantastic stay! Staff was really committed to fulfilling our every need...from Andrea, Brian and Travis on the front desk to Giovanny in the Cloud Room during breakfast to Claudia...the super conscious general manager...everyone genuinely wanted us to have a great stay! The beds are exceedingly plush and comfortable - the breakfasts are a delight and the afternoon happy hour (a complimentary or two per guest) is a great way to re-charge before heading out to all the restaurants and clubs within a short walk from the hotel. Quick valet parking combined with a high level of comfort makes this hotel one of the tru bargains in B'more! I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for any occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely service, excellent location, comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: veggiechk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my fiance and a friend on a week long road trip around the east coast- by far the most relaxing place I stayed! Hotel staff was friendly, pleasant, and attentive. We also had a dog on the trip- the staff was extremely warm with our dog as well- anyone with pets realizes that dogs are not always welcome at hotels. The location was beautiful!! A block from the harbor, this is one of the best locations. There is also a 24 hour subway restaurant next door that was convenient when the rest of Baltimore is closed down. The evening reception in the Cloud lounge was wonderful, as was breakfast. All in all, I wouldn't really think of staying anywhere else in Baltimore. Excellent stay! The only reason service got a 4 instead of 5 was because the valet parking was slightly backed up when we arrived and the traffic from the street was difficult to deal with when we were not even pulled into the garage yet... only took 5/10 minutes and we were set up!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Brookshire suites mad Magic”
Reviews.Author: brittbritt300
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay the Brookshire suites. The hotel was great the employee's were very helpful, the room was very comfortable and I will be visiting the hotel again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “The most rest I've had in along time.”
Reviews.Author: ladikiss
Reviews.Content: I loved the room. It was very spacious and clean. The bathroom was huge and clean. the beds were soft, but firm that gave us a goodnight sleep. I believe that this will be my first choice to stay when I come to the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to have a great time at the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: nickdelong
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Brookshire for a quick (3 night) get-away. We could not have been happier! This was our second time at the hotel, and it was even better than the first! It is situated at the perfect spot right on the inner harbor (about one block from the water). It is an easy walk to the aquarium, and many other inner harbor attractions. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. An especially nice addition were the in-hotel activities which are included with the normal nightly rate. We went to several of the events, either inside the Brookshire or at the sister hotel the Pier 5 (within walking distance), including free nightly wine receptions with hors d'oeuvres and even a cooking demonstration (we made crab crepes while sipping great local beer). Empress, who ran the cooking demo was so much fun! All of the staff, in fact, really went above and beyond to make sure we felt welcome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to see the harbor and have a great time doing it. We will be back ourselves very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!! Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: walshb20
Reviews.Content: Courtney Fisher has been very helpful . I am here for a cancer vaccine and she know that I haven't been feeling well. She went way out of her way to make me feel at home. I Look forward staying here even when I know that getting the vaccine isn't fun the people here make it all better. Thanks you all. Courtney thanks again for your beautiful smile........

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in a big city we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravelbird
Reviews.Content: Brookshire Hotel means what they say about their customer service. We stayed two nights and received nothing less than what they advertised. All the staff goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. Everyone there is willing to help you in anyway they can. From the parking attendants, to the front desk staff, to the staff working the breakfast and even other guests, everyone was willing to point us in the right direction. They can advise where to go around the city, where not to go as well as how to get there. We were in Baltimore for Johns Hopkins Medicine. The hotel took us to and from the hospital for FREE. They parked our car for us so we did not have to worry about it. We were not sure where to go for dinner one night so everyone gave us their input then the hotel arranged for the restaurant to come pick us up and bring us back! The beds were unbelievably comfortable! The room was clean, spacious and relaxing. Anything you need, I'm almost positive this hotel can get it for you. The breakfast is delicious. We had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, bagels and much more to choose from! They have coffee, tea, and wide juice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start but it got better”
Reviews.Author: mcook6680
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel and our room was not ready yet. We decided to take the shuttle that the hotel provides to guests to the inner harbor area for lunch but it was running an hour behind schedule. We decided to walk. We finally checked in and our room was FILTHY, so the hotel switched our room to a much nicer one. The hotel manager (I believe her name was Claudia) wasquite generous and ensured that the proper wine and beer was delivered to our room. We were ready to head to happy hour at the Pier 5 hotel and once again the shuttle was running behind schedule so we decided to stay at the here at the hotel for the complimentary happy hour. This is were our day took a turn for the better. Dorien, the bartender at happy hour, truly made our day. He was great!! He turned a terrible day into a much better one. We were not happy thus far and Dorien was able to turn our day around. So much so that I came right back to the room to comment. I hope the rest of our stay continues to be positive, but I am skeptical.

Reviews.Title: “Snowstorm no match for staff at Brookshire Suites!”
Reviews.Author: mbamor51
Reviews.Content: Even in the midst of Baltimore's worst snowstorm in DECADES, the staff of Brookshire Suites went out of their way to accomodate us ......from trying to find us taxis(almost impossible) to clearing paths in the snow for my husband when he was discharged from Johns Hopkins after surgery. The complimentary breakfast in the Cloud Room was delightful. Shuttle service to the hospital was such a convenience.From Andrea at the front desk,to the manager at the Cloud Room, to Debbie who drove the shuttle that snowy night, to the gentleman who brought us our car.....all went above and beyond! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a great value.”
Reviews.Author: MileFilms
Reviews.Content: A short block down the street from the Inner Harbor and the fantastic National Aquarium, within a very short cab trip to the amazing American Museum of Visionary Art or Little Italy, the Brookshire Suites is ideally situated. With free breakfast, and two room suites, it was a great bargain for taking my family. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Friendly and Outgoing”
Reviews.Author: soshoreqt
Reviews.Content: As an employee of Johns Hopkins and a resident of Baltimore County, I normally wouldn't need to stay at a downtown hotel. But, when the"Blizzard of 2010" rolled through, I didn't have much of a choice. After explaining to the reservation agent on the phone my situation, she secured a room for me at a great rate. I showed up to the hotel and encountered Travis, who was working the front desk. He was VERY helpful, courteous and despite having been stuck there himself, on his birthday weekend, still had a smile on his face and gave me all of the info I needed. He was great. I got up to my room and it was HUGE and really really nice. The shower was hot, the soap was really cool! (If you see it you'll know what I was talking about). Nap time! Slept until like 1am, then went down and encountered Courtney? I think that was her name. We just started chatting and then an hour or so later back to my room :) Slept until breakfast the next day. Which was Delicious! I expected like continental, etc. but it was eggs and bacon and sausage.and great :) Check out was amazing...Andrea was SO helpful in securing me a cab, which cost me an arm and a leg, but the day after a blizzard, I guess it was worth it. The only issue I had was the lack of food and how expensive what they did have was. Everything else was A+++!! Thank you Brookshire!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very caring and supportive personell”
Reviews.Author: Coolidge62
Reviews.Content: My husband was having surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital and we stayed the night before his surgery and I stayed there for two more nights. The accomodations were excellent and the staff were very caring and attentive. Tad was on duty several of the days that I left very early to go to the hospital and he was very sensitive and caring in his concern for me and my husband. Al, the bellman was also very concerned and thoughtful when we arrived and each day when I returned. It is one thing to have a good facility but even more important when your staff are welcoming and accomodating. I would be happy to recommend Brookshires Suites to other friends and families. I trust that we can be with you again on a more pleasant occasion. Thank you for your excellent service. Anna Farrell

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: brzhech
Reviews.Content: We traveled from Philadelphia to see the Baltimore aquarium and ended up at the Brookshire. From checkin we were treated like royalty. Agostinas quickly checked us in while Al parked our car. She told us about a happy hour on the 12th floor. When we arrived it was busy but Dorien showed us the attention that made us feel like we were the only ones there! The next day, we went to the aquarium while the hotel cheerfully held our luggage until we were ready to check out. We will definitely return this summer to do it all over again. We will always stay here!

Reviews.Title: “awesome cutomer service”
Reviews.Author: malagirl
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend! saw zappa plays zappa at rams head. Got the BOGO at Brookshire with a dinner voucher and drink passes. Had a few drinks with the wonderful bartenders Dorien and Catherine. This was a great bday present to my boyfriend....and we were able to bring our doggy too!! Definitely come to this place!

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: luzePa
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year old son and I returned to the Brookshire Suites in Jan (we were there the previous year in March). We came back because we loved it there - friendly and knowledgeable staff, affordable, spacious rooms with breakfast included. Our first trip we got the package deal to the acquarium - fantastic deal. Our second trip, we took the two nights, second night free offer. Have not been disappointed at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: DenverSSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brookshire for the second time. I was very impressed with the service and the rooms the first time and I was not disappointed this time. I had a particular good experience with Dorien Murphy. He was our host during Happy Hour and he took the time to stop by our table and chat with us. I noticed that he did that with everybody. That extra step made us feel very welcome. I would also like to mention the exceptional service of the Front Desk Personnel. Thank you for making my stay very enjoyable. Hopefully, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LuciaNY
Reviews.Content: I am here for a cancer vaccine study. I picked Brookshire Suites to stay because everyone is so friendly and helpful. Brian is very helpful at the front desk when we have answers. Thanks for everything. Rein

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel near inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: lrw033
Reviews.Content: great location, very helpful staff, internet included in the cost, nicely appointed rooms, hot buffet breakfast included each morning, wine/cheese evening receptions included each night. Dorien Murphy was especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small in Size, Big in Service”
Reviews.Author: MagicalDreams
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Brookshire Hotel in downtown Baltimore for over ten years now. I love the Magic this hotel brings to its customers during the New Years Eve Celebration. The staff is always friendly, courteous and quick to accomodate you, no matter what the request. I especially want to thank Ms. Andrea Carter/Front desk Manager. She really looked out for me. Originally my request for a HarborView room was not honor. I usually call in October to make sure that I recieve what I want, but somehow the accomodations were not what I had expected. Ms. Carter was very professional and tried her best to fix the problem. She even allowed me to look at two more rooms. She was gracious enough to keep looking for a cancellation. She mentioned that she would extend my cancellation time, so that I would have more time to think about whether I wanted to stay or not. Needless to say Ms. Carter saved the day and made Magic by getting me the room I requested. I was more then thrilled! Breakfast is always great. The cotton club is beatifully decorated, and it has a great view of the water. The complimentary drink of Merlot also made a diffrence. The bottle of champayne and New Years Eve party favors that showed up at my door were perfect. The staff was always smiling, especially (Shelby/A porter). They presented the kids with gold coins to purchase treasures from the beautifully adorned treasure basket. My stay was lovely and Extremely Magical! I love staying at the Brooksire Gwen Lloyd

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: randdlady
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Brookshire Suites. We arrived to the hotel late at night and the staff were very kind. They helped us get all our things to our room and helped us with directions to our destination the next day. They were very friendly and made our experience very pleasant, and stress free. Our suite was very nice and comfortable and we were very glad that we had chosen to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great! better than i expected!”
Reviews.Author: tocori007
Reviews.Content: From the pictures the hotel looked nice but i still didnt expect it to be nearly as nice as it was. Everything was great from the rooms to the breakfast buffet, and all employees where pleasant. I would definetly recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't ask for a better stay”
Reviews.Author: Skyflash10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brookshire suites for a visit to Johns Hopkins Medical School. I was pleasantly surprised at first by the friendliness of the staff when I checked in. I stayed in a suite with king size bed and the room was flawless. It was clean, spacious, modern and very quiet. The air control was easy to use and silent, unlike the air conditioning units you find in many other hotels. The bathroom was spotless, well-stocked with towels and supplies, and the water temperature/pressure was perfect. The hotel was gracious enough to provide evening refreshments including wine and cheese that were complimentary. The complimentary breakfast was complete, offerred a great variety, and fresh. Checking out was a breeze and the shuttle to the university was on time and courteous. Finally, the location is ideal. It is a block away from the inner harbor and only a mile or two from Hopkins or other great neighborhoods. In summary, I have done a lot of traveling and the Brookshire suites is one of the only hotels where I felt "at home" and felt that they were happy to have me as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, What an amazing time had and all because of the Brookshire Suites.”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveltime
Reviews.Content: Our trip started because as a family we really needed to get away together. With a preteen and younger child we just don't seem to have enough time together. We did not think we would be able to go because of the money and holidays coming up. Well Travis at Brookshire Suites took care of that. He made sure not only were we taken care of but that we were treated like royalty and got the best deals. I was really empressed with his service and customer service. The entire hotel was like that. They had cute programs for the kids, awesome breakfast and a nice lounge area. We were given several activies to do included in our rate. We really had a great time, or should I say awesome!

Reviews.Title: “A HUGE DiSSAPOINTMENT IN EVERY WAY IMAGINABLE”
Reviews.Author: kidzatheart
Reviews.Content: Not sure where all the great reviews for this hotel come from...Our room had no working fridge, a dirty bathroom, and a "view" to a brick wall building 20 feet away. The breakfast buffet was only fair...the eggs, pancakes, bacon and sausage were all luke-warm. There were no vending machines. The elevators were extremely dirty with smudges of who knows what all over the doors. Also, there is no room-service! If you want room service, you have to call a nearby restaurant. The walls are paper-thin...we could hear the people in the next room going to the bathroom. This is a highly over-rated hotel, and I would NEVER stay there again. The ceilings are low, and the with the exception of the "cloud club", the entire place is very dark. Oh, and housekeeping didn't bother to show up until our 2nd night there, and by that time we were getting ready to go to dinner, so it was not an appropriate time for them to decide to come clean the room. Also, be aware, there is a lot of construction going on on Lombard Street, so the entire thing is pretty chaotic. A big thumbs down for this dreadful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to enjoy a birthday.”
Reviews.Author: lisadavis530
Reviews.Content: The trip was a birthday pressent for a special freind. The hotel made this experience very exciting and something that he will remember for a lon time to come. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and convenient to the harbor. Every place that we went was in walking distance. The hotel provided free breakfast which we found to be great. there was a gentle man on the night that we arrived. We were entitled to complimentary drinks for happy hour in the cloud club I beleive his name was Devon. He made sure we received complimentary passes for all the activities for nightlife for our stay. We had a ball and will be returning some time next year.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: steelerfans07
Reviews.Content: We had just lost our 23 yr. old son 3 months ago, and really needed to get away. It was wonderful going somewhere where no one new us and your employees at the Brookshire Suites couldn't have been more accommodating. When you have someone like Al Canty greeting you upon arrival, we knew we had picked the right spot. He was so friendly and recommended a fantastic place for us to have dinner our first night in Baltimore. We checked in with Brian Harrington who was more than eager to get us into our room since we had just driven 5 hours. My husband wanted ice and the machine on our floor wasn’t working, so when he called down to Brian, he immediately sent Al up with the ice. On the second night we had a small problem, and again, immediately handled by Brian and Al. The location of the Brookshire was convenient, clean but more so one of the friendliest places I have been in a long time. As a retire flight attendant/travel agent I would highly recommend the Brookshire Suites and tell Al and Brian we said Hi!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Price Great People”
Reviews.Author: CaptainDRockville_MD
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire is conveniently located to both the Inner Harbour and Ravens Stadium. The hotel is clean, in a nice section of town and the people were friendly. I recommend this hotel to any one who wants to stay in the area. Much nicer 'feel' than the large chain hotels. As an added bonus the breakfast was a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Botique Hotel at regular chain prices”
Reviews.Author: bplus187
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Brookshire Inn & Suites in Baltimore, MD for just one night. We stay overnight in Baltimore about 10 times per year and never noticed this hotel before. Everything about it was unique. It was very clean and offered free WIFI which is a nice touch. I didn't get the feel of a chain hotel when I stayed here. It was a more personal experience and had much more personality. I saw as I was leaving that it is part of a family of Hotels (Pier 5 and Admiral Fell's) which are both known for their superior quality compared to a chain hotel. As we were checking out, I wasn't sure whether we had to sign a piece of paper or what the procedure was, so as I was going to stand in a 5 deep line, the valet or bellman came up to us and said there was no need to stand in line, as long as the bill looked ok we could just leave. That saved us at least 10-15 minutes of waiting in line as others checked in. Highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Majorcasemully
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for 6 years. The hotel goes above and beyond any other.Great location,great staff,great breakfast and great managers reception in the evening. Close to everything and their shuttle will take you where you need to go. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE. Kenny Mullins,Florida

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: egracep2
Reviews.Content: The whole staff was attentive, efficient and accomodating. Each person went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and enjoying our stay. The cloud club receptions were great - a perfect way to end our work days. Every bartender was friendly and welcoming - Dorien in particular was fantastic. He made us feel like VIPs!

Reviews.Title: “The Brookshire is trendy, comfy, and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: bfrist
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, a great experience. The suites was roomy and the staff were customer focused. The Brookshire hosts a daily complementary cocktail hour for guests and our host of the evening, Dorien, showed a sincere interest in the guests' experience, whether it was catering to their special requests or simply answering questions about the hotel or the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff made an exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: Lobomojo
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire Suites has one of the best, most efficient, and friendliest staff I've had the pleasure to encounter and the primary factor in making the stay memorable and a joy. It is well located, our corner room had a view of the Inner Harbor, and was convenient to Johns Hopkins, downtown and Fells Point. A very efficient free shuttle service provide timely rides to Johns Hopkins, Little Italy and Fells Point.. A complimentary hot breakfast, though not posh, is a convenient start to the day and a free happy hour with cheese and snacks closes the day in a relaxing manner with a great view for both from the top floor. The suites are very clean, provide privacy with two sleeping areas, the bedroom and living area with sleeper sofa. Both rooms have very large flat screens, and a nice touch, the bath room is not in the bedroom to avoid disturbing the bedroom occupant. A small sink, microwave and refrigerator are off the living area as well. It seems a bit unfair to single any of the staff out, as all were wonderful, but we will give special mention to Andrea at the front desk, who is very kind and always asked about our well being, Dory (sp?) at happy hour who brought a relaxing and happy end to the days, the night bellmen with their very helpful tips and friendliness, and the lovely and gracious Claudia, who gave great recommendations, runs such a friendly and tight efficient operation and overall assured a great stay and desire to return soon, which we plan to do next month.

Reviews.Title: “Your treated like family.”
Reviews.Author: knuck4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great part of Baltimore near all the Inner Harbour attractions and great restautants. If you need to get medical attention at Johns Hopkins the hotel offers shuttle service to and from your appointments. We will continue to stay at the Brookshire Suites when we are traveling to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great service and great value too.”
Reviews.Author: LeeSchwartz
Reviews.Content: As a regular user of Trip Advisor reviews to make my lodging choices, I wanted to pass my recommendation for the Brookshire Suites on to others. This will be a lengthy review so if you want the bottom line, as the heading says, I found the Brookshire to have a great location, great people, great service, and great value. This was not a short-term stay. For 21 days in October and November, the Brookshire served as my "home away from home.” When you stay in one hotel for that long, comfort and good service aren’t just extras, they are necessities. THE STAFF: The staff at the Brook (as they call it in Baltimore) was uniformly excellent. They went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed to make my stay not only tolerable but also enjoyable. Andrea, Agostina, Geoffrey, and Tad always greeted me by name, asked how things were going and if there was any way they could do to help me. Repeatedly they took care of the little things in a way that showed they cared. One example out of many: I dropped off my dry-cleaning a hour too late for pick-up but I needed it for the nest day’s meeting. They got it to the drycleaners and back to me that night. Rooms can get pretty cluttered when you’re there on business as long as I was but Maria kept the room clean and tidy. I didn’t get this treatment just because I was staying there for a lengthy time. I saw the staff give the same level of service to everyone who were guests of the hotel. THE SUITE: I had an Executive King Suite. Very spacious. Nice living room with a large flat-screen TV. Good working area. Mini-kitchen area with a refrigerator and microwave. Two bottles of Poland water dropped off in the room every morning. Hugh bed in a large bedroom. Average sized bathroom but everything worked including the bathtub drain, (One of my personal bugaboos are bathtubs that fill up with water while you shower because the drains are slow.) You’ll read in some reviews that the ceilings are lower than in other hotels. They are but I never had a problem with the height and I’m over 6 foot. I didn’t have a view but, given I was there on business, didn’t need one. The only, very minor, quibble I had during my stay was the mini-kitchen didn’t have any dinnerware, not even a bottle opener or a corkscrew. This was easily remedied with the purchase of some plastic dinnerware but it would have been nice to have some already in the room. There was a convenient coin-operated laundry across the hall ($1.75 for washer and dryer.) Be aware this is not a brand-new hotel so not everything is in pristine condition anymore than it would be at your house. But the facilities are clean and well kept up. THE LOCATION: The Brook is about one block from the Inner Harbor. Easy walking distance to most of the attractions, including the Aquarium. Lots of good shopping and restaurants nearby. Always felt safe and secure in the area. Well lit and plenty of street traffic. Three very good dining establishments within a block of the Brook (Burkes, Velleggia’s and Peter’s Pour House). 24 hour Subway kitty-corner to the Brook. Beer aficionados won’t want to miss the Pratt Street Ale House, an easy five-block walk away with exceptional bar food and superb craft beers and ales. (Ask for Robyn.) Mass transit is a mess in Baltimore. The light rail and the metro only run along one line. Buses are plentiful but confusing. As part of the Harbor Magic group, the Brook has shuttle service to its two sister properties, the ultra-modern Pier Five hotel right on the Inner Harbor and the historic Admiral Fell Inn at Falls Point. These hotels share some guest services including a convenient shuttle. Both my shuttle drivers Roland and Rae not only made sure I got to were I needed to be but also gave me some of the history of Baltimore’s neighborhoods and recommendations on where to eat. THE VALUE: Value to me means more than just a low price. It means attentive and responsive staff, good facilities, and quality service. The Brook was an excellent value. I have stayed at other suite hotels and received far less for more. There are also a number of special packages offered at all three hotels. I took advantage of the Best of Baltimore package during my stay. THE CONS: No major cons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: luckeylady38
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Brookshire was pleasant, excellent, comfortable and memorable. I am excited about returning very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and service for us and our dog”
Reviews.Author: healypass
