Reviews.Content: Centrally located for Inner Harbor with outstanding staff. Spacious room that are well furnished. Very quiet, bedroom and living space separated by spacious bath. All of the staff were responsive, helpful and appeared to genuinely enjoy the service they provided. The only suggestion we have is better directions to registration/parking area ( very convenient once located).

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay at while in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: onnad1
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and it is always great to find a nice Place to stay and I found a winner in Baltimore. The Brookshire Suites. Conveniently located at the Inner Harbor close to everything. The hotel was very clean, the room and bed were very comfortable, they had a good breakfast and nice happy hour with free food, beer, wine etc. But the best part about the Brookshire is their staff, they are unbelievably friendly and helpful from the minute you check in until you leave. I will stay there again when I go back to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing Value and Friendliness in Baltimore Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: This was a Priceline gem at $51 per night plus a resort fee of $10. We received a clean comfortable room, early check in, a top quality full American breakfast and an evening reception with two free drinks per person and cheeses, veggies and soup. The staff were all friendly and helpful from the manager Claudia who held elevator doors open for us, to the desk staff that brought train schedules to our door and arranged early morning taxis and even to a maintenance man who overheard our conversation and gave us terrifc tips on local shopping. The hotel is very central and everything of interest to us was walkable. If you win this property on Priceline, click your heels and do a happy dance! This was one hotel where I would be willing to pay the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: jvop4
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a wedding and also business. My room was not ready until 4pm and the shuttle to the church left at 4:20. Clearly, after traveling for 6 hours, this was not enough time to get ready to go to a wedding. I was told by the unhelpful staff that there was nowhere I could get ready and there was nothing they could do about it. Then, the hair drier did not work. The room was dingy and dirty. Later on the same day, I needed to go on a conference call and work on the internet for several hours for my job. Of course, the internet in my room was completely non-functional. Once again, the unhelpful staff said there was nothing they could do about that. The phone did not work either. I checked out of the hotel immediately, but even though I had not even spent a night at the hotel, they would not give me a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Roytennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice for our stay near the waterfron. It was clean, staff was courteous and it met our expectations. The food at the evening social and the morning breakfast were good. We would chose this again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: yellowday25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brookshire Suites the weekend of 10/30/09 - 11/01/09 to celebrate our daughters 14th birthday. This has been our thrid stay at the hotel since the summer of 2008. The staff here always make us feel welcome. We noticed each time we have checked in the same helpful and curtious woman is working at the front desk. This past trip she gave us a room on the 11th floor with a great view. My family likes staying here because of the spacious suites, convienent parking, and easy walking distance to all of the inner harbor attractions. Our daughter would say she likes the hot breakfast buffett best at the hotel (free with stay). I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay only one block from the harbor and doesn't want to drive from place to place. It is also nice having a private bedroom. This trip we focused on shooping and the MD Science Center. Next time we would like to explore Baltimore's Littlle Italy section.

Reviews.Title: “MORE THAN YOU WILL EXPECT”
Reviews.Author: Westvillelou
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel and it was just as good as the first time.. The front desk person Andrea, was very nice and helpful. She provided us discount coupons to various bars and restaurants. Complimentary shuttle service was also provided to Fells Point and the driver Roland was very nice. Again, great happy hour and breakfast. Some hotels in the area cost more and offer less.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: phillyb0y
Reviews.Content: Excellent service provided from start to finish! The morning buffett and the evening reception were both first class.. Dorien,at the front desk, provided us with tips on where to go and what to see.I am already planning a return trip..

Reviews.Title: “this is a great place”
Reviews.Author: buddyboyPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: i would reccomend this place to anyone th breakfast was great alon wit the room and the staff

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience, felt safe and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Yostfamily5
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an excellent experience at Brookshire Suites. We were in Baltimore to go to John's Hopkins for treatment. I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the unit that we stayed in. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. We had all of the amenities in our room that we needed and did not have to call for anything. The free breakfast in the morning was the most amazing complimentary breakfast we have ever had at a hotel. The breakfast is worth the return to this hotel. Even though we were visiting Baltimore/John's Hopkins for reasons other than what we would have liked, the experience at Brookshire Suites made us feel very comfortable. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Brookshire Suites combines convenience, quality and comfort...all at once.”
Reviews.Author: northoftheboarder
Reviews.Content: My stay at Brookshire suites began with professional service from the moment I entered the lobby, right from Travis at the front desk to the bell man waiting to help with my luggage. The service was prompt and courteous. They even went out of their way to track us down when we left our belongings at the front desk by mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Inner Harbor Sites!”
Reviews.Author: Seventiessoulchild
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite to attend a concert at Rams Head Live! Pros: great location for Inner Harbor sites. Many sites within walking distance. Suite location was great & mine was on the top floor overlooking the harbor. One of the best rests I've had in a while! Love the new Plasma flat screen TVs. Great touch! Cons: Staff friendly, but not very helpful. Suite could use a microwave and the kitchenette (Fridge, cupboard etc) was under the sink. (?) Ceilings were a little low, but was ok since none of us were 6ft tall... lol Giving a very good rating mainly because of the location and the great military discount I was given for the suite we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Caring for the caregiver”
Reviews.Author: tripseer
Reviews.Content: Early October, I needed a stress reducing and comfortable stay to be able to support my daughter through surgery at Johns Hopkins Hospital.... somewhere that would care for the caregiver! The Brookshire staff, amenities and facilities provided just that. I was able to shuttle back and forth from the hospital with friendly, prompt drivers, without worry for parking and traffic. There was local and long distance phone service to keep everyone "tuned in", The bed was sleep producing comfortable and all was clean and neat. There was a relaxing welcome the snacks and a drink. In the morning, there was a great breakfast buffet and newspaper with a phenomenal harbor view from the 12th or C (for Cloud) floor. The "Brook" is pet friendly, too... though confinded to a single floor so that those wishing to be away from pets, have their distance. On my next visit, we can bring our dogs so that my husband can join me and also support our daughter through her next surgery. I am almost looking forward to the pampering (though not the reason we want it).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodations in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Laughlin
Reviews.Content: My wife put it best--it didn't really feel like we were in a hotel, but more like we were staying at a posh apartment loaned to us close friends. We both do a lot of traveling around the country and internationally for our (very different) jobs and have seen the whole gamut of accommodations, and would rate Brookshire Suites in Baltimore as one of the best-ever. We've now stayed there three times, in different rooms on different floors, and can say from more than chance experience that the rooms are spacious and clean, with comfortable, clean-smelling beds, well-arranged work desks and relaxing couches, and everything you need to feel at home. You don't have to sit in bed to watch TV--in fact there are 2 TV's--one for the bedroom and one in the living room--as well as two sinks (bathroom and kitchenette), two mirrors, two closets--it's totally easy to share the space with another person without feeling cooped-up. The staff couldn't be nicer or more attentive, either. I had a problem with my internet connection close to midnight one night and within minutes (after asking me if it would be okay) the front desk dispatched an engineer who quickly replaced the modem and solved the issue so I could get back online right away. At every other hotel, that kind of request has been met with responses like "Call us in the morning if you are still having trouble" or "Sorry, but there's nothing we can do about it." All the staff were as friendly as they could be. Dorian and Andrea were real standouts at the front desk, but the porters and lobby assistants also went well out of their way to be unusually helpful. Breakfast is everything you could ask for--not just a box of doughnuts and instant coffee like a lot of places but a real meal with freshly-cooked hot foods, fruits, pastries, fresh juices and a delightful view of the Inner Harbor. The happy hour (5:30-7:30 PM) is a nice touch, too, with free drinks and hors d'oeuvres and that same view of the water to get you in the mood for going out for dinner. For the visitor on foot, going out could hardly be simpler--one block away is Harborplace, with dozens of restaurants and shops, museums, the aquarium, music clubs and a Water Taxi landing if you want to catch a romantic ride to still more fascinating parts of town like Fell's Point or Fort McHenry. Camden Yards is a five minute walk if a baseball game is your goal. And if all you want to do is curl up in your suite and relax, a Subway across the street and a pizza place around the corner are great for running out for a bring-home meal. The hotel offers quite a few drinks and snacks in the lobby as well. We didn't take advantage of the exercise room or other amenities at Brookshire Suites because the weather was so nice for walking and exploring, but it was nice to know they where there. We heartily recommend Brookshire Suites to anyone looking for a great place to discover Baltimore from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in noisy location”
Reviews.Author: Multitraveller24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brookshire suites in August. It was my husband, son, 8, and daughter 5 and me. The hotel itself was lovely. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean. The downside - the hotel is in the heart of the city and has constant traffic noise at all hours of the day and night. To top it off, road construction was being done the entire time we were there. We initially had a front room on a low floor and what a mistake that was!! Nobody slept that night due to the traffic noise. New York may be the city that never sleeps but Baltimore is a close second. We requested a room change on a higher floor in the back of the hotel the next morning. Once again, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were given a higher room on the side of the hotel since no rooms were available in the back. Actually, this room was nicer than our original room. It was somewhat quieter but we were still able to hear some traffic noises. It is very unfortunate since it is such a nice hotel. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 3Siggys
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the accomodations we experienced at the Brookshire Suites. The staff is exceptional, very attentive. The rooms were immaculate and very large! We had a fantastic view of the harbor from our room. Very centrally located to all activities. Parking seemed a little high ($33) but all in all, we would DEFINETELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Guest Relations in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Doctor-and-Lawyer
Reviews.Content: Brookshire Suites and the Admiral Fell Inn may not be the world's most famous hotels, but they exhibit great quality accommodation and world class customer service - service that keeps a guest coming back for more. They are two of the three Harbor Magic Hotels in Baltimore, the other one being the more exotic Pier 5 Hotel in Baltimore's vibrant Inner Harbour. Both properties are well situated in two different but exciting neighborhoods, Brookshire in the heart of the business district and within steps of the Inner Harbour, and Admiral Fell Inn at the hub of Fell's Point with its vibrant nightlife (and also day life!). The neighborhood concept is at the heart of both hotels. In each, a guest is made immediately to feel at home by staff that are more like low key helpful neighbors (that don't no how to say no) than typical hotel employees who might live by corporate policies that don't always address real life guest situations. We are not talking luxury, rather value for money with luxurious touches. The beds at both properties are excellent; large and with the quality of bedding that you will find at the serious international chains. Bathroom amenities are spa quality and go a long way to make up for the traditional bathtub and shower curtain. And for those that have business at or rely on the resources of Johns Hopkins, the Harbor Magic Group has carefully designed an excellent program including discounted rooms and free shuttle service from all its hotels to and from Johns Hopkins, scheduled in the mornings and evenings but on-demand at all other times of day. Yes there are a few drawbacks - but very few indeed - all of which are outweighed by the outstanding value for money and guest experience. Don't expect shiny new properties with marble shower stalls and heated floors. Don't expect a swimming pool. Do expect (very) clean and well kept premises and great gym facilities. Apart from the Hopkins package which is generous and which meets our business needs, we come back time and time again because of the people. At the Admiral Fell Inn, look out for Brett Henry, a fine manager, who takes time from his managerial duties to give personal service amidst what must be a busy schedule for him. At the Brookshire Suites, Travis, Andrea, Al, Brian, and Geoff all distinguish themselves in even the most mundane work of guest relations with wonderful customer service attitudes and this, in the long run, is what stands this hotel in good stead. For those of us that don't need luxury at a price that is often not worth it, put the Harbour Magic Hotels on your list. We think you won't be sorry, and, who knows, you may never stay anywhere else in Baltimore again!

Reviews.Title: “The staff of this hotel are professional, on the ball and clear that their job is to make your stay excellent.”
Reviews.Author: skaramooj
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel are professional, on the ball and clear that their job is to make your stay here excellent. We stayed here for a few days and over this time, Dorien, Agostina, Courtney and Travis at reception all offered us excellent service - we were very busy during our time here with many requests for various things and the team downstairs made our life easier with thier helpfulness. The top floor of the hotel is a lovely lounge with great views and was an asset to our stay, as was the free passes to a great gym nearby. I recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bella910
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Brookshire Suites went above and beyond to make our trip exceptional! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you have children. I cannot express enough how friendly and accomodating the staff was. I wish I could recall the names of the staff because they definitely deserve their high praise!

Reviews.Title: “Will definetely stay at Brookshire Suites Again! Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Katysl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided on a last minute overnight trip to Baltimore, MD. I went online to search hotels at Inner Harbor Baltimore on many of the travel sites. Brookshire Suites came up alot so I went to their website to look for even better rates. They have a great website & I was happy to find a great rate plus an aquarium package deal that was well below any other hotel in the area so I assumed the pictures on the webpage were outdated or exaggerated, We pulled up to the hotel & it is really great! The lobby is beautiful, our room was decorated very nicely & large! The staff was so nice & the extras they offer (breakfast & nightly "Happy Hour") was such a nice surprise. We will stay here again & have told lots of friends/family what a great hotel. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “SOO Glad I Ignored the Negative Reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: PrissyPixie
Reviews.Content: Before I go into detail, I'd like to sincerely thank Dorien and Andrea for making my 25th birthday weekend special! The Brookshire was at full capacity when my boyfriend and I visited, but we had an extremely personalized experience. I've already recommended the hotel to my sister and brother-in-law for their upcoming wedding anniversary. For those who want more than my gushing: My boyfriend flew into town to help me celebrate my birthday. Since I live an hour from Baltimore, he arranged to stay at the Brookshire on Friday. I'm the "planner" in our relationship, so my first reaction was to check Trip Advisor. It didn't take long to find some pretty scary reviews. I called and spoke to Andrea who told me how the hotel investigated both the items taken from rooms and the car theft, my biggest concern. She also told me that even though the rooms don't have safes, there are security deposit boxes at the front desk. She further provided a description of the valet's outfit (black pants, black vest, and Brookshire Suites nametag prominently displayed) and told me to leave my keys at the front desk if the valet was helping another guest. Of course, this seemed like common sense, but apparently the victims of the car theft gave their keys to a guy in jeans and a t-shirt. I definitely feel sorry for them and their ordeal, but that wasn't really a smart move. :-( Dorien efficiently checked us in, told us the details we needed to know about the Brookshire, and gave us some great recommendations for dinner (Rusty Scupper) and entertainment (Power Plant Live) within walking distance. We headed up to room 1103 -- a two-room, corner suite with a partial view of the harbor. The room DID show it's age a bit, but it was neat, clean, and completely adequate. After dinner and a night of fun, we were more than satisfied with our comfy bed. The full breakfast the next day was enjoyable, as was our day at the National Aquarium (the tickets for that alone would've been $60 without the package). We ate an amazing lunch at Ra Sushi -- a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. (Tip: Ra has a happy hour from 3-7, even on Saturdays, with half-off appetizers, half-off sushi, and drink specials.) It was raining when we finished lunch, so we went to one of the Brookshire's sister properties and caught a complimentary shuttle back. We got the car back (in the condition we left it) AND received a complimentary box of Godiva for celebrating my birthday at the Brookshire. I normally spend more time in DC than Baltimore, but I'm excited to return. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: Lwylie
Reviews.Content: We lucked out when the hotel that we were originally staying at, somehow lost our reservation. They quickly called the Brookshire and set us up there. We were only there for a night but the entire staff, from the top down was completely professional and helpful. Even Dorian, when approached with an extremely uncomfortable situation with another guest handled the situation and quickly checked us out and went from the front desk to retrieve our vehicle. We will certainly be staying there the next time in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Best for location, price, hospitality, and very safe. Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: carolineVa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location, I could see the harbor from my room without paying the "harbor view" prices at these other hotels. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. It's right in by everything you would want to experience in the Inner Harbor. The lobby is adorned in beautiful purple which gives it upscale appeal. I couldn't believe I had such a wonderful hotel overall for the price I paid! Please thank Dorien the front desk associate and the bellmans for being so nice and ready to help resolve any issue I had very quickly. He was very professional and caring.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gr8 stay”
Reviews.Author: UsButterflygirl
Reviews.Content: What a "GR8" stay I had at the Brookshire Suites. I loved my room, it had a wonderful view if the harbor (which was only 1 block away) and my suites was very spacious. There was more then enough room for me and my friends. Great locaion as well, very close to everything. The whole magical theme is a plus as well, I like how the staff had prizes for the children in the hotel. And speaking of the staff, they were outstanding, I dont think I have ever saw customer service like this before. Each and ever employee I came i contact with was so friendly and assistive. Andrea, Doren, Al and Travis to mention a few. The hotel offers a great breakfast too. I will be back to stay again (and I look forward to making my next reservation) I hope that i encounter the same staff and the same service during my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Other hotels could learn a lot from the staff at the Brookshire”
Reviews.Author: didilh
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a fairly picky person, particularly, with the people/staff of a business. It is hard for me to give five stars to anything, 5-stars would suggest everything is perfect and that would be unlikely. However, I am giving the Brookshire five stars (or dots here) because nothing about our stay was negative and since the staff was the best I have encountered I have to give five star/dots. When checking-in, I understood there are a limited number of rooms with views, we asked for one but one wasn't available. Entering our room "without a view" I found a perfectly lovely view. We could even see the harbor from our room "without a view". The suite was exceptionally comfortable, especially the bed. How nice to have a two room suite (for the price of a typical one room). I had a couple of out of the norm requests, I forgot my comb at home -- the man at the front desk said "you know, I think we might have one" he went into the office and brought out a new comb in plastic wrap. We had my birthday cake and needed a place to refrigerate it after checking out, the front desk took care of that instantly. I had the feeling that no matter what I would have needed, the staff would have helped me get it. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: doylie21
Reviews.Content: My name is Colleen and I just wanted to say what a wonderful time we had at the Brookshire suites hotel in Baltimore. Booking the trip was easy and check-in with Andrea was a breeze. We were out the door to the Aquarium in a jif which was only 2 blocks away.Our room was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. Everyone at the Brookshire was so so friendly and helpful. We had a couples massage at Spa Sante which was wonderful. All of the little services at each of the hotels looked amazing, I wish we had time to try them all. There was a little mix up between the hotel and the Spa but Benjamin fixed the problem quickly and efficiently. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here every time in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: njmoose
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the staff of the hotel. They were always so helpful with any questions or needs. They welcomed you when you entered the lobby and always acknowledged you when passing by. The hotel was very clean and appeared to be well maintained. Five star service.

Reviews.Title: “Many firsts - all bad.”
Reviews.Author: regularslinky
Reviews.Content: My wife, 5 year old son and I stayed for 3 nights. The hotel lobby was nice and the people were friendly. The room (harborview) left something to be desired - peeling wallpaper and missing knobs on the dressers. Very noisy due to traffic and metal sheets on the road. The hotel provides a small breakfast buffet, which was a nice touch - especially considering that there didn't seem to be many alternatives in the area. No pool or gym onsite. Room service from a local restaurant but almost exclusively seafood. Parking was expensive, especially considering that the lot was empty. I travel 4-5 times a year, so I've stayed in a few hotels - many firsts at this one: This was the first time I've seen maids come to make up the room at 5:30-6pm - just when we were there resting and getting ready to go out for dinner. This happened every day except the day we checked out - on that day they were knocking on the door at 8:30 am!!! First time I've had to go to the desk to ask for bathroom tissue. First time I've seen a line of 5 people/couples at a hotel front desk. First time I've ever seen and paid a $9.95 daily "destination charge." This was a surprise when we checked in. Now don't get me wrong, I don't mind spending money. The daily rate for this hotel was reasonable (we did the Waterfront Invasion package and got tickets to the aquarium, science museum, etc.) and I would have gladly paid an extra $10 per night if that was the rate quoted. But I hate being surprised by bogus stuff like this - it's insulting. The "destination charge" supposedly includes internet access, copies, etc. - none of which I used. But it also includes 2 bottles of water per day and a daily newspaper. We stayed 3 nights and got 2 bottles of water and no newspapers. I didn't want a newspaper but if you're going to charge me for one the least you can do is actually give me one. Overall the trip was nice despite the hotel. The "Waterfront Invasion" package is a great deal for a long weekend with kids. We also did the Pirate Adventure in Annapolis which was outstanding. I might try one of the other Harbor Magic hotels, but I wouldn't stay at this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Made the best of a bad situation”
Reviews.Author: stuckinnj
Reviews.Content: Was in Baltimore for my sister's wedding at the nearby Hyatt - was booked at Hyatt for $167 per night, recieved email for Brookshire for 99 per night with free breakfast. Opted for Brookshire - stopped by on Saturday at 1130, room not ready yet so dropped off bags. Problem is, at 315 room still was not ready - c'mon...finally got into room at 4 (had rehearsal and stuff to get ready for), gave us room 203 - two room suite - my brother stayed at the nearby residence inn marriot, the rooms were probably the same size, but ours had the bedroom seperated from the living room with a wall and door, with a sofa for the kids in the living room. DO NOT STAY IN THIS ROOM! Super noisy, was a metal plank in the street, every time a car ran over it, CLANK CLANK, CLANK CLANK - a 24 hour Subway restuarant was right otuside our window - apparently its the hot spot when the bars close at 2 am-4 am. Sirens all night long, heard every voice, bad situation. we called the front desk the next morning and said we need a higher room - they said they could move us to the 11th floor - when we left for the wedding at 1230, new room was not yet ready, we left our stuff packed in our old room - ran back around 8 pm to check on room (since had young kids that needed to go to sleep asap when we would get back), luggage was in room. all in all, staff took care of us, but only because they had another room available - if we had to stay in room 203 again, would probably have looked for another hotel for wedding night. Also, staff took 50 off room rate, even though it wasnt really their fault about the noise (poor soundproofing/windows?). we didnt ask for it, only wanted different room. two other things - we had a roll away bed the first night, supposed to be a 20 charge - they didnt charge us. also, supposed to be a 9.95 daily fee for internet and other stuff, we werent charged that either breakfast wasnt bad (for free) - scrambled eggs, pancackes, sausauge or bacon, potatoes, bagels and bread, muffins and scones, fresh fruit and yogurt and cereal - not enough people were leaving tips for the staff in room hardwired internet access worked fine, didnt try wireless in lobby. all in all, would only stay again if could guarantee high floor - staff was accomodating and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good Value / Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomWilson
Reviews.Content: Good value for this hotel just one block from the Inner Harbor. They need to add a desk person because check-in was VERY slow. Not a great first impression, but after that, the experience was much improved. Small lobby, nice rooms, but even the suites seem crowded. Not as nice as the other Harbor Magic properties (Pier 5 and Admiral Fell Inn), but good value as this is the least expensive of the three. Stay included free breakfast and a very nice free happy hour, which inlcuded two drinks and a small finger off buffet. Very attentive manager, desk people could be a bit friendlier, but overall, I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location, Great packages”
Reviews.Author: lovetovac
Reviews.Content: 8/20-8/23 vip invasion package Family of 5 good value, great location for inner harbor, breakfast buffet included was very good, Cloud club reception included was very good, Hotel is Old and in need of renovation. Valet Parking expensive 29.00 a day but a great convience. Resort extra fees should just be added to room rate. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: gjoyPhiladelphia_Pa_
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, my brother-in-law and sister-in-law have just returned from a two day stay at the Brookshire, Aug 26,27. For my husband and I it was our first stay and we are sure to return. The accommodations were more than adequate with a well equiipped sitting area and a large bedroom. The mattress in our room was so comfortable we inquired as to its manufacturer. The hotel staff responded with a follow up phone call to provide us with the information. Speaking of the staff, each person we dealt with from desk clerk to valet, to wait staff in the Cloud room were more than helpful and professional in their duties. The Cloud room is to be commended on the simple yet good selection and presentation of different breakfasts and evening snacks. The recommendation for dinner one night at La Scala was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding from top to bottom!”
Reviews.Author: mikeefren
Reviews.Content: Where to start? My daughter and I travel to Inner Harbor about every other year for a day trip. While searching the various web sites about the I.H., I came across the Brookshire Suites "Harbor Invasion" which included hotel stay and VIP passes to the Maryland Science Center and National Aquarium for a very low price. Naturally, I jumped on it. I called the hotel to confirm our reservations and ask a ton of questions. Courtney at the front desk was not only helpful but extremely kind and considerate to my needs. At check in, Augustina again treated us like we were some major captain of industry. Our room was not ready yet (got there way early) but they checked our luggage and parked our car for us, then gave us our passes so we could start our vacation early. Augustina explained all the perks that came with our stay, including a game they have for children where they ask hotel staff for coins that the kids accumulate until they have enough for a toy. Great idea!!!! Room was gorgeous. Decorated to perfection. One small problem was that the lid for the toilet was outside the actual bathroom. As we were leaving for dinner, I advised the manager, Andrea, about it. Not to be a bother or that I was upset, but just so I didn't get charged for trashing the bathroom. Andrea was very apologetic and promised to have it taken care of, even though I insisted that it wasn't necessary. When we got back, the toilet was fixed and a letter of apology was on my desk from Andrea, along with a box of Godiva chocolates! Even checking out was a memorable experience. the Bell man got our car quickly in a torrential downpour and Andrea really made us feel like the staff was going to miss our presence! She is truly a tremendous asset to Brookshire. Oh, and the also have a nightly reception for new guests that include 2 free drinks and free breakfast (which was outstanding). I've already raved about Brookshire on my Facebook and will definately be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous-Nightmare-Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gracegd
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start as virtually everything about this hotel and it's staff is horrible. However, the point of this review is to advise others against staying here, not for trivial things like poor housekeeping, lazy, uncooperative staff, and ugly smelly rooms (all of which is true) . but for the fact that we were robbed while staying here and it is a DANGEROUS, SCARY place. I've been reading other's reviews, and apparently, this is not unusual for this hotel. Others have had almost exact experiences with the staff as we did on our stay. There is something very fishy about that to me, and apparently to the Baltimore Police as well. Here is a rundown of our stay at Brookshire from arrival to departure (about 24 hours) 1) Rooms were not available as promised 2)Front desk clerk was USELESS and CLULESS..promised to upgrade our rooms at a "sister hotel" and provide a shuttle to the new hotel....none of which ever happened. We waited for an hour in the hot lobby with our 4 young children only to be told that the phone call was never made and when it was finally made, we were told the rooms were not available and we would have to stay at Brookshire. 3)Room keys did not work 4) Rooms were dirty,small,housekeeping never came 5) Bellhop and valet are the same guy...hotel is COMPLETELY understaffed...one clerk at desk..and if he moved any slower, would have been going backward... 6) waited almost an hour to get our car out of valet so we could go to dinner *****7)****** OUR CAR WAS STOLEN BY A MAN POSING AS THE VALET WHILE THE "REAL" VALET AND FRONT DESK CLERK STOOD BY WATCHING FROM ABOUT 20FEET AWAY**** 8)When the car was stolen, the front desk clerk had to be instructed to please get off his cell phone and call the police 9)The manager arrived in the lobby, and while she was emotional, she was useless as far as helping us or accommodating us in any way. 10) The car was found 6 hours later, totalled. 11) we felt unsafe and terrified in our rooms, and felt very much so that the staff was somehow in on the crime based on thier ambivilant attitude toward us and our situation 12)We were promised a "limo" ride home to NJ since the car was totalled. We had a 9 month old infant with us and were told that the "limo" would have a carseat available for him 13) waited another hour for the "limo" only to realize that it was infact an airport shuttle van with faulty A/C and NO CARSEAT 14) had to drive 2/12 hours with an infant on my lap since no carseat was available. 15) was promised that we would not be charged for the rooms as the hotel's lack of security and competant staff are partly to blame....however, same front desk guy was reluctant to produce a receipt with a zero balance to prove that we were not being charged, AND the charges have shown up on my statement anyway 16) supposed 'higher up" manager of hotel was USELESS, did NOTHING to help or try to make us feel better about the situation 17)kids are terrified now, emotionally distraught, PLEASE DO NOT STAY AT THIS DANGEROUS HOTEL******

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel and customer service I've had in years, a must go to place.”
Reviews.Author: Robin10561
Reviews.Content: My husband and I get away very few days a year. We have a Down's child and now helping with our grandson who is 2 who has 2 tumors on the optic nerve in the brain. We were only able to get away for a one night stay and I sure wish it was more. The hotel Brookshire is by far my favorite hotel. The hotel is very clean and the location is great to go where ever you need to around the harbor. If you want to go to the pier and don't care to walk those 4 to 6 blocks Roland is a wonderful driver who will take you there. My husband told him about my having a total knee replacement a few months back and I got curb side service. Roland was the nices person, I give him a thumbs up. The front desk person Brian was wonderful also. He was quick to take care of any thing we needed. From needing a ride, charging soda's to our room. He was just so nice and friendly. I never seen him without a smile on his face and eager to help. Most people in the hotel business you can see it's a "job" Brian seemed to really care about the customer. The hotel offers alot of great things. We were not able to take part in the crab dip cooking expience because of other things going on at pier 5 but we did get to go up to cloud 9 for the evening reception for FREE beer, wine, fruit, cheese and a few other things. It was a very good set up. Barry handled that event. He was so nice and again he seemed like he was not just into it because it was a "job" he really cared about the customer and what he was doing. He held a nice conversation with him. He was able to answer questions we had. He kept everything filled and cleared tables as soon as people left. He did a great job. I have to say Brookshire Suites gets my top praise for hotel and customer service. I have already been telling family and friends if you go to Baltimore Harbor you MUST stay at Brookshire Suites. WE WILL BE BACK. Thank you to all the staff , even if we didn't meet you because you were behind the scenes for making my stay a wonderful one.

Reviews.Title: “Would definently go again”
Reviews.Author: loloterp
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time in the suite..nice..clean..the staff was very cordial. The location is w/in blocks from the harbor. So my bf and I could walk out to the harbor and the gallery was right across the street. I would def. book there again..The Cloud Club was so elegant. They offered complimentary wine and snacks. I enjoyed everything. The female host at the The Cloud Club did an excellent job w/ our orders and so did the guy at the Front desk. :)

Reviews.Title: “Scary, Dangerous, Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: vinser
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?? This was the worst trip of my life. It started out with a ridiculous wait of over 1 hour to check in to our room only to discover the rooms were not what we had ordered and were not large enough to accomodate our party. It took me another half hour to get the attention of the person at the desk to ask for assistance. When he agreed to remedy the situation by moving us to an upgraded suite at another hotel, that seemed great. I gathered my family and waited in the lobby (as instructed) for another hour only to be told that they hadn't called the other hotel yet to tell them we were coming and when they did finally, call, we were told there was no room and we would have to stay here. They agreed to take $50 off my bill, so I accepted this, despite feeling I had been totally misled by the online adds. The end of this horrible night was my car being stolen by a man posing as a valet outside of the hotel while the real valet stood and watched this man approach our car, then go to the front desk to supposedly get a claim ticket, talk to the front desk man (the same one who screwed up our move) and come out again to take our keys. The staff had to be told to call the police, acted clueless as to how to behave, there was no security on site at all. The polive were very nice and helpful and later found our car totaled, but the way the hotel employees reacted, including the manager and her higher up manager, was actually suspicous!!! We were scared to death to go to sleep that night because it seemed that some of the employees may have been involved in the robbery based on their non-chalant reactions!! I was scared to even speak to the manager the next day because they all gave me the creeps!!! I will be incurring the expense of a new car, changing the locks on my home because they have my home address and some lunatic drove around for 5 hours with my car keys, and the emotional distress of this whole situation. By the way, they still haven't removed that charge for my room from my credit card and were hesitant about finding us a ride back to New Jersey after they were clearly negligent in the situation. We will probably be filing a lawsuit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly - great way to see Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: suerocks27
Reviews.Content: My fiance stayed here for two nights, booking through a discount travel site and getting a $99 per night suite. When we first checked in, the room we were given was someone else's! Not sure how that happened. They are running a "Harbor Nights" promotion and we got discounted drink tickets for bars and restaurants in the Fells Point and other areas plus $25 for use at some of the nicer restaurants in the Inner Harbor (like McCormick & Schmick's). M&S Grill accepted this $25 certificate as well. The Brookshire runs a free shuttle to its other locations and we took advantage of the free ride to Fells Point. The shuttle stopped at 10 so we cabbed back, which is expensive but worth our safety. We also got a free breakfast buffet every morning that was good--scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes or french toast, plus a good assortment of bagels, fruit, cereal, etc. It was a popular breakfast but they refilled items as fast as they could. Room: The suite was very nice and set up well. The sheets were not the best and gave my fiance a rug burn. They didn't clean our room until after 4:30, which was fine. I am glad we were on the 8th floor because you could still hear street noise like trucks and horns honking. It was strange that the hallways seemed to have no air conditioning, but our room was nice and cold. Service: When our room was wrong, the front desk clerk apologized and fixed it within 5 minutes. Otherwise we didn't need to use services. The workers were all friendly. They suggested a parking garage that was half a block away and $11 cheaper than their valet. They did mention a $9.95 fee per day to use the internet, go to the offsite gym, and other items but we didn't use these things and they were not added to our bill. There is a computer in the lobby but it was slow and being hogged by the same guy both nights we were there. Location: We were one block from the Inner Harbor and three blocks from the Aquarium. This was a perfect spot for us! It took about 5 minutes to walk to Camden Yard, the Orioles stadium to see a game (and would have been another two to get to the M&T Stadium for a Ravens game.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: longandshortofit
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The stay was not perfect, but the location and value far outweigh the negatives. The room was more than large enough despite low ceilings. Wet bar with fridge. Comfy beds. Horrible view into building next door but great view from breakfast. Room not ready on time and often line at front desk. Shuttle from hotel to their other properties or anyplace along the route. Great location within blocks of inner harbor. Afternoon reception had snacks and drinks including wine/beer. Breakfast was more than adequate and include hot dish and fresh fruit. Maid forgot to leave clean towels and bottled water one day. Price was far below anything located nearby. Joining hotel traveler program included $50 coupon for next visit that they let me use this time!

Reviews.Title: “Brookshire Suites made our trip wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lpinney
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent 3 nights/4 days in Baltimore, staying at the Brookshire Suites. We had a package deal that just couldn't be beat! Our room was wonderful, we were close walking distance to the places that we visited. Our E-Experience Specialist was wonderful in keeping communication with us before our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: kirstenmm
Reviews.Content: I was greatly disappointed with the facility. Our room smelled like stale smoke, the carpet was dirty and greatly worn and the hallways were hot and humid. The room was not cleaned properly. Rather than switch rooms we opted to leave as it was obviously not up to our expectation. I was disappointed since I was thrilled with the customer service up to the point of arrival. I do feel a bit mislead. The marketing does not accurately reflect the product, the website had a fresh, clean updated look not the worn, dirty and unkept look we walked into. We chose to leave and drive through the night as we did not feel comfortable in the facility

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: nikki10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Brookshire for three nights. The nightly happy hour and the free full breakfasts were great. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I got a great rate of $99.00 per night. However, the maid service was poor. There were times when our room was not cleaned. Keep in mind that they only have valet parking for $33.00 per night. You are better off parking in the Arrow parking garage next door for $18.00 per day.The suites were large enough but the rooms and carpeting are old. I wasn't too upset because for $99.00 per day I received breakfast for 2, a nightly cocktail reception with snacks and a coffee bar. I also received a few drink vouchers for cocktails at local bars and a $25.00 gift card for dinner. It is not the greatest place to stay, but it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: LAD21NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My Family and I enjoyed our stay at the Brookshire very much. The Staff was on top of everything and extremely helpful. Once we arrived I didn't have to lift a finger they did it all from dinner reservations (at our request) to helpful hints. We will definitley be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: bbrainerd
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to find old fashioned service delivered by mannered, well informed, and helpful staff members. We will definately kame this hotel our home base in future visits to the area.

Reviews.Title: “No clean sheets”
Reviews.Author: nocleansheet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 3 day vacation at the Brookshire Hotel. I have two complaints. 1. Check-in time was 4PM. I thought that was late to check-in. I felt we lost half of the day just to wait to check-in. We travel and stayed at plenty of hotel and we usually check-in no later than 12PM. 2. The 3 days we stayed there our bed linen were never changed. I even marked the sheets to see if they would change them, we would come back to our room all clean up expect we still had the same sheets on the bed. My husband approached the housekeeping lady and she would said "tomorrow I will change the sheets" tomorrow came and went, I just hope the next person(s) who gets that room have clean linen

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: ALW1835
Reviews.Content: I had phoned before my arrival to inquire about parking. I spoke to Andrea and she was very helpful. She asked me when I expected to arrive and when I told her I would arrive way ahead of check-in, she checked to see if a room would be available. It was and she said it would be ready when I got there. I hadn't asked, she offered! She recognized me when I check in and was very welcoming. My room had a partial view of the harbor. The breakfast buffet was very good, including the coffee. Overall my experience was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: TheSoooz
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings toward this hotel. The hotel is poorly staffed so I had to wait a few times at the front desk for help. The door man was never at his post so I had to carry my daughters stroller down the steps myself. Also, we were charged a $9.95 fee each day we stayed for things we didn't want (outside gym, bottled water, internet, etc.) I also had an issue with the housekeeping. They have untill 5pm to clean the rooms and when I asked for my room to be donw by 1pm so my daughter could nap, I had to wait for an hour and a half for it to get done and it was poorly done. Plus, the housekeepers knocked on my door and didnt understand me when I told her that my room was already done. The hotel itself was beauiful. It's extreamly close to the inner harbor and the convention center. They have a good hot breakfast and happy hour with free drinks and snacks. They staff is very freindly and they do try to accomidate you when possible. I'm unsure if I'd stay there again, but I wouldn't reccomend it to anyone I liked.

Reviews.Title: “Not accomidating, very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolezamp
Reviews.Content: If your looking for something special, a pampered feeling, or something that isn't your run of the mill hotel do not stay here. The hotel is very poorly staffed so be prepared to wait, not have your needs met, or feel like your in for a treat. My BF and I went away for the weekend for my b-day and he had called ahead for some basic suprises in the room(rose pedals, cake, and balloons) to be there for our arrival. They were not able to do as promised. We could not even get into the room until after 4pm and at that point we were able to find the a/c broke. That took about another 1/2 hour to fix. No apologies or deductions for their error on the b-day suprise or a/c issue. Also, parking is $29 plus a 15% tax on parking-very disappoining

Reviews.Title: “Check in staff kept saying 'there's a lot of confusion here'”
Reviews.Author: jmaan19480
Reviews.Content: Took over two and a half hours to check in (after 4;00PM). The check in desk even called an hour and a half later (5:30) to say we could check in. Got back to the hotel, 'they were confused', we couldn't check in yet. They did upgrade us to suites for our troubles. They weren't ready on time either. We were gone all day the next day, getting back at about 4:00. We wanted to clean up and rest, as we were going to the ballgame later. The maid was just getting to our room. We had to leave again. We were told that they have until 5:30 to clean the rooms. When we checked out, and were asked about our stay, we told the manager what had happened. She understood, and took $50 off our bills, and also gave us a $50 gift card to return and try the hotel again. She also said that she would check into our compliants with the weekend staff. She was knowledgeable, and polite, and we thank her for helping us out. The rooms were fine (neat and clean), the location to the harbor is great. Haven't decided if we'll go back. Not sure if I'd recommend this hotel to other people, but since I have to check the recommendation below, I'll check 'no' for now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GingergirlDelaware
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Baltimore to go to the Red Sox Game. I have read the mixed reviews of the Brookshire but I was very impressed with the hotel and staff. We had a two room suite that was well decorated and clean. They offer a free full breakfast nuch better than the branded hotels plus a complimentary evening cocktail reception. The staff was very friendly and the location is great, just a block from the Inner Harbor and a short walk to Orieles Stadium. This is my first review but I thought I would share our good time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. My room was broken in and my purse stolen.”
Reviews.Author: Isabella_M_NewYork
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to Baltimore on business, and this was by far the worst stay. The room was filthy, the shower curtain covered with mold. There was a dead cockroach in the middle of the room, and it remained there for the duration of my stay, so it certainly was not vacuumed. The bag with Q-tips in the bathroom was open. The overall impression was disgusting. But most importantly, on 6/29/09, when I went for a jog around the harbor early in the morning, I came back half an hour later to find a door to my room ajar and my purse and two cell phones gone. The thief ran away through the fire escape stairwell. He took the cash, one credit card and one bank card and two phones and dropped everything else on the stairs, where my co-worker found it. The front desk clerk was absolutely useless and didn't know what to do. I told him to call the police. He was also very defensive and accused me that it was my fault. He said that I probably lost a key card to my room with the room number written on it. I had both key cards in my possession and returned them when checked out. The manager who arrived shortly did not offer me any help or any support. Not even an apology. The policeman from the crime lab said it definitely looked like an inside job. I think it explains the management's reluctance to deal with it. From other reviews, I see that it happens on a regular basis. There is no security - they only have a camera in the lobby downstairs. The doors do not lock. Everybody complained about it. There are no safes in rooms. I would never again stay in this hotel and strongly recommend to anybody against staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Items were stolen from our room”
Reviews.Author: Flowers28
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Brookshire in early May 2009. While we enjoying the city, we had items stolen from our room including a purse and a wallet. The manager on duty that day was nice and attentive but everyone else up to that point was incompetent and unresponsive. Their stories were not lining up and they weren't doing anything so we called in the Baltimore police to get a report. The police woman was great but was shocked at how the hotel was handling the situation (or not handling). Be careful if you want to take the risk in staying here- they admit that the doors do not lock correctly! We aren't sure if that is what happened but pretty sure it was an inside job. We are still getting the run around from their unresponsive insurance agency as well. Besides getting robbed, the bathrooms had mold all over the shower curtains and were disgusting. but that obviously was the least of our worries. The manager working that day did comp one of our rooms but that came no where close to the amount of money that was lost during the trip or the headache of canceling credit cards, bank accounts, losing gift cards, etc. To date, they still have not made good on the troubles caused by us staying in their establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: feliciah7
Reviews.Content: I was here on business, so unfortunately I did not get to experience some of the extra activities the hotel offers. First off, I would like to say that the staff was very friendly and helpful. I had a small repair that needed to be done to my room, which was done expeditiously. I think this place is good for business travelers who need to start the morning with a good meal and wind down after work. The breakfast was hearty, and the social hour was adequate. I was expecting more; however, I realize that was my own expectation based on experiences with other hotels--the Brookshire stayed true to the meaning of "social hour." Also, you definitely can't beat the location. It's within walking distance from the Harbor, which was great. I only have 2 complaints: Although there is an individual control for the A/C, there seems to be an overriding master control. It was pretty warm in the room in the mornings and at night. Regardless of how low I turned the thermostat, it remained almost 80 degrees. It seemed like the cool air was reserved for the afternoons, because when I would return from work in the early evening, it was nice and cool. By the time I would return from dinner, it was warm again. I didn't bother to complain, because it was obvious that the hotel wanted it that way. Secondly, there were no towel racks in the bathroom. I don't think I have ever been in a hotel bathroom that didn't have this. The bathrooms are very small, but I think the hotel should be able to fit at least 1 rack in there somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brookshire is not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: brooklynot2picky
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Baltimore Harbor and we stayed at the Brookshire. The rooms were not very clean and the bathroom was disgusting. The rooms also smelled funky. The staff was not very helpful at all, there was only one staff member that looked interested in us. They advertised an indoor pool but do they did not say that the pool was a mile away at a health facality and not at the hotel which my kids were very disappointed. Also the couch had a tear in it, you would think for the money you spend they could have someone fix it. I don't usually stay at luxury hotels and expect to be treated like royality but I think the Days Inn would have been a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: ImAllOverThePlace
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on several occasions and I am sad to say this was the last. The location is amazing but everything else seems to be on a steady decline. Andrea at the front desk is one of the most incompetent people I have ever come across. Each time I was at the desk there was another guest complaining. We spent 45 minutes checking in for a one-night stay, and all of the requests on my reservation were marked incorrectly. The hotel used to have a welcome package in the room with snacks, drinks and chocolates. Instead I was welcomed by the permeating stench of a stale ashtray. The rest of our party ended up on a different floor even though we requested the rooms together. I get the whole concept of it being a request, but there was no effort to fix or accommodate us at all. They have imposed a new $10 daily resort fee, I'm not sure how a small inn with less then 100 rooms and no real ammenities can even use the term resort. The bedding was uncomfortable and our view was a brick wall. Parking across the street was $42 for one night, which is completely obnoxious but better than waiting for the valet, who was about as efficient as the girl at the front desk. She charged the credit card that was supposed to be "holding" our room without consent. While trying to resolve the situation it turned out it wasn't my card that was charged at all, but our friends in the 2nd room were charged for both rooms. We just gave them cash, but now, 3 days later I find that my card was charged after check out-- so we have paid for the stay twice at this point. Andrea told me she is the manager there now, and I can promise IF and as long as that is the case, I will spend the extra money to stay at the Radisson for my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: zebraland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Brookshire Easter weekend. The hotel is within walking distance to most attractions - camden yards, aquarium, fell's point, power plant. The room was very clean and extremely comfortable. My only suggestion would be to incorporated the additional 9.95 daily fee into their room rates. Be sure and take advantage of the social hour (free wine, beer) and snacks and the breakfast. Also, you have access to the free activities at the partner hotels Pier 5 and The Admiral Inn.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely blown away”
Reviews.Author: hg1967
Reviews.Content: we have never stayed at this hotel previously and have stayed at several in the inner harbor area. i will never need to look for another place to stay! from the moment we walked in the door (actually prior to that with the valet driver), we were blown away by the attentive, friendly staff. we checked in to our room, were floored by the attention from the staff (not a familiar scene in major city hotels) and were impressed by the little details throughout our entire stay. from the bed (most comfortable hotel bed i have ever slept in), to the cloud club reception, to the bottled water in the room, high quality tvs, outstanding breakfast-everything we experienced was top notch. and like all service businesses, the difference is made with the people. the staff and hotel manager were attentive and friendly to us throughout our entire stay-not that we are needy but it was really nice to go somewhere and feel special and welcomed. i will definitely recommend brookshire suites to everyone i know travelling to baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: rjanden
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my three kids states at the Brookshire Suites with their promotion for Aquarium tickets. They gave me a room with one queen bed and a pullout sofa. I knew this room was not big enough for five to sleep so I went down to the desk at 5:30 pm and asked if I could have a rollaway bed. The girl at the desk said she would have it sent right up. Then my husband realized we only had three bath towels for five people so he called the desk to ask for more towels. She said she would have them sent right up. We went to dinner and came back at 8pm with no bed and no towels. We waited until 10pm and just went to bed. At 11 pm there is a knock at the door with a rollaway bed but no towels. My husband was so aggravated he told them they could keep their bed because everyone was asleep already and they have some nerve taking 5 1/2 hrs to bring up a bed. The man went and brought us towels at 11pm as well. My whole point is customer service is everything and even though your hotel is clean and in a good location, we will never stay here again. Your employees are just yes men.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: PABNewYork
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Brookshire Suites in Baltimore Maryland with my husband and children and we had a wonderful stay. From the front desk staff to the concierge lounge attendant the staff was excellent!!!! The location to Inner Harbor was perfect for our weekend getaway and the most impressive part of it was the warm and helpful staff which recommended to see the aquarium- good call. Jessica at the desk was always accomodating and the General Manager Claudia was always there to assist me and my family!!!! I would recommend this hotel to all!!! Thank you again Brookshire Suites!!! Patty from New York

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaorohctga
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location: only a couple of blocks from the harbor; near many restaurants, and shops, friendly staff clean room Cons: "Destination fees" additional $9 added each day to my bill. They say it include a bottle of water, evening reception and breakfast, shuttle trips to their other hotels, use of fitness center, internet etc. OK. But there's CVS in the same block so you can buy a bottle of water under $1. As I was on a business trip, I didn't have time to enjoy their evening receptions, fitness center, internet connection etc. Breakfast was OK. But if you go to Dunkin, you can buy a breakfast bagel under 4. So I totally do not agree with their $9/day.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we almost stayed at”
Reviews.Author: travelerN0Tt2urist
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Brookshire Suites to attend the presidential inaugruation. When we arrived our room only had one bed (not their fault, I booked through priceline and didn't specify). The manager COULD NOT HAVE BEEN MORE ACCOMODATING!!! She went out of her way to keep my children occupied - free dolls, cookies and milk- while she sorted this out. Ultimately she found us a room at a sister property. I cannot say enough about how smoothly our issue was resolved. If only all hotels could be as accomodating as Brookshire Suites. Kudos to a manager who KNOWS the value of customer service. ps the inaugruation was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AGZE
Reviews.Content: If you'd like to know how our stay was ... go look at the bathroom door. I'm sure that WHATEVER it is that was covering the door ... is still on the door. Our garbage cans weren't emptied. Our water and teas were never refilled. Saturday we left the room at 10 a.m., the room was not cleaned that day at all. We had to go back downstairs when we arrived at 11 p.m. that evening to get clean towels. The batteries were so low in one remote we had to constantly get up and manually change the channels, the other remote ... did not work at all. We couldn't connect to the internet through the ethernet as there was no "Connectivity" manual in the room ... (as stated that it should be in the hotel guide.) The breakfast, though ample, was cold. There are quite a number of snacks to be purchased for the room in the lobby, yet NO microwave to heat them with. Yes, the employess are knowledgable ... and helpful. The fact that our anniversary was marred by such a bad lodging experience ... that's what we'll remember.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Brookshire”
Reviews.Author: BreezeeNyc
Reviews.Content: Great stay, the breakfast and evening reception was first class. The staff was super friendly, the GM was very visable and we spoke to him several times. Service like this is hard to come by these days! Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Can't live up to its own promises”
Reviews.Author: hotelpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel promises a lot but all it can deliver on is its location which it can't screw up. Nothing is as it seems. the bathrobes aren't in the rooms, the wireless internet isn't available IN THE ROOM! The "business center" is a small room with a printer which does not work. The hotel staff knows it doesn't work but does nothing nor puts a sign on it so you can waste 15 in. trying to make it work. The rooms are small with VERY low ceilings and tiny old bathrooms and incredibly scratchy towels. The tub is old with peeling paint. There is not even a guide to the few TV channels they get in the room. Do yourself a favor - spend a little more and get a hotel with decent, basic service.

Reviews.Title: “They just don't get it”
Reviews.Author: sox_girl12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Brookshire because we were travelling to Baltimore for the Red Sox/Orioles game, and the Brookshire Suites was pretty much the only hotel available for the dates we needed...that should have been my first red flag. The hotel is in a perfect location for what we were there for- the Inner Harbor was 1 block away, and Camden Yards only about a 10 minute walk. I booked the trip through Expedia, and called the hotel the week before to confirm our reservation. The desk clerk who answered the phone was not very professional, and was somewhat awkward, but, I didn't really think much of it. I worked for Fairmont hotels for 5 years, and also graduated from one of the best hotel/restaurant management programs in the country, and was constantly trained on customer service. Well, it is obvious to me that the staff at the Brookshire Suites have not been well trained. Check-in went fairly smooth. Behind the front desk area was under construction, and the newly renovated color scheme was hideous. It didn't give off the "modern" vibe I think it was going for. It reminded me of the Joker's purple suit from the Batman movie. When we got to our room, it was on the side of the hotel that was about 5 feet away from the abandoned, scary looking brick building next door. The room had a king bed, which I requested, but was so dark, even with the lights on, it felt like we were in a cave. The air conditioner was a floor unit with a huge white exhaust tube that extended to go out the window- again, disgusting. And the mini-bar that was supposed to be "fully-stocked", and had a menu on top of it, was completely bare. So, I was unhappy with the room. I went to the front desk and expressed my feelings, and asked to be moved to a different room that wasn't so dark. So, the front desk clerk, without making eye contact with me at all, searched the computer for at least 5 minutes. Then he said that they had "1" room, and gave me a key so I could go look at it. Upon entering the room, it was brighter, but about half the size of the other room, with 1 double bed. Now, shouldn't the desk clerk have mentioned that before he sent me all the way up to that room? Also there was a huge stain on the carpet in front of the bed. I returned back to the front desk and asked if there were any OTHER rooms- was told that there was not, and that was that. I did not get the feeling that this man was trained in customer service AT ALL. That day, I had run into a friend who was also visiting Baltimore, and they had heard that there is a train that runs from Camden Yards to the airport, and it only costs $1.75! That is much better than the $35 taxi ride we took from BWI to our hotel. So, that evening I approached the front desk clerk and asked him about it. He had no idea what I was talking about, but attempted to check the internet for me. Again, he made no eye contact with me, but his face was just about plastered to the screen for about 10 minutes. Now, if you work at a hotel in such a location, and it's about a 10 minute walk to the particular train, don't you think you would be knowledgable about it, or have resources to find out about it? No luck there, either. The one redeeming quality of this hotel is the Cloud Club- the breakfast is included in your rate, and it was very good. Also, the cocktail hour reception was wonderful too. Oh, one last thing- I wrote all of this on the comment card in our room, and have not heard any response from the management. It truly is a shame, because if the hotel properly hires staff and trains them well, it wouldn't be so bad. If you decide to stay at the Brookshire despite all of the negative reviews, ask for a room on the left side of the hotel- I heard those are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: GBinAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip to Johns Hopkins, who has the hotel listed on its 'recommended' list. It seems to be owned by some company that makes the staff say the stupidest things like, "How can I make magic for you today?", etc. and the interior design (purple couches, ocean-themed carpet) looks like Prince took over Sea World. This part wasn't what turned me off; it was the utterly unprofessional staff, who publicly bicker and behave like adolescents, and the smell of the place, which reminded me of old yogurt. I will definitely be giving this report to Hopkins (they usually try to put people up in the excellent Henderson's Wharf but it was booked). Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Room needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Jenswar
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 we booked this for the bedroom suite and the location. The location was great - just a short block to the Inner Harbor. Also, the staff was all very pleasant and made every attempt to be helpful. And the breakfast was fresh and good. That said, the room itself was nothing like the website made it seem. The whole room need to be painted, there were a number of chips in the wall, the furniture was uncomfortable and cheap, the sheets were cheap, and the blanket was old and ratty. The bathroom floor was dirty, the tub stopper was broken, the tiles in the shower were popping out and needed new grout, and the shower head was dirty and could not be moved. Overall, the location was great, but the inside needed work.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad”
Reviews.Author: WishfulThinking90210
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 1-bedroom suite and found the hotel to be "okay." I liked the breakfast buffet, happy hour, small refrigerator/wet bar, and spacious living room. I liked that they still have smoking rooms. I did NOT like the coffeemaker (1-cup) and lack of vending machines for soft drinks. And trying to get coffee from the staff was like pulling teeth. We had to constantly beg the front desk and maid for regular coffee. Also, the internet in my room wasn't working, so the front desk had me call their tech support at a 1-866 number. These tech support people need the hotel name, address, and phone number before they will do anything--just try and find the hotel phone number and address in your room! Plus they were foreigners with English as a second language. Anyway, the internet problem was resolved by a maintenance man who just restored power under the desk. The living room furniture and carpeting were worn but still comfortable. The hotel made an attempt to remodel the bathroom but made a huge mistake in installing a dresser-type vanity that was too big for the bathroom and with a sink too far back, making it difficult to lean over while washing your face. But it was clean. I will probably stay here again because the AARP rates are good and it's one block from the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ncolea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brookshire Suites for the Yankee/Oriole baseball weekend and couldn't have been more happy with our hotel choice. Rooms booked fast for that weekend far in advance so we had to book using the Business Package since it was the only room type they had available. Fine with us since that included a book of coupons to use for various bars and restaurants in the area (free admission, drinks etc). This also included free WiFi in the room and the room also was a two room suite with a living room, kitchen area, and bedroom. This hotel was far cheaper than others in the area and I think it had possibly the best location! Right by the inner harbor. On Friday night they had free happy hour on the top floor (beers, wine, and hors de voures). Also, every morning was free breakfast on the top floor. And, on the weekend this breakfast was provided until 11..So if you are a late sleeper then this is great. Water pressure was excellent and for the ladies they had a great hair dryer in the bathroom (not the kind that attaches to the wall). Leave your hair dryer at home. The only negatives I can see would be that there was a bit of mold on the shower curtain and that the ac in the lobby was broken when we arrived. Not big deals at all but they were the only negatives that we found..So if you want a great deal then def consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: sasnj
Reviews.Content: this hotel was absolutly disgusting! i bought a brand new truck before going to this hotel and theyre valet dented the rear end of it. as we proceeded to check out of hotel we noticed the damage, filled out claim with hotel and hotel said they would take care of damage. a month and a half later they call and tell us they arent covering the damage. this hotel didnt even have the decency to cover a 200.00 dollar estimate and took them forever to return our phone calls. this hotel didnt even have any resteraunts! i will never ever send any of my friends or any one i know to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better price!”
Reviews.Author: Kbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 5/30-6/1 for a baseball getaway weekend with several other couples. We were the only couple staying here, the rest stayed at other inner harbor area hotels. Of 6 couples we had the lowest rate for the weekend. I booked through a website I was unfamiliar with, but called the hotel directly afterwards to verify my rate & reservation which put my mind at ease. Check in was easy. We arrived early - around 1230pm (checkin is 4pm) but they had our room ready. Front desk staff was very friendly as was the bell boy. Our room was right outside the elevators - however I never heard any elevator or hallway noise - very convenient. Our room was on the 4th floor and faced the direction of the harbor. The hotel is located 1 block from it - very convenient for us. Included was a daily paper & hot breakfast on the top floor. The breakfast consisted of breads & pastries, coffee & juices, eggs, sausage, pancakes, and more I can't remember. Our room was clean and typical size. Desk, chair, TV stand, end tables. There was a bar sink & locked mini bar, bottled water on the counter which also was included. The shower pressure was really good. Ample closet space. Our room was made up for us sometime while we were gone. The only thing to note is that you could hear street noise. This didn't bother us but if you're a light sleeper you want to know this. Checkout - again, super easy. My expectations were exceeded. For the right price I would definitely stay here again. Compared to the other area hotel rates our weekend, this was a gem of a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Creepy”
Reviews.Author: sash813
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a creepy hotel this was! Safty: First you walk up and the front window has been shattered, which was hopefully caused by a rock and not a bullet, but either way made me question the safety of the place. Food: There is no restaraunt and no vending machines so if you want to eat you either have to walk around the block to Seven-11 or McDonalds or eat a $3 can of Pringles out of the mini bar (the mini snack can, not the normal one). Room: The room was too small to turn around in, I couldn't even open the drawers of the dresser to put my clothes away (but on second thought, I guess that's a good thing since it didn't seem like the cleanest piece of furniture in the room) The hotel itself was pretty quiet, but the ceiling in my room creaked whenever someone in the room above me would walk around ... not cool. Hotel: The elevators are slow and loud and don't seem very safe. Internet access, they charge you for it ... enough said. Lastly, what's with the magic theme? I don't get it and it contributes extra creepiness to the atmosphere. In summary , this place was so bad that I wanted to check out after the first night, but they told me that I would be charged for checking out before my scheduled departure date. Nice. Thanks Brookshire ... Smell ya later! Tips: For a few extra bucks, I recommend the Springhill or the Residence Inn (both Marriott) or for about the same price the Tremont Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: queenlump
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire Suites absolutely exceeded my expectations for a last minute booking. Check in was easy although our room was not ready till mid afternoon.
