No problem there, they set us up with our package immediately and we were able to go directly to the Baltimore Aquarium (be sure to see the dolphin show and the 4D show, truly worth the extra 3-4$per person extra per show).Upon leaving the hotel we were only one block from the harbor and two blocks over from the Aquarium. Location was perfect for fun and shopping. Breakfast was included with our package and it wasn't just coffee and fruit...It WAS eggs, bacon, sausage,cereal, fresh fruit and french toast...a great way to start the day. Internet access in room or in the Cloud Club (top floor). They also have a small gym where my daughter was able to run her 5 miles without getting lost in the city.Monday evening we found ourselves in the Cloud Club for a free (yes free) cocktail party with local wines and beer as well as cheese,crackers and fresh fruit...and a nice way to end the day. The room was exactly what they said it was...spacious and clean and I would definitely go back...For 2 night and 3 adults, breakfast, cocktail party, and aquarium passes it came to $600 (including taxes and and all the other charges the government adds to your vacaton).We had the Harbor Magic package and it was easy to book everything on line right at the hotel web site...Don't forget to get your free Oceanoply game before you check out! Parking is expensive but not a bad as NYC. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: JKWMinnesota
Reviews.Content: It started with the walk across the street from the parking ramp- The crosswalk means nothing to the drivers and there is no skyway - so put on your helmets, elbow pads, and running shoes! There is the hidden charge called a "destination fee" which should just be included in the price to begin with. I went through Priceline thinking everything was paid for. Just add the $10 to the room!!! People will be a lot happier just thinking the paper, breakfast, and water is free. The lobby was nice, and gives the illusion of a 3star hotel, but the halls had such a stink I had to hold my breath getting off the elevator. (I'm not exaggerating) It smelled like someone peed in a flower garden after eating asparagus. There were also stains in the carpet all over the halls. (coincidence?) The room was half new and half falling apart. I did like that it had two rooms, with the bedroom having a door. The front desk called us after being in our room an hour asking how things were. We thought it was a bit intrusive, making us feel uncomfortable and put on the spot. Maybe if it seemed more genuine instead of obviously being read from a script it wouldn't have been so.....well,...creepy. When I called down later to order room service I was put on hold for several minutes and then told to call the restaurant directly. Then the restaurant took their turn in making us feel unwanted. Walking around the block in the morning was not pleasant. Oh, and $42 to release our car from the parking ramp!! That is not a typo. $42. Leave the ramp before dawn and you might save half. The other 6 hotels we stayed at on our trip were superb, and far less costly. Personally, the Marriott chain has won my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: strippel
Reviews.Content: i was concerned when I looked at reviews from last year. More recent ones were more complimentary. I had a good stay at the Brookshire. Nothing spectacular, but checkin was easy (booked through Hotwire). Room was clean and comfortable. The complimantary breakfast had a wide selection, and was warm. The wine and beer tasting was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: gee_gee97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. Only about a 3 minute walk to the Inner Harbor. We had a very pleasant experience. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly. When we had a problem the hotel was immediate in fixing it. Overall, our weekend trip was terrific. Hotel provides hot breakfast in the morning which was very good. Mon-Fri they have a social hour in the Cloud Club and offer drinks and snacks that are complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Good Baltimore Experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeIsh
Reviews.Content: Brookshire suites offered my girlfriend and I a very good deal on seeing the inner harbor for the weekend. The rooms are spacious and clean. We had a sperate "living room" and a bedroom. I feel for the price we paid ($115/night), you can't beat it. This included our VIP tickets to the aquarium, which considering the lines outside the aquarium, (even in feb) immediate entry was clutch. They had a great little wine and micro brew tasting on friday night. Along with cheeses crackers, grapes, chips/salsa, and my fav...the homemade old bay potatoe chips. The beers are full bottles and they give you full glasses of wine...pretty uncommon for a tasting. Most importantly, they do not care how many "samples" you take. I am proud to say I downed 6 microbrews in an hour. The hotel is 2 blocks form the inner harbor and I had no trouble getting anywhere. The staff was pleasant and the breakfast buffet was more then ample...along with an exceltn view. If I were staying in Baltimore again, I would definitely stay at Brookshire.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: seahills
Reviews.Content: Booked this thru Expedia with a stay 2 nights, 3rd free. The first thing I noticed about this place was how friendly everyone was - from the doorman to the front desk staff, to the housekeeping and maintenance staff - everyone had a smile. My room was ready and clean when I arrived at 4:30pm. Housekeeping was good. Room had a minibar and comfortable bed. There were helpful tourist guides in the room and good guides on the TV. Keep in mind there is a 9.95 destination fee but you get a lot for that including internet access via ethernet (they supply cat5) shuttle services, USA Today, and more... I ate the breakfast every morning. Even as late as 9:30am the above average free breakfast was good and fresh. I didn't buy a package but decided to go to the aquarium and bought my tickets from the hotel where I got the corporate ticket (meaning you can enter the Aquarium at any time - no waiting for the incremental entrance). I thought it was very conveniently situated - one block from inner harbor where there's so much to do, a few blocks from light rail, and about a mile from Mt Vernon - where I walked nearly every day. The room was a tad bit small and did get pretty warm so I had to open windows to get cooler air circulating. It was a bit noisy outside but that's what you'd expect being downtown - it didn't bother me. I hope to come back in spring and see no reason not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay for a visit to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Missjra717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the New Year's Eve package at the Brookshire. This was our second trip to the harbor. Previously, we stayed at the Hyatt. There were a few things that I would recommend for improvement. They have no onsite self-park. You can pay $29 a night for valet. There is a self-park next door that you can use. Our room was not ready when we arrived at four for check in, as they told us "house keeping was a little behind". The person in charge of housekeeping walked by and mumbled "its gonna be a while." we left our cell phone number, and they did call within the hour. Luckily, we were just next door at the Gallery mall. The room was clean when we arrived, however the next day housekeeping did not do a very thorough job. The rug seemed to not have been vacuumed and there were some crumbs on the counter. Even though they were our own, it would have been comforting to think they were doing a thorough cleaning job all the time. One other thing that they might want to do something about is the keeping an eye on the people who linger around the property. Several times when we were leaving, we were approached by individuals asking for money. It became a little uncomfortable after the second time. Despite the things I mentioned above, if you can get a good rate or package, it is a good place to stay when visiting the Inner Harbor. Our room was very large, with a bedroom and living room. The breakfast buffet was very good. They have both cold and hot items. The staff was on top of the clean up as well. They seem to go out of their way to be sure everyone was comfortable and had a place to sit and eat. The night reception was limited in food providing crackers and cheese, but was abundant in local wine and beer. The location may be the best feature of this hotel. It is within walking distance of all the local attractions. We were even able to walk to Fells Point and Little Italy. I would stay here again on my next trip to Baltimore. Also, if you have pets, they are pet friendly for an additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about walking to EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: FourHolmes
Reviews.Content: We booked online and got a great rate for the "down under" package to stay at this hotel and go to the aquarium. The Inner Harbor is great! What a happening place. Our family included myself, my husband and our two sons age 15 and 10. My 15 year old took his skateboard and found many spots to board. We also got an "Oceanopoly" game that came with the package to play during our down time in the hotel. The hotel room was spacious and clean with two TVs and a separate bedroom (always a plus with teenagers) Friday night we went to the Cloud Club reception that had free wine, beer and cheese and crackers. We met some nice people from all over! But even better was the hot buffet breakfast both Saturday and Sunday morning. Eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, potatoes and all kinds of cereals and muffins and fruit. Delicious! The hotel could use some updating (the carpets are rather worn) and if someone could do something about the clunking manhole cover out front it would quiet the place a bit. But you are right in the thick of inner harbor; so don't expect much quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ellano
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for two days, just before the thnxgiving and the hotel was very empty. they gave us a very nice room on the 11th floor. very friendly staff. the room had two separate sections, one living room and one bedroom, separated by a wall, and tv in each room. hotel is one block from the inner-harbor and it was excellent. Breakfast is not included, we purchased when we booked the room. breakfast was not the best breakfast I had but its OK. Vale parking costs $32 per nite, but there are multiple parking garages next to the hotel. We paid $36 for two nites parking. Overall, I loved the hotel, and would love to stay there again. If the price is right, this hotel will be my first choice in baltimore..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Zinfandel50
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at different hotels in the Inner Harbor but this is one of the best hotels in Baltimore for the price. Check in was efficient and friendly and were we pleasantly suprised at the room itself. The decor has clearly been upgraded (per the management's posting on this site) and the room was immaculate. A few minutes into our stay, Andrea called up to see if everything was okay with our room. I am usually an early riser and rarely sleep past 7am. However, even with the street below us on a busy Monday morning, it was quiet on our floor. Thanks to the extremely comfortable king-sized bed, I managed to sleep in until nearly 10am. Unfortunately, we missed breakfast by about 3 minutes but the wait staff encouraged us to have some coffee, fruit and eggs before they carted off the buffet. Check out was equally efficient and friendly. Kudos to the concierge for pointing us to Burkes for great sandwiches on Sunday evening. The Brookshire has a lot of nice touches - great lobby, complimentary water and breakfast - but the best part of it all is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: allismile0
Reviews.Content: I came up from DC with my girlfriend to celebrate my birthday and I can't express just how much we appreciated the wonderful hospitality and thoughtfulness that the entire staff displayed. They all went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable as well as to make my Birthday a special one! In general, the hospitality of the hotel with free shuttle service, wine/beer tasting, etc makes the price of the room well worth it. There were a few slight negatives about the room, but they would be nitpicking issues considering the price in comparison to other hotels in the area and their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: mj250
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for the distance from the Inner Harbor. One block away - that is a major plus! However the place needs some updating. It looks dated. Complimentary breakfast was good. Major problem: noise! You can hear everything! Other guests, elevator, street noise (police siren, fire truck, etc.). I think is has to do with the building being so old. BTW I was on the 8th floor and could hear street noise like it was outside my window.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fire59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brookshire for a weekend getaway. The front desk staff and everone else just had a great attitude. The room was clean and spacious and the breakfast was awesome as well. This was our 1st time to Baltimore and when we go back we will stay here again. The hotel made the whole trip worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dcaiani
Reviews.Content: We had a small group head down to Baltimore for a three night stay to catch a couple of ball games. We chose the Brookshire for its location and price. The hotel is one block from the inner harbor and a 5+ minute walk to Camden Yard. The cost of our stay was much cheaper than any of the neighboring hotels, plus the hotel offers free breakfast. Our room was larger than average, well appointed, and clean! The view was of the alley, but we pretty much were only there to sleep anyway. Breakfast was very good, although finding a seat was a bit of a chore during peak breakfast time as the hotel was sold out during our stay. The water bottles in the lobby was a nice touch as the days were hot. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The cocktail hour was another nice touch! Lastly the $10 per day upcharge was not disclosed to me as I booked my rooms over the telephone. If you book over the internet the charge is disclosed and you should not be surprised. I complained and they took my charge off my bill. The $10 covers the "free' breakfast", "free internet", and "free bottled water". While its not really free, it is a bargain at $10 a day. They should just bake it into the cost of the room rate rather than being sneaky about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: zekesidney
Reviews.Content: I booked our two-night stay at the Brookshire despite some mixed reviews posted on Trip Advisor. The hotel was close to the inner harbor and within walking distance of Camden Yards. We stayed in a standard 2 queen bed room. The room was smaller than what we are accustomed to, but wasn't a problem. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The only real problem we ran into was air conditioning. For some reason at night, the central AC didn't seem to work as well and the room got a bit stuffy. We mentioned this when we were checking out and the person deducted $50 for each night from our bill. The real surprise was the continental breakfast. It was by far the best complimentary continental breakfast we have ever had. Scrambled eggs, bacon, home fries, pancakes, bagels, breads, assorted ceral, fruit, juice and coffee. Just remember if you stay in Baltimore, parking is not cheap....$21 a day in the parking garage that we used adjacent to the hotel. For us, the Brookshire's location (one block from the Inner Harbor) and price (cheaper than many of the other hotels in the Inner Harbor area) made this a great choice for our stay in Baltimore. We would book a room there again if we visited the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: What stands out is the friendly staff. The rooms are a little outdated, but plenty of room and clean. It was quiet as well. Great value for being so close to the inner harbor which is a quick block walk away. We would consider staying here again! By the way, the $9.95 daily charge is clearly stated on the hotel website and check-in, so no surprises there.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and value”
Reviews.Author: sbharr
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Baltimore for hubby's b-day (he is a huge Orioles fan). Decided to stay at Brookshire for a change as we usually stay elsewhere. Very pleasantly surprised. Only one block from the Inner Harbor (if you stay in the front of the hotel, you have a nice view of it) and a short 10-15 minute walk to Camden Yards. Hotel staff were VERY pleasant and we were very impressed with the service there. Room was fine (a standard queen size bed room) and the included full breakfast made this a real deal. My husband loved it! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Only one small issue - we pre-booked (an pre-paid) through Orbitz. When we checked in, we were told we didn't owe anything because we pre-paid. We didn't charge anything to the room during our stay. The morning we went to check out, we had a bill for $20! When I asked what it was for, the said they had a $9.95 destination fee which covered a newspaper every day (we only got one on one day), bottled water in your room (we never touched it), the "free" internet service in your room (didn't bring a computer) and "complimentatry" shuttle service to their 2 sister hotels in the area (never used). We decided to let this go since our hotel rate with the included breakfast was such a good deal, but we were disappointed that this was not mentioned on Orbitz or by the front desk when we checked in. Particularly when they said we were paid in full when we checked in. If they had mentioned it during check-in, we would not have been surprised, and would have used the services offered.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: wiscvball
Reviews.Content: Brookshire Suites was a nice place to stay. The staff was very friendly, although check-in and check-out were very slow. We had two suites - one was the regular suite and one was an executive suite. The regular suite was smaller than your average suite, but the executive suite was large and had plenty of room. The rooms were clean, but needed some minor repairs - scuffs on the walls, frayed carpeting, etc. We parked across the street because the woman at the front desk said it would be cheaper, but we paid over $30 to self park for less than a day and valet would have been $25. The breakfast was very nice - something for everyone - pancakes, eggs, meat, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt. We booked the "Discover Down Under" Aquarium package through Orbitz, which includes two VIP (immediate entry) tickets to the aquarium. VIP tickets were great, because we didn't have to get to the aquarium at any special time, and when we got there, we just walked right in. Also be aware, other hotels offer express entry, but that is not the same thing as immediate entry. I would definitely recommend that you check around for rates. Our room rate through Orbitz was $159, whereas it would have been $239 if we had booked directly with the hotel. Just use the "check rates" button on tripadvisor.com, and you might get lucky like we did. I also have to mention the great customer service that we received via email before our trip. I sent email to harbormagic.com and all of my questions were answered, even after they knew that I had made my reservation through Orbitz. I can't say enough about how nice they were.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: Noland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slightly dated but very nice. It is close to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. The suites are big enough and the beds are excellent. There is street noise if you are on the first couple of floors. The free breakfast is good. Everyone in the hotel are friendly and nice. The price was in line or slightly better than the other hotels in the area. But BEWARE: at checkout, you will find a "Destination Fee" of $9.95 per day on your bill. When I inquired at the front desk about it, I was told the "Destination Fee" was for the complimentary bottled water in the rooms, the complimentary drinks at night and the complimentary breakfast. In Baltimore, complimentary comes at a price! You are not told about this when you reserve your room or when you register. Too bad this company resorts to hidden fees. I will not stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crunchy409
Reviews.Content: Besides some slight check in issues (originally given keys and directions to the wrong room), my fiancee enjoyed our one night stay in the Brookshire hotel. We visited over one weeked to see some sights in inner harbor. We booked the suite with the aquarium package. ROOM: The room was fine. As the agents will tell you on the phone, the ceilings are slightly lower than normal in the rooms but unless you are above 6' it shouldn't be a problem. Some scuff marks on the wall but well maintained. View was of the bulding next door, but you can't ask for much more in a city. The location is amazing- basically a part of inner harbor. There are a lot of parking lots around so don't feel like you must use their valet parking. We thoroughly enjoyed the included free breakfast- hot foods (sausage, french toast, egg) and plenty of pastries and cereals. The dining room is on the top floor, revealing a nice view of the harbor. Another great thing was their wine and beer testing. From 5:30-6:30 on most days they feature local beers and wines in the lobby with light snacks. I was expecting a tablespoon 'taste' of the product, but we got full glasses of wine and you could take a bottle of beer back to your room if you wanted to. Enjoyed our stay. Great location, nice staff, average rooms were fine. fairly good rate for its location

Reviews.Title: “it was just ok....inner harbor was nice”
Reviews.Author: brandysmom1214
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick weekend getaway with 2 other couples to see a concert in Rams head live..We booked thru internet and after all you helpful people telling me to keep my printout of my confirmation, i neede it.!!! The place needs an overhaul of redecorating and updating the rooms. Staff was helpful, but they royally messed up my reservations despite calling 2x to confirm them and having them call us as well, maybe better training of staff would help. $25. to valet your car is steep when there are so many parking garages surrounding the hotel. The water pressure is awesome in the shower... The free breakfast is very nice and has alot more variety then other hotels that offer this.. all in all, the room was clean, a bit musty, but needed updating, and watch for hidden fees, Checkout was very very slow, we waited on long line for 25 min, only 2 girls doing checkout... Inner harbor was soo pretty and clean, Philips Restaurant was delish, water taxi was cheap and fun, Fells point was quaint and fun too...we are going back in the summertime to enjoy the nitelife but i will book different hotel.. oh we saw Brooke from the Real World Denver check into the hotel that weekend...lol

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly good find”
Reviews.Author: JanetFincher
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a training and team-building exercise, and thought the hotel worked well as a small friendly gathering place with corporate meeting facilities. The location is a block from Baltimore's bustling tourist-friendly waterfront, so the location is good that way. For a family vacation, the suite would be nice because you get the living room, sleeper sofa, writing desk, wet bar, bedroom, big closet and a decent sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jerzeygirl80
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and accomidating staff. Willing to book tickets for lots of sites. Have shuttles to help you get to sites near other hotels, 5 owned by same company. We had a package it came with champagne, dinner with appetizers and desert. We had a great time. Breakfast was great every morning. They really seemed to work with the guests around, things for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Worse place I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: sumSedona
Reviews.Content: There were many errors made in my reservations, which was very frustrating. Our room accommodations ended up not being what was promised. After leaving the hotel, I was able to remedy some of the errors in charges with lots of persistence. The roll-away beds were unbelievably shabby and uncomfortable. The rooms were also very old and dirty. The place needs updating. Upon checkout, there were "hidden" charges for each night's stay that people should be aware of. Although the price is better than other places that I checked, I would not stay here again. I also would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would have liked it more if not for a few things”
Reviews.Author: IcameIsaw
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults + 1 kid under 5) Spent $149.99+tax (almost $25) for a suite (bedroom w/ queen-size bed + additional room w/ sofa-type-bed). The price included free breakfast (very good) and free snacks/drinks in the evening (didn't get to try due to sightseeing plans). The bedroom had a partial view of the waterfront (if one looked at a 90 degrees angle outside the window). The location was very convenient (2 blocks from waterfront area). Valet parking was $25 so decided to park in an adjacent garage for $12 per day (great deal if you don't need to use the car, unfortunately we had to for dinner). Checkout time was 12:00 noon which gave plenty of time to sleep in longer. Now for the gripes: Bedroom was small as was the bathroom. Bedroom had a queensized bed which was cramped for 2 adults and 1 kid. Rooms had low ceiling so felt a bit claustrophobic. Rooms looked old even though I had read somewhere that the hotel was renovated in last 6-8 years. Staff was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with Bite a hit with the kids!!”
Reviews.Author: mitchvb
Reviews.Content: I loved the character breakfast on Saturday Morning. The kids absolutely loved " Mr. Bite"!!!! I didn't think I would be able to take them anywhere but Disney World, but with Mr. Bite there we can vacation in Baltimore instead! Hey, its cheaper and we had a really great stay at the Brookshire Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: raleighnclady
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are really great. I was really impressed with everyone. Also, I had such a blast at The Brew at the Brook. I wouldn't think Baltimore when I think Oktoberfest, but I do now.

Reviews.Title: “Oktoberfest was a BLAST!”
Reviews.Author: KerinPerez
Reviews.Content: Oktoberfest at the Brookshire Suites was a BLAST. I would totally recommend this hotel to friends and family. The staff was super nice and provided a fun and relaxing atmosphere. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Love”
Reviews.Author: Sampo8983
Reviews.Content: The Romance package was super! I have gotten similar packages at other hotels but this one was extra special and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Stoffers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in mid September and my stay could not have been better. The location was ideal and Jill was so helpful in suggesting restaurants and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Brookshire Suites”
Reviews.Author: caredo323
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Brookshire with some girlfriends a couple of weeks ago and we loved it! The experience specialist, Jill, was totally helpful and able to recommend some cool local hang outs to us, and we loved the Oktoberfest celebration!

Reviews.Title: “The Brew at the Brook, great fun!”
Reviews.Author: niejad
Reviews.Content: The Brew at the Brook Oktoberfest activity was a great time! My girlfriends and I stayed at the Brookshire Suites and truly enjoyed the complimentary beer, wine and snacks at the activity. Jill was very helpful in making us feel comfortable and entertained. A plus to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: luvvacay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in mid-October 2006. I was in Baltimore for a conference that was being held at a different hotel. The location of the Brookshire is great -- very close to the Inner Harbor, restaurants, shopping, activities, etc. The customer service at this hotel was outstanding. The room I had was a suite with a living area and a separate bedroom. The room was a little "worn around the edges", but overall it was clean and comfortable with some unique modern touches. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown Baltimore, so there is street noise that you can hear in your room, but I didn't think it was too loud and it didn't keep me from having a good night's sleep. The breakfast buffet (which is included with your stay) was good -- there was a good selection of items to choose from. Overall, for the price I paid, I was very satisfied with this hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: digtravel
Reviews.Content: After I booked this hotel through Hotwire, I began to worry based on reviews found here. Admittidly, I got a fantastic deal and maybe that colored my impression of this place, but I could not be happier with my stay at the Brookshire. The staff was attentive and helpful, and very very friendly. The room was clean and pleasant, we were on the 11th floor and had a nice view of the harbor. We arrived right on time for te cocktail hour and even won a box of Godiva chocolate. I enjoyed the cocktail hour, the complimentary full hot breakfast, the wifi and the minibar. Sure, some aspects of the room could have used a little updating, but I have found this to be true in many hotels. Certainly nothing was dirty or not servicable. I am sorry I wasn't there on a Wed. to take advantage of the Crab Feast. Overall I would strongly reccommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay right in the heart of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Not a magical experience whatsoever...”
Reviews.Author: BookerT1969
Reviews.Content: The Brookshire is conveniently located near the Inner Harbor, but other than that the Brookshire has nothing else going for it. The room we stayed in was located on the 4th floor with a view of the building next door where pigeons had their way with the rooftops and brick walls – you get the idea. So the view was absolutely terrible and the worst I have ever had – of course none of the staff informed me of this when I booked the room. We stayed for 3 nights and within about 10 minutes of walking in the room we quickly discovered that this was not what we had wanted or had expected. The following is a breakdown of ‘all of the problems we found: the heating and cooling system within the room did not work (maintenance took a look at it 3 times before it worked – the system is completely antiquated and needs to be replaced); the carpet was dirty and had cigarette burns on it; the walls were completely dirty (scuff marks and muck all of them – we were afraid to touch them); the king size bed blanket had a hole in it; there were very few towels to speak of with – holes in a couple and they also smelled funny; the bathroom floor was completely dirty with paint spray all over the place; the shower drain did not work (maintenance was called up and after 3 attempts to fix the problem, you still stood in about 4 inches of water when bathing – clean your feet after each shower); when booking the room we requested a microwave and a refrigerator – we didn’t get either (the 2nd night we finally got the fridge, but never did get our microwave); the breakfast was just as everything with the hotel, nothing special. They had plenty of items to choose from, but the items had zero flavor and were cold every morning. The television systems for On-Demand movies were not functioning, which is a bummer when you want to spend some quality time with your special someone. There is absolutely nothing “Magical” about this hotel and turned out to be the Hotel of disappointments. They did do something unexpected, which was give us a $50 credit off our bill but as everyone knows is too little to make up for the experience. I have stayed in Hotels that cost $80 per night versus the $180 spent per night rate at Brookshire and have had much better experiences – honestly I just don’t get it. As far as the staff goes, the only person in the entire hotel that had personality was the gentlemen that provided service during breakfast but other than that they we not the people that should work in a hotel that claims to be “Magical”. I regret choosing this hotel and would dissuade others to not stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice!”
Reviews.Author: AMB&JAS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on August 9th, 2006. It's a good choice for anyone who wishes to be near the Inner Harbor, yet wants to pay a reasonable room rate. The staff was friendly and helpful. The building was fine. Our room was clean and spacious, yet it needed new carpeting. The free breakfast was to start at 6:30 a.m., but that's when the staff just began to assemble it. By 7:00 a.m. it was ready, and it looked great with lots of variety. But I had to be somewhere at 7:30 so I had to rush a bit. The hotel doesn't have its own parking lot, but there are two public lots across the street. We will certainly stay here again, but I will insist on a room away from Lombard Street. Even during the night that street is noisy!
